title: Stone Installer - Fixer - Helper
description:
EDM is a worldwide leading group specialized in custom high-end marble supply and installation as well as project management.

EDM is the privileged partner of architect, interior designers and prestigious luxury brands with 15 branches around the globe, which includes EDM Canada.

Today, EDM Canada seeks to recruit a Stone Installer and apprentice/Helper to work on it projects alongside employees, each with more than 30 years of experience in marble setting, in the most luxurious hotels, boutiques and private residences around the world.

EDM Specializes in interior stone work, as well as façade work.

The Stone Installer Helper will assist the Stone Installer with the following responsibilities:

  • Prepare to lay marbles (or other natural stones)
  • Repair or maintain stone floors, walls, ceilings in high end residential & retail construction
  • Assist in measurements, cutting stone, mixing Dry Pack or Thinset, grouting, protect and clean stone
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • Pay close attention to detail, able to follow instructions
  • Passion and desire to learn stone craftsman ship
  • Self-motivated with strong work ethic
  • Ability to communicate in French is an asset

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities:

  • Physically demanding, handling heavy loads, bending, crouching, kneeling, lift up to 60 lbs

Salary negotiable based on experience

How to Apply:
Please forward your cover letter and resume by email with the heading "Helper – Stone Installer" in the subject line in order to be considered for the position. Please apply by email only. We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however, only the candidates selected for interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Temporary, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$30.00 per hour

Experience:

  • Stone installation: 1 year (Required)

Location:

  • Greater Toronto Area, ON (Preferred)

Licence:

  • Driving (Required)

Language:

  • French (Preferred)

title: Carpenter
description:
PattyMac Inc. has over 15 years’ experience as builders of luxury homes, cottages and boathouses in Muskoka, and we stand behind every one of them. At PattyMac we are looking for enthusiastic people to join our hard-working team. If you are looking for a company that provides room for growth and positive work environment, we’d love to hear from you!

We are seeking for a Carpenter, who enjoys working outside, has strong work ethics, good teamwork skills and leadership experience.

Carpenter Responsibilities:

• Building foundations, installing floor beams, laying sub-flooring and installing walls and roofing systems

• Fitting and installing trim, doors, stairs, moulding and hardware

• Measuring, cutting and joining materials made of wood or wood substitutes

• Repairing and renovating wooden structures

• Reading and interpreting blueprints, drawings and sketches

• Inside finishing

Carpenter Requirements:

• Operate a variety of hand and power tools of all types: hammer, drills, chainsaws, skill saws, jack jammer * Install of windows & doors, roof trusses, sheathing, hardware,

• Erect scaffolding and ladders working at heights training a requirement

• Ability to work independently

• Experience working in a physical environment. Must be able to lift 80lbs and work outdoors in all weather conditions

• Valid Ontario driver’s license, as well as transportation to work.

• Minimum 2 years of experience required

Job Type: Full-Time Position

Salary: $25.00 - $35.00 depending on experience

Location: Muskoka Region

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $25.00-$30.00 per hour

title: Carpenter - Ottawa
description:
Job Title: Carpenter

Company: Tamarack Developments

Reports to: Site Superintendent

Location: Ottawa, Ontario

 

Tamarack Developments

Tamarack Homes has a legacy of home-building in Ottawa that dates back to the 1940s when Harold Taggart began building homes for returning war veterans. Since then we have built hundreds of homes in communities across the Ottawa and Kingston regions. We take pride in quality workmanship and creating homes that are more than just houses. The communities we construct are built on excellence and attention to detail. Today, Tamarack Homes continues to be one of the most sought-after home builders in eastern Ontario.

 

We are currently looking for Carpenters for each of the following sites:

- Westwood/Edenwylde (Kanata/Stittsville)

- Cardinal Creek (Orleans)

- Meadows (Barrhaven)

- Findlay Creek (Ottawa South)

 

Work Description

The Carpenter is responsible for the overall delivery of repair work inside Tamarack home building projects.

 

Major Responsibilities:

Carpenter

  • Perform repairs to the internal and external structure while ensuring the buildings are safe.
  • Install structures and fixtures, such as windows, frames, hanging doors and closets, trim or hardware, using carpenter's hand and power tools.
  • Installation of dry-wall, and minor repairs of drywall after home completion should there be a deficiency.
  • Fill cracks and other defects in plaster or plasterboard and sand patch, using patching plaster, trowel, and sanding tool.
  • Sanding surfaces, taping and preparing the home prior to the trades coming in for installation
  • Repair any issues after the trades have been in the homes.
  • Caulk tiles and fixtures, and repair minor deficiencies as required.
  • Recognize problems and deficiencies and provide recommendations to supervisors on how to fix issues, execute and perform repairs.
  • When the trade comes back to repair something meets them on site and oversee their work. While also bringing it to the attention of the Finishing Foreman/ Site Superintendent.
  • Prepare and install cosmetic wood working repairs and replacements.
  • Operate and maintain carpentry tools and equipment in a safe and efficient manner.
  • Work with Finishing Foreman and Site Superintendent to order supplies as they are required during the building phases.
  • Repair all flooring issues, creaking or cracking. Removing and replacing floor pieces as required.
  • Prepare houses for customer move in; ensuring they are ready for delivery.
  • Fix home issues after homeowner move in as per the Home Inspectors and Service Technician's reports on an as-needed basis.
  • Complete checklists to ensure accurate and detailed completion of carpentry duties prior to handover.
  • Perform other related duties, including minor duties of other trades where certification is not required, and the work does not exceed own limitations.
  • Any other duties as required.

 

Statement of Qualifications:
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Certificate of apprenticeship, carpenter. Red Seal is considered a strong asset.
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience as an interior finishing carpenter or performing interior finishing duties.
  • Physically fitness and manual dexterity are required.
  • Quality orientation and attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in reading plans. Recognizing potential discrepancies or errors.
  • Experience in a high-volume home building environment is considered an asset.
  • Able to identify the source of a deficiency and under most circumstances, perform the repair necessary.
  • Knowledge and use of imperial and metric measurements. Strong mathematical reasoning.
  • Ability to use power tools.
  • Demonstrated ability to assist and guide Labourers and Carpenters as needed.
  • Demonstrated critical analysis and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to independently coordinate several simultaneous tasks while maintaining a positive attitude and flexible work style.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate verbally and in writing in English.
  • Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to complete tasks independently as per the prescribed schedule/timelines.
  • Ability to prioritize tasks based on various schedules (trades, closing, etc).
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work well independently, and a willingness to learn.
  • Demonstrated strong customer service and interpersonal skills in dealing with colleagues, trades, and potentially homeowners.

 

Physical/Sensory Effort/Work Environment

  • Providing service to several people or departments, working under many simultaneous deadlines
  • Sitting or Standing for long periods of time at workstation
  • Heavy manual labor, requires ability to climb ladders, push, pull, lift, carry and manipulate objects of up to 80 lbs.
  • Use of Personal Protection Equipment will be required (e.g. hard-hat, safety boots, etc.)
  • Hazards associated with the construction industry.

 

Application
All candidates are asked to apply via the following link: https://taggartgroup.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=255&source=aWQ9MTk%3D

Any questions regarding the position can be directed to careers@taggart.ca. We thank all candidates for their interest, however only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

For more information on our company, please visit: http://www.taggartgroup.ca.

 

Accommodation
The Taggart Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, physical or mental handicap, or financial ability.


In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with a Disabilities Act, we’re committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. If you require accommodation or special assistance, please send an email to hr@taggart.ca with your request. Your information will be treated as confidential.

title: Drywall Installer (Gill Drywall Ltd.)
description:
Vacancies:

2

 

Wages:

$27.50 per hour

 

Employment Term:

Fulltime, 30-40 hours a week

Must be available to work early morning, during the daytime, evening, night and on the weekend.

Flexible/part-time work is also available

Relocation Bonus:

We offer a $1500 relocation bonus after three months of continuous full-time work with us

 

Experience:

Experience is an asset

 

Education:

No degree, certificate, or diploma

 

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities

Handling heavy loads, Up to 23 kg (50lbs)

Walking, Bending, Crouching, Kneeling, Physically demanding, Standing for extended periods

Work at heights, on scaffolding or swing stage, Noisy, Dusty, Hot, Cold temperature

 

Work Location Information

Various locations, depending on the project

 

Work Setting

Residential

 

Primary duties of as drywall installer are, but not limited to:

  • Measure, cut, fit and install drywall sheets
  • Tape over joints using the taping machine and embed tape in compound
  • Apply successive coats of compound and sand seams and joints
  • Position and secure and sheets to metal or wooden studs or joists
  • Fill joints, nail indentation, holes, and cracks with joint compound using trowel and knife
  • Smooth out the excess compound and allow the coat to dry

 

 

Please Apply By:

 

Mail:

Gill Drywall Ltd.

14987 76A Ave.

Surrey, BC V3S 5P1

 

Email:   gilldrywallltd@gmail.com

title: Lead Hand (Labourers/Carpenters/Apprentices)
description:
• Don't miss this opportunity to take on a pivotal role with a rapidly growing organization
  • Receive extensive benefits and a highly competitive salary of $18-$36+ based on skills and experience
  • Enjoy working in a collaborative and supportive team environment

About Tribuild Contracting

Tribuild Contracting took on its first construction management project, a commercial office interior in downtown Calgary, in the year 1982. Thanks to our high-quality work and excellent customer service we have grown since then into an industry leader with a diverse group of clients including corporate offices, government buildings, and critical facilities. At Tribuild Contracting, we pride ourselves on our services that go above and beyond the normal offerings of our competitors by working closely with our clients to ensure that any disruption that could arise from working in an occupied space is either minimized or taken away completely. 

At Tribuild Contracting, we're equally passionate about the individuals that make up our staff and drive the success of our organization. Our excellent work-life balance and our culture are underpinned by our values of integrity, loyalty, accountability, and balance. Diversity and the different opinions, ideas, viewpoints, and opportunities it generates is also hugely important to us which is why our workforce is more diverse than the Alberta average and its why we're striving to increase the diversity of our organization at all levels.  

For more information, please visit our website.

About the Opportunity 

Currently, Tribuild Contracting is looking for a Lead Hand to work on-site in Winnipeg, MB on a full-time basis. Journeyperson carpenters, labourers, and apprentices are all welcome to apply. 

As our new Lead Hand, you'll train under our Site Supervisor to support work on our projects that focus on critical facilities, specifically regarding chiller plants. You'll work to ensure that our client's projects are built to the highest quality standards and are completed both on time and within budget. You will help conduct safety evaluations, maintain scheduling, track and communicate progress back to the project team and client, while managing the expectations for our various sub-trades.

In order to qualify for this role, you must be willing to learn, with previous experience working with tools; experience in commercial/industrial construction, specifically in critical facilities, is an asset.

As our ideal candidate, you'll be a highly motivated individual with excellent communication skills, the ability to ask relevant questions while taking direction, and an eagerness to learn and train under the Site Supervisor. You are detail-oriented, can multitask, and have pride in what you do. Your passion, your desire to continuously learn and grow, and your ability to build quality relationships with both colleagues and clients will set an example for those working with you and foster a positive and fun working environment.  

Above all, you'll be a dedicated construction professional that is passionate about fostering a safe and productive work site. 

About the Benefits

In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be awarded with highly competitive compensation from $18-$36+/hr based on skills and qualifications along with a wide host of benefits including:

  • Starting wage for General Labourers/Carpenter Helpers is $18/hr.
  • Starting wage for Apprentices at $23.40/hr, dependent on the year of studies.
  • Starting wage for Journeyman Carpenters/Lead Hand at $36/hr.
  • Per diem, accommodations, mileage reimbursement and overtime pay available when travelling.  
  • Full benefits offered through Canada Life.
  • RRSP matching. 
  • Flexible shifts so that you don't miss important moments with your family.
  • A Kindle Fire tablet for both work and personal use.
  • An annual Costco membership.
  • A company cellphone. 
  • Covered mileage as per Canadian standards. 
  • Full support for additional education and training. 
  • Opportunities to customize your role or learn skills outside of your traditional field. 
  • An annual corporate family holiday party with special guests and gifts for kids. 
  • Huge opportunities for career progression - we're rapidly growing and we want our team to grow with us.

But that's not all, upon joining Tribuild Contracting, you'll be welcomed into a family team environment where we take pride in the work that we do but also deliver our product as friends and family. We're passionate about diversity in our organization which is why we invite and encourage applications from individuals that self identify as a member of an equity-seeking group such as female, trans* (trans, transgender, transsexual, genderqueer, two-spirit, transwoman, transman), a visible minority or racialized people, aboriginal or indigenous people, people with a disability, lesbian, gay, or bisexual.  

For the safety and well-being of our clients and employees, we require proof of COVID-19 vaccination before commencing employment. Accommodations will be made for those exempt from the COVID-19 vaccination, based on grounds protected by relevant human rights law.
 
Don't miss this unique opportunity to take on an exciting safety role with a rapidly growing organization - Apply Below!

title: Carpenter
description:
Sibwest Inc., with the head office located at 1495 Bonhill Rd., Unit#12, Mississauga, ON L5T 1M2, has translated their restoration experience into a business that focuses on concrete – new concrete works and restorations. Sibwest’s experience, working for well-established construction companies in the GTA, has told them that there is another approach – «be customer focused».

In addition to providing concrete forming and restoration services for large-scale industrial and commercial construction projects across the GTA, Sibwest is strengthening its expertise in residential and midrise construction, providing cost effective advice to our clients. We build positive relationships that provide future opportunities – client references and repeat business.

THE POSITION:

We are now looking for two skilled, experienced, and hard-working Carpenters to join our team of talented individuals.

The candidates will be responsible for the following:

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Erect and install scaffolding, falsework and other working platforms
  • Prepare layouts in conformance to building codes, using measuring tools
  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings and sketches to determine specifications and calculate requirements
  • Measure, cut, shape, assemble and join materials made of wood, wood substitutes, lightweight steel and other materials
  • Build foundations, install floor beams, lay subflooring and erect walls and roof systems

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Minimum 7 months of experience as a carpenter
  • Secondary school diploma. Post-secondary education is an asset
  • Good English language skills (written and oral)
  • Familiarity with workplace safety, safe lifting and handling procedures

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:

  • Full-time, permanent position consisting of at least 35 weekly work hours
  • The remuneration will be set at CAD$26.10 per hour
  • Occasional overtime may be required for meeting critical deadlines. Overtime pay will apply after 44 hours of work per week and will be remunerated at one and a half times the regular pay rate
  • Address: 1495 Bonhill Rd., Unit#12, Mississauga, ON L5T 1M2
  • Work location: various customers’ sites around GTA and Ontario
  • Great environment with professional individual approach and friendly atmosphere

How to apply:

Please apply by email to sibwest.hires@gmail.com with resume and cover letter. Kindly put “Carpenter” in the subject line. Do not contact the office directly, as resumes and cover letters submitted will be assessed by our management before interviews are scheduled.

Sibwest Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As such, we welcome all applications from all qualified candidates. However, please note that only those who meet the requirements of the position will be contacted for an interview.

Visit our website https://www.sibwest.ca/  to get more information about our company.

title: Drywall Finisher/painter
company: Handyman Connection of Metro Vancouver, BC
description:
To meet the demands of our rapidly growing base of satisfied customers, Handyman Connection of Metro Vancouver, BC is seeking an experienced Drywall Finisher.  This skilled craftsman would ideally have a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work.  Our customers love us!  We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

 

What You Will Receive

  • Receiving constant leads that can be scheduled based on your availability
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers

Responsibilities

 

The Drywall Finisher performs and coordinates the cutting, taping, sanding and installation of drywall during the construction, remodeling or repair in a residential and light commercial setting. The candidate must be proficient working with all drywall hand tools, mechanical tools required to complete their work. You must have experience as a Drywall Finisher, and you must have a positive attitude.

 

·        Ability to texture and refinish plaster services

·        Ability and willing to work on new walls and ceilings, and repair existing walls.

·        Ability to determine and clearly identify proper materials and material quantities for new and existing projects.

·        Evaluate customer requests, price projects, troubleshoot customer issues, and present a description of a work order to a customer.

 

Requirements

 

·        Must have current Driver's License and submit to a background check

·        Must have tools, vehicle and good references

·        Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades

·        Independent Contractors must carry liability insurance and workers comp

·        Must pass screening process

·        Must have a smart phone and access to the internet

 

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.

Check out our website at: www.handymanconnection.com

title: Drywall/Painter
description:
First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Drywall / Painter to help rebuild homes and businesses for our residential and commercial customers after fire or flood emergencies. Do you have previous experience in restoration or construction? Are you looking to build a successful career while rebuilding lives? If so, keep reading!

Our experienced Drywall / Painter earns a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

Position Summary:


The Drywall / Painter has knowledge of materials, methods and the tools involved in the construction or repair of houses, buildings, or other structures and builds, applies, or fastens interior and exterior wallboards or wall coverings in residential, commercial, and other structures.

Responsibilities:

  • Measures and installs drywall panels to accommodate electrical outlets, air-conditioning units, and plumbing.
  • Possesses skills with power and non-power tools to saw, drill, or cut holes in panels.
  • Installs blanket insulation between studs and tacks plastic moisture barrier over insulation.
  • Removes plaster, drywall, or paneling, using crowbar and hammer.
  • Assembles and installs metal framing and decorative trim for windows, doorways, and vents.
  • Reads blueprints and other specifications to determine method of installation, work procedures, and material and tool requirements.
  • Lays out reference lines and points, computing position of framing and marking position.
  • Installs horizontal and vertical metal or wooden studs for attachment of wallboard on interior walls.
  • Estimates the number of materials needed to complete a job and the length of time needed to complete the job.

Additional Requirements

  • Minimum 1 year of drywall and painting experience.
  • Courses or certifications from trade schools or equivalent experience.
  • Knowledge of materials, methods, and the tools involved in the construction or repair of houses, buildings, or other structures
  • Ability to pass a background check
  • Valid drivers' license
  • Availability for scheduled on-call and after-hour shifts

Are you able to work independently? Do you have excellent communication and interpersonal skills? Can you work collaboratively with construction crews? Are you service-oriented? Is safety important to you? Do you project a professional appearance and attitude? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Framer / Drywaller
description:
Who are we?

Versatility Staffing Inc is an experienced staffing agency with a proven track record. We help candidates and employers find their match within their field of expertise. We are a Toronto-based company. Since 2015, we have successfully served over hundreds of clients across Canada. Proving our forte into the recruitment industry, now we aim to staff the world with talented candidates. The hiring process is always a tough nut to crack until you find the right candidate for your business. Like you, we also believe in qualitative work, and time is essential to us. So, we invest our time in those candidates who suit your company and raise your business standards higher.

Job Description

Our client is looking for a Front Server for their Indian restaurant located in Pickering. Preference for someone with experience in an Indian restaurant, as well as a smart serve certification.

Responsibilities:

  • Accurately measuring, cutting, and shaping lumber, wood, and other building materials.
  • Attaching building materials using screws, nuts, and bolts.
  • Erecting temporary structures such as scaffolds and hoists.
  • Performing repairs on existing framework structures that are damaged or structurally unsound.
  • Analyzing blueprints and drawings to determine the structural dimensions of the framework to be constructed.
  • Analyzing construction plans to identify potential structural problems.
  • Examining building materials to identify any defects.
  • Performing cleanups of job sites by clearing away all carpentry debris and waste.
  • Constructing wooden concrete forms to aid the construction team in erecting various concrete structures.

Requirements:

  • High school diploma or GED.
  • Associate's degree in carpentry or completion of a carpentry apprenticeship.
  • Bachelor's degree in construction is advantageous.
  • Sound knowledge of building codes and safety regulations.
  • Physical strength and stamina.
  • The ability to interpret blueprints.
  • The ability to safely use hand and power tools.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong organizational skills.
  • Effective communication skills.
  • Access to own transportation or public transportation.
  • Ability to work shifts any time of day.
  • Ability to work overtime if needed.
  • Ability to work independently and with a work crew.

title: Drywall installer and finisher (NOC 7284)
description:
Drywall installer and finisher (NOC 7284)

Cullum Drywall Systems Ltd

Location:       6027, 79 Avenue S.E. Suite 2145

Calgary, ABT2C 5P1

On the road job: Work locations may vary. Frequent or constant travel is required from the employee.

 Salary range: $27.28/hr. to $31.00/hr

 Vacancies: 5 vacancies

 Terms of employment: Permanent employment, Full time 40.00 hours / week

 Start date: As soon as possible

 Benefits: Medical benefits, Dental benefits, Vision care benefits start after 6 consecutive months of employment

 Employment conditions: Morning, Day, Evening, Weekend, Night

Job requirements

Languages: English

Education: Other trades certificate or diploma (4th Period Apprentice or Drywall Finisher Trade Certification) OR equivalent experience

Experience: minimum 4 years of experience

Own Tools/Equipment: Providing own steel-toed safety boots required. Providing own safety glasses, mask, hard hat and tools preferred, but not required.

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities: Hand-eye co-ordination, Repetitive tasks, Tight deadlines, Large workload, Work under pressure, Overtime required, Walking, Bending, crouching, kneeling, Manual dexterity, Physically demanding, Sound discrimination, Standing for extended periods

Work Location Information: Various locations

Work Site Environment: Dangerous, At heights, Noisy, Dusty, Hot, Cold/refrigerated, Outdoors

Personal Suitability: Dependability, Judgement, Client focus, Flexibility, Team player, Reliability

Additional Skills: Work at heights, on scaffolding or swing stages

Weight Handling: Up to 23 kg (50 lbs)

Work Setting: Industrial, Commercial

Drywall Installer and Finisher Specific Skills: Fabricate and install suspended metal ceiling grids and place in panels to form acoustical and coffered ceilings, Tape over joints using taping machine and embed tape in compound, Fill joints, nail indentations, holes and cracks with joint compound using trowel and broad knife, Cut and install metal corner beads to protect exterior corners, Position and secure sheets to metal or wooden studs or joists, Apply successive coats of compound and sand seams and joints, Measure, cut, fit and install drywall sheets, Smooth out excess compound and allow coat to dry

How to apply

Apply with a resume to: info@cullumdrywallsystems.com

Here is what you must include when submitting your application:

References attesting experience OR Proof of the requested certifications

title: Drywaller - Mud And Tape
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?
Join our NRB Modular Solutions team, where our people are driven by a desire to innovate, do social good, and move construction forward.

As a Drywaller, reporting to the Lead Hand, you will apply plasterboard to ceilings and interior walls of buildings. Mud and taping experience is a must. 

This position is safety sensitive and requires drug and alcohol testing as a condition of employment.

Your work will include:

  • Measures cutting lines on framing, drywall, and trim using the appropriate marking devices.
  • Tape, mud/fill and sand drywall ready for paint.
  • Trims rough edges from wallboard to maintain even joints.
  • Cuts openings into wall boards for electrical outlets, windows, vents, or fixtures using the appropriate cutting tools.
  • Plans out reference lines and points to properly position framing channels.
  • Removes plaster, drywall or paneling to replace or repair using a crowbar or a hammer.
  • Installs horizontal or vertical metal or wooden studs for attachment of wallboard on interior walls, using hand tools.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Extended health and dental benefits - no waiting period.
  • Award winning safety culture.
  • Work indoors year-round.
  • Whereas other companies are downsizing, we are growing!
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader.

Follow NRB Modular Solutions on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • An educational background equivalent to high school is required.
  • At least 2 years of experience with taping and mudding is ideal.
  • Perform heavy manual labor, including bending, stooping, reaching, carrying and lifting heavy objects weighing up to 45 lbs.
  • Requires manual dexterity of both hands and feet to perform activities such as lifting overhead, twisting and bending while lifting, climbing ladders and stairs while wearing protective equipment, and working in confined spaces, including repetitive arm motion below, at, and above shoulder level.
  • Walks approximately 2-4 kilometers per day on a variety of surfaces including, concrete and gravel.


Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: Drywall Installer
description:
Our corporate client is looking to hire foreign workers for the Drywall Installer position in a Construction Company based out in Toronto, Ontario, Canada:

We are currently looking for 10 talented Drywall Installers for a full-time position. The successful candidates will be working closely with dedicated staff and experts in the industry.

As Drywall Installer, you would be performing the following on a regular basis:

  • Measure, cut and fit drywall sheets for installation on walls and ceilings
  • Position and secure sheets to metal or wooden studs or joists
  • Cut and install metal corner beads to protect exterior corners
  • Tape over joints using taping machine
  • Apply successive coats of compound and sand seams and joints


Requirements


  • Good English language skills (written and oral)
  • High School Diploma
  • Ability to board 30-50 sheets a day
  • Ability to read simple building plans
  • Ability to estimate quantity of materials required for a project
  • Ability to measure and cut drywall to fit in specific spaces
  • Excellent hand-eye coordination
  • Ability to work independently and with a work crew
  • Ability to use hand tools and power tools required for installing drywall



Benefits


  • Support with getting Permanent Residency in Canada after 1 - 2 years of work will be provided.
  • Permanent, full-time position
  • Occasional overtime may be required with applicable overtime pay after 44 hours of work per week
  • Location of work: Client sites across GTA

Interested applicants should apply directly through this posting. Only those applicants selected to move forward in the recruitment process will be contacted.

Handyman Connection is seeking an experienced home improvement contractor to do drywall installation and repairs.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work.  Our customers love us!  We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

We take care of the things that you don't want to.  We find the jobs, we schedule appointments, we manage the customer, and we take care of the payments.  You can focus on doing the work.  You decide what you want to do, where you want to do it, and when you want to do it.  You can work as little or as much as you like.

  • Earn $42-48/hour, depending on your skills and experience
  • Work as an Independent Contractor
  • Flexibility - you choose the work you do, when you do it, and where you go
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking, billing
  • Free access to custom Mobile App for scheduling and communications

The handyman will need to have expertise in drywall installation and finishing. You must have basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate with others with a positive attitude.  We are looking for a craftsman or craftswoman who can bid work and produce it.  If you have experience in the following skill areas, you're the kind of person we need to add to our team:

Ready to Learn More?

title: Carpenter
description:
Description:

The Engineering Department at Hamilton Health Sciences is an integral part of the support services, providing facilities maintenance services to all buildings, wards and departments at General, JHCC, JCC, St. Peters, WLMH and McMaster Children's Hospital sites. The Engineering staff is comprised of numerous and varied trades, including Stationary Engineers in the power plant, Electricians, Plumbers, Millwrights, Carpenters, Painters, etc. all contributing to the safe and efficient operation of the facilities. The department's goals can best be summarized as "SERVICE EXCELLENCE".



Qualifications:

The Engineering Department at Hamilton Health Sciences is an integral part of the support services, providing facilities maintenance services to all buildings, wards and departments at General, JHCC, JCC, St. Peters, WLMH and McMaster Children's Hospital sites. The Engineering staff is comprised of numerous and varied trades, including Stationary Engineers in the power plant, Electricians, Plumbers, Millwrights, Carpenters, Painters, etc. all contributing to the safe and efficient operation of the facilities. The department's goals can best be summarized as "SERVICE EXCELLENCE".


Under general supervision, the Carpenter is responsible for the construction, installation, repairs and maintenance of cabinet work, drywall partitions, doors and frames, windows, concrete floors, furniture, framework, locks, hardware, hinges, closures, weather stripping, blinds, curtain track and ceiling tile, exterior building repairs including soffits, minor glazing, caulking and minor roof repairs. Functions in accordance with duties defined in the job description of a Carpenter. May be assigned to work at any HHS site.


Under general supervision, the Carpenter is responsible for the construction, installation, repairs and maintenance of cabinet work, drywall partitions, doors and frames, windows, concrete floors, furniture, framework, locks, hardware, hinges, closures, weather stripping, blinds, curtain track and ceiling tile, exterior building repairs including soffits, minor glazing, caulking and minor roof repairs. Functions in accordance with duties defined in the job description of a Carpenter. May be assigned to work at any HHS site.


Monday to Friday; days


Monday to Friday; days


1. Current Province of Ontario General Carpenter Trade Certificate
2. Minimum five years experience as a qualified Tradesperson
3. Demonstrated ability to follow verbal and written instructions in English
4. Demonstrated ability to use tools and equipment of the trade
5. Demonstrated ability and willingness to work in areas that are cold, hot, dusty, dirty, noisy amongst machinery, at elevated levels and cramped quarters
6. Must be willing to provide own hand tools of the trade
7. Demonstrated ability to bend, crawl, lift heavy items, climb, work from ladders and scaffolding, and as required, wear a respirator to work in mechanical spaces containing sprayed asbestos fire-proofing


As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to Employee Health Services.


1. Current Province of Ontario General Carpenter Trade Certificate
2. Minimum five years experience as a qualified Tradesperson
3. Demonstrated ability to follow verbal and written instructions in English
4. Demonstrated ability to use tools and equipment of the trade
5. Demonstrated ability and willingness to work in areas that are cold, hot, dusty, dirty, noisy amongst machinery, at elevated levels and cramped quarters
6. Must be willing to provide own hand tools of the trade
7. Demonstrated ability to bend, crawl, lift heavy items, climb, work from ladders and scaffolding, and as required, wear a respirator to work in mechanical spaces containing sprayed asbestos fire-proofing


As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to Employee Health Services.


Guidelines for submitting an Application ~ UNION staff, who choose to submit their application through hard-copy mail, fax or email will need to have their application (ONA & OPSEU: with accompanying skills profile) available to the Recruitment Staff before 4 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ALL JOB SEEKERS, including UNION staff, who use the Career's Website to apply for job postings will have until 11 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ***INTERNAL JOB SEEKERS - Please ensure that both your ID# and last name are entered exactly as you see it on your most recent pay stub, otherwise you will be treated as an external candidate.***

Hamilton Health Sciences fosters a culture of patient and staff safety, whereby all employees are guided by our Mission, Vision, Values, and Values Based Code of Conduct. Hamilton Health Sciences is a teaching hospital and all staff and physicians are expected to support students and other learners.

To be considered for this opportunity applicants must apply during the posting period. All internal and external applicants may ONLY apply via the Careers website.

Hamilton Health Sciences is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate any needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact HR Operations at 905-521-2100, Ext. 46947 for assistance. If the applicant requires a specific accommodation because of a disability during an interview, the applicant will need to advise the hiring manager when scheduling the interview and the appropriate accommodations can be made.

This competition is open to all qualified applicants, however, qualified internal applicants will be considered first. Past performance will be considered as part of the selection process. If you are a previous employee of Hamilton Health Sciences, please note: the circumstances around an employee's exit will be considered prior to an offer of employment

Proficiency in both Official Languages, French and English, is considered an asset

If this position is temporary, selection for this position will be as per the outlined Collective Agreements:

Article 30 (k), CUPE Collective Agreement

Article 10.7 (d), ONA Collective Agreement

Article 13.01 (b) (ii), OPSEU 273 Collective Agreement

Article 14.04, OPSEU 209 Collective Agreement

Article 2.07 and Article 13, PIPSC RT Collective Agreement

title: Carpenter Red Seal
description:
Minimum Clearance Required to Start:


Not Applicable/None


Job Description:


Parsons has been successful in winning environmental and mining projects in Northern Canada and will be aggressively pursuing additional northern projects. We are a world-class leader in providing in-depth engineering, construction, technical, and management services. Our employees deliver landmark commercial, industrial, environmental, energy, power, and renewable infrastructure — and provide innovative solutions to complex environmental, water quality, supply, treatment, watershed, and wastewater projects. We hire colleagues with an entrepreneurial spirit who thrive on solving project challenges in a high-energy environment. Parsons is helping to build a healthier and more sustainable world.


Parsons is now hiring a Carpenter for our Faro Mine Site.


Responsibilities:


The Carpenter performs carpentry duties necessary to maintain building structures and finishes in good repair including repairing or installing new walls, partitions, floor tiles, ceiling tiles, and systems furniture. Also included are drywall patching, painting, and adjusting and installing door hardware. Work involves most of the following: planning and laying out of work from blueprints, drawings, models, or verbal instructions, using a variety of carpenter's hand tools, portable power tools and standard measuring instruments, and making standard shop computations relating to dimensions of work; and selecting materials necessary for the work. Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.


EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

• High School diploma or equivalent.

• Formal or informal education or training which ensures the ability to read and write at a level necessary for successful job performance.

• Minimum of ten years of carpentry experience required.

• Ability to lift up to 45 lbs

• Computer Skills: Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, etc.) preferred.


The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by federal, state, provincial or local mandates or customer requirements.


About Us
Parsons is a digitally enabled solutions provider focused on the defense, security, and infrastructure markets. With nearly 75 years of experience, Parsons is uniquely qualified to deliver cyber/converged security, technology-based intellectual property, and other innovative services to federal, regional, and local government agencies, as well as to private industrial customers worldwide.
Parsons is an equal opportunity, drug-free employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veteran/LGBTQ+.
For more about Parsons, visit parsons.com and follow us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and YouTube.

title: Carpenter (NOC 7271)
description:
JOB ADVERTISEMENT
 

  • Company operating name: Patty Mac Inc.

 

  • Company business address: 3785 Muskoka District Hwy 169, Bala ON  P0C 1A0

 

  • Title of the position: Carpenter (NOC 7271)

 

  • Job duties:

 

  • Building foundations, installing floor beams, laying sub-flooring, and installing walls and roofing systems
  • Fitting and installing trim, doors, stairs, moulding, and hardware
  • Measuring, cutting, and joining materials made of wood or wood substitutes
  • Repairing and renovating wooden structures
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints, drawings, and sketches
  • Inside finishing
  • Fitting and installing trim items, such as doors, stairs, moulding hardware
  • Preparing layouts in conformance to building codes, using measuring tools
  • Supervising apprentices and other construction workers
  • Operating a variety of hand and power tools of all types: hammer, drills, chainsaws, skill saws, jack jammer
  • Installing windows, doors, roof trusses, sheathing, hardware,
  • Erecting scaffolding and ladders working at heights training a requirement

 

  • Terms of employment: Permanent and Full-Time

 

  • The language of work: English

 

  • Wage: CA $26.50 per hour for 44 hours per week

 

  • Benefits package being offered: Vision care and prescriptions

 

  • Location or locations of work: District of Muskoka, ON

 

  • Contact information to apply for the job: Email - steve.macdonald@pattymac.ca & Tel. - 705-765-1919

 

  • Skills requirements:

 

  • Ability to work independently
  • Team player
  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Ability to lift 80lbs
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Good problem solving and decision-making
  • Organized and efficient
     
  • Required education: Completion of secondary school is preferred but not required

 

  • Required work experience: 2 years of work experience as a carpenter

title: Labour Worker
description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE Gold’s Gym British Columbia is hiring a labour worker, with potential to grow! Are you hard working, a good team player, with a passion for fitness? We would love to hear from you!

About Gold’s GymGold’s Gym has been the authority on fitness since 1965. It was then that fitness legend Joe Gold took the knowledge and expertise he gained from training at the world famous “Muscle Beach” and opened up the first Gold’s Gym on Pacific Avenue in Venice, California. At Gold’s Gym, our goal is simple: We’re here to help you Know Your Own Strength®. We are committed to helping people find their inner strength and reach their goals.

Key Responsibilities
  • Basic maintenance work (moving equipment, driving parts, manual labour, painting, general maintenance)
  • Assist in gym maintenance at 4 lower mainland locations (Port Coquitlam, Langley, West Broadway, University Market Place)
  • Assist in general equipment repair
Qualifications
  • Must be able to move and carry up to 50lbs 
  • Drivers License and vehicle 
  • No prior experience is required but it is an asset 
What We Offer
  • Positive, rewarding, and collaborative team environment
  • Competitive compensation
  • Complimentary club membership
  • Discount on Gold’s Gym products and services
NOTE: This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.Gold’s Gym British Columbia is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at https://goldsgymbc.ca/Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.

title: Labourer
description:
Are you looking for long term employment with a proven employer? As a member of the FBL team you will enjoy many career advancement opportunities such as development training, career growth, and promotional opportunities from within.

Forbes Brothers Ltd, OA FB Bullet is looking for qualified individuals to join our growing team in SURREY BC. Specializing in underground utility construction FB Bullet offers a competitive compensation package, benefits and pension contribution.


Civil Labourer

The ideal candidate will either have previous experience as a Construction Labourer or seeks the opportunity to join our growing team and advance their knowledge and skill base. The role of Civil Labourer will be responsible to report to the Crew Leader and execute the day-to-day activities of their crew. As a valued member of our team, you will be able to support and take instructions from crew members with assigned duties to gain and improve efficiencies.

Responsibilities:

  • Receive duties, delegations from the Crew Leader, and assist crew members execute these tasks
  • Work closely with all crew members, and learn the construction industry standards
  • Complete installation of conduit and other utility infrastructure with crew members
  • Work on tight timeline power outage worksites
  • Assist in maintaining a clean and organized work site
  • Able to problem solve through coordination with Crew Leader
  • Ensure quality of work meets or exceeds expectations
  • Complete daily pre-trip inspections on company equipment/vehicles
  • Participate and engage in daily Tailboard meetings, identify hazards and assist in crew compliance to safety policies and regulations
  • Work with construction equipment such as compactors, shoring, core drills, various hand tools
  • Ensure all small tools assigned to crew are cleaned, stored and maintained properly
  • Work closely with Crew Leader/Lead Hand to install conduit per specifications to correct grades/elevations
  • Assist drivers and vehicles navigate through busy work sites via proper hand signals and guidance

Schedule:

  • Due to the demand of our workload, all crews are scheduled Monday-Friday with the opportunity for weekend work quite frequently. Nightshift work is also scheduled on a less frequent basis
  • All shifts are scheduled for 8-10 hours, and due to the type of work we perform can extend past that
  • Daily overtime/double time is offered in all FB positions

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid Class 5 driver's licence, Class 1 or 3 preferred
  • Preferred experience in underground utility construction, hydro/telecommunications considered an asset
  • Physically fit and able to provide hands on assistance to crew members
  • Must be safety orientated
  • Ability to take and execute instructions and duties assigned to you
  • Lead by example attitude
  • Existing knowledge of WorkSafeBC standards and policies is an asset for this position

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: Construction Labourer
description:
Location:

GTA - West, Ontario

Department:

Employment Type:

Construction, GTA Lowrise Division

Full-Time

Reports to:

Builder

Who We Are

Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with 40-plus years of history across the United States and Canada. Every year, Mattamy helps more than 8,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In Canada, our communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area, as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton.

What We Offer

In keeping with the Mattamy Mission of providing The Best Homeowner Experience, the Construction Labourer safely constructs new homes which meet the high standards of quality set by the company.

 Responsibilities

  • Prepare house for next trade as required including cutting concrete, covering floors, scraping floors, straw placement and removal and stripping floors
  • On a daily basis, collect and dispose of debris at construction site, placing it in appropriate designated places, while ensuring compliance with waste recycling programs
  • Assist with having porches filled, garages and basements cleaned so cement can be poured. Ensure driveways are cut, stone is ordered and that patio slabs are installed on each lot.
  • Make sure houses are graded and safe for the bricklayer trades to work; ensure footings and walls ready for inspection
  • Advise Administrator when to contact garbage company for delivery and exchange bins for interior cleaning
  • Ensure availability of temporary heat for inside trades (tile setters, tapers, etc.)
  • Locate water boxes (dig up and repair) and ensure water turned on for each house; includes ensuring water boxes are raised and marked for sod
  • Review, assess and report any issues on safety to Health & Safety Rep. or direct supervisor, includes ensuring protective gear used/worn
  • Address any complaints or inquiries forwarded by homeowners

 What You Bring

  • No formal education is required although any training related to construction skills would be an asset.
  • Experience in residential building or related construction industry.
  • Experience dealing with tools and machinery, includes machine skills – rough grading, digging hydro, gas trenching, water boxes, backhoe operation, etc.
  • Good organizational skills with ability to get things done according to timelines.
  • Good communication skills – especially verbal.
  • Good customer service skills.
  • Must have the ability to perform physically challenging work.
  • Must have a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record.

 Health & Safety

We are doing our part to safeguard your health and taking extra steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19. All work sites and premises will allow for required physical distancing requirements, and new routines and resources such as hand sanitizer, antiseptic wipes, masks, or other protective equipment.

Vaccination is the single best protection against COVID-19 for us as individuals and our communities and is vital to maintaining our commitment to health and safety. The successful applicant will be required, as a condition of employment with Mattamy, to provide Mattamy with proof that they have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine (or combination of vaccines) authorized by Health Canada, subject to accommodations required under applicable human rights legislation.

 Why Mattamy

At Mattamy, we’re passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important aspects of the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues and communities. We offer a workplace that allows our employees to experience exciting possibilities in their career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.

When you’re part of the Mattamy family, your day to day work has an incredible impact. What we do takes teamwork, and everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. Based on the culture we pride ourselves on, we’ve been recognized with external awards as well. Some of our most recent recognition includes:

  • Canada’s Best Managed Companies for 2021 & 2020
  • Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for 2022, 2021, 2020 & 2019
  • Canada’s Top 100 Employers for 2020 & 2019
  • Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2017

We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

Mattamy Homes is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us on your application and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.

title: General Labourer
description:
Oakridge Landscape Contractors has a need for General Labourers (Full-time Year Round) to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!

Oakridge Group Inc. Established in 1992, our team of trusted professionals strives to accomplish the best outcome for every single one of our clients, every time. With 30 years of experience, we stand firmly behind our work and take immense pride in all of our projects, both big and small. Our focus and client dedication can be seen throughout decades of Oakridge Landscape Contractors' award-winning residential and commercial projects. We have won 9 Landscape Ontario awards in 2021 for our residential and commercial projects.

Job Details:
  • Position: General Labourer.
  • Location: Hamilton, Ontario.
  • Pay: $20/hr.
  • Benefits after probationary period.
  • Company events.

Key Job Duties:
  • The job involves lifting, bending, digging, raking, using a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, and other tools.
  • Ability to dig holes (when needed), place soils, plant trees, and shrubs, etc.
  • Building retaining walls
  • Installation of natural stone (flag, armor, etc).
  • Installation of interlock paving stone.
  • Snow removal in winter months.

Job Requirements:
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Must have access to your own vehicle.
  • Ability to work long hours.
  • Self-motivated.
  • Ability to think as a team player.
  • Ability to do physical work.
  • Respect for on-site safety.
  • Ability to work Saturdays as required.
  • Tolerance to various weather conditions.

Application Details:
  • Oakridge Group is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties.
  • If you are a person with a disability and have a question or require assistance with the application.




    About Oakridge Landscape Contractors:

    Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.

title: General Laborer (FT)
description:
Description

Purpose:
This is a hands-on, physical role working with a small construction team with responsibility for refurbishing and building gas stations for MacEwen Petroleum Inc. We are looking for a candidate who brings construction experience.

Main Responsibilities:
  • Maintenance of pumps, replace nozzles, spouts, hoses and filters, contain and clean up spills and leaks.

This Includes:
  • Working in a small construction crew under the direction of the Construction Manager.
  • Working alongside and supporting the work of contractors.
  • Maintaining a safe work environment.
  • Using a variety of large equipment. E.g. back hoes.
  • When certifications have been completed, carrying out the service and maintenance of petroleum equipment, systems, and accessories essential to their operation including installation, removal, repair, maintain, start-up of dispensing and suction systems and submersible pumps.

Requirements
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • Must be willing and able, with Company support, to upgrade knowledge and skills to hold relevant PM licenses.
  • Must have a clean driving record and hold a 'D' license.
  • Previous experience working with the installation of tanks is highly desirable.
  • Knowledge of service station equipment including dispensers and suctions systems and fuel handling equipment and related tank gauging is also highly desirable.
  • Physically able to move and handle loads, up to 50 lbs.
  • Must be willing to travel as required, including occasionally working away from home base, as the projects determine.
  • Able to complete tasks effectively with minimal supervision.

Our Core Values:
It is important to us that when you consider a new opportunity, you understand a little about the company, its history and values. It is important to us that our values fit with yours, then everyone wins. Our core values are the cornerstone of who we are as a company, and what we value. We hope that our core values speak to you and what you value.
  • Customers First - We exist, first and foremost to serve our customers. They must be at the heart of all the decisions we make.
  • Long Term Focused - We value long-term success over short-term gains.
  • Respect Each Other - Each person with whom we work, communicate and do business is valued and treated with dignity and respect.
  • Do The Right Thing - We stand by our word and do what's right.
  • Own It - We are encouraged to be entrepreneurial and make decisions as if the business were our own.
  • Ever Evolving - We embrace positive change and always seek to improve.

Benefits
Why work with us?
  • Supportive colleagues and leaders who are passionate about providing exceptional service.
  • Learn and collaborate with the best in the industry.
  • “The perks” include employee gym membership reimbursement, discounts on motor fuels at our service stations, and purchases of equipment and heating oil.

Before an offer of employment is extended, a minimum of two business references will be required and candidates must complete pre-employment testing which comprises a drug/alcohol test and a criminal record check.

Prior to any offer of employment being extended, a minimum of two business references will be required and candidates must complete pre-employment testing which comprises a criminal record check.

title: General Labourer
description:
Matrix is looking for local labourers for a long term project in Victoria, BC starting immediately.  This role is a great opportunity to learn new skills while working with knowledgeable trades people.  

Scope of Work:
  • Assisting various constructions trades on site
  • Misc. Labour tasks
  • Other duties assigned by the supervisor
  • Lifting and moving large loads of supplies ect.
  • Working primarily outdoors in all types of weather
Qualifications:
  • Reliable
  • Previous construction experience 
  • Full PPE
If you think you are a great for this role and would like to be earning soon, apply now!




    About Matrix Labour Leasing Ltd.:

    Matrix Labour Leasing is a full-service recruitment agency specializing in the placement and administration of the skilled trades workforce all across Canada. We have been in business for over nineteen years and have placed over 4,000,000 employment-hours in the Canadian workforce. We have been recognized as one of Alberta Venture’s Fast Growth 50 and as a Leader of Tomorrow by Business in Calgary.As a leader in our industry, Matrix remains committed remaining cutting edge of the Full Service Temporary/Permanent Placement model as well as best in class managed services in Payroll and Back Office Support. title: Summer Labourer
company: Sun Peaks Resort LLP/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel & Conference Centre
description:
Work, Live and Play

Sun Peaks Resort LLP has proven to be one of the highest levels of guest service providers within the ski industry. We can promise you a memorable and gainful working experience within our high volume and challenging work environments. Sun Peaks Resort LLP has many benefits to offer our employees including:

  • Full access Summer Alpine Hike and Downhill Bike season pass
  • Employee access to Golf Membership and discounted Golf Cart season pass
  • Employee Health and Wellness Program including EFAP services
  • Companywide discounts and benefit programs 
  • Eligibility to participate in our Peak Performer Recognition Program, awarded at the end of our summer season at a specially planned event
  • Reciprocal riding at other participating BC and Alberta bike parks

Your Responsibilities will include:

  • Assist carpenters and/or plumbers with tasks as assigned
  • Odd jobs include, but are not limited to, power washing, washing windows, painting
  • Unload tools, prepare building site materials, stack building materials, and set up equipment
  • Prepare work zones by digging, moving dirt, moving construction materials
  • Use construction and maintenance tools and equipment to complete daily tasks
  • Ensure regulated and proper headgear, earplugs, gloves, safety glass, CSA steel-toed boots, and clothing are worn
  • Clean and clear debris and construction waste
  • Follow all OH&S and Work Safe regulations worn

Ideal Candidates:

  • Physically fit as the job involves physical labor
  • Must be able to lift 50 pounds (23 kg)
  • Experience working construction laborer or similar is preferred
  • Valid BC driver’s license and able to produce a clean driver’s abstract
  • Ability to work independently and unsupervised, while prioritizing duties effectively
  • Ability to work well with the public and promote Sun Peaks' image
  • Ability to operate 2-way radio
  • Dependable, reliable, and punctual

Incentive Program:

If you are a student, currently enrolled in a college/university tourism and/or hospitality program, please note, that this role is eligible for fully reimbursed staff accommodation for the Summer season for successful applicants.

Please ensure you provide the required documentation and complete the information on your student status in the job application fields. (Conditions apply and will be discussed in detail with successful applicants during the interview and at the job offer stage).

If you have been referred by a current employee of Sun Peaks Resort/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel (or someone who has an accepted job offer for the Summer 2022 start), please ensure you indicate their name and current department in the required field in your application form.

title: Skilled labourer
description:
Our client is growing and looking for a fourth member of full-time crew. Company philosophy is to train workers to ensure our timelines, quality of work and customer satisfaction is met.

The right candidate must be able to lead tasks with minimal supervision and must have a minimum of five years of renovation experience with relevant construction education. One of the key requirements of this role is leadership ability. The candidate must be able build and maintain strong site team morale.

The position is for a small-sized General Contracting company in the residential and commercial market that focuses on interior renovations for clients of various sizes across Toronto and the GTA. This is a strategic hire for the company as we are looking for an individual who is passionate about the industry and enjoys learning about construction techniques/methods, and who will be a future candidate for a foreman or site manager.

Requirements:
  • Must have a valid Ontario Driver's License, and your own vehicle; a truck is preferable.
  • Must have, at minimum, cordless drill, tool belt and hand tools.
  • Must be clean cut and presentable to clients – public perception is very important.
  • Must be hard working, flexible, reliable and take pride in your work.
  • Must have the ability to work within a team as well as alone.
  • Must provide a criminal record check.
  • Must provide a resume and professional references upon request.
  • Post-secondary education is preferred in a construction-related field of study.
Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Assist the Supervisor or General Contractor with basic work site project management.
  • Read and interpret plans, instructions, and specifications to determine daily work activities.
  • Provide assistance to sub trades, skilled trades, Supervisor and General Contractor on the job-site when required.
  • Build, install, and repair structural woodwork, flooring, ceilings and cabinetry.
  • Operate, maintain, and calibrate hand and power tools.
  • Read and comprehend plans and blueprints.
  • Clean and make minor repairs to equipment and tools when required.
  • Follow proper safety rules to maintain a safe working environment.
  • Operate all equipment in a safe and efficient way according to all relevant legislation,
  • policies and procedures.
  • Set up the accompanying tools, equipment, materials and supplies for trades, such as carpenters, drywallers, plumbers, electricians, etc., who are completing work on-site, when needed.
  • Load, unload and organize tools, equipment, materials and supplies to and from the work truck, work site, and designated tool boxes and bins.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work site to eliminate possible hazards.
  • Ensure daily time sheets and any other forms requested by Supervisor are consistently completed by team.
  • Maintain daily communication with General Contractor and record daily construction activity.
  • Assist with communication between sub trades, skilled trades, labourers and GC.
Knowledge -The employee must have proficient knowledge in the following areas:
  • Comprehensive knowledge of general construction and repair methods, and the proper utilization and care of tools, materials, and equipment used in building construction.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of traditional building materials, practices, and techniques
  • Strong knowledge of electrical, plumbing, tiling, drywalling, framing, flooring, painting and carpentry.
  • Minimum technical college education but college- or university-level education is preferred (post-secondary education such as George Brown College, Ryerson University, or equivalent is ideal).
Skills/Experience -The employee must demonstrate the following skills/experience:
  • Five (5) years or more of renovation experience.
  • Strong carpentry skills, and general trade and interior finishing experience.
  • Plumbing, electrical and HVAC experience is preferred.
  • Excellent project management, organizational and time management skills.
  • Strong verbal and listening communications skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to work as a team or unaccompanied on various tasks.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English.
Personal Attributes:
  • The employee must demonstrate the following personal attributes:
  • Fast-thinking and good judgement (common sense).
  • Hardworking, detail-oriented and thorough.
  • Honest, trustworthy and flexible.
  • Respectful and conscientious of the people and environment around them.
  • Demonstrates sound work ethics and self-motivation to work with minimal supervision.
  • Interacts with supervisors, coworkers and clients in a positive, courteous and respectful manner.

title: Labourer
description:
Like working with your hands? Don't mind heavy work, using hand tools, working in a team environment?

You'll be working with scaffolding, taking it apart, reshaping it, using tools like grinders and screw guns. This is a growing company and there will be opportunity for advancement and more pay. They have trained people on new skills (welding/forklift/truck driving) once you show initiative and interest. If you have fork lift experience handling wide loads, please make sure to note that in your application. If you have any auto-body experience, that will be considered an asset.

Job title: General Labour

Pay rate: $18-19 based on experience

Location: Highway 404 & Herald Road (Newmarket)

Shift time: Start training on the day shift (6 AM - 3 PM or 7 AM - 4 PM)

Ongoing Contract

Advantages
What's great about this opportunity:
-Work for a growing company in Newmarket
-Full time hours
-Flexible start times
-$18-19/hr
-Possibility of permanent placement once the contract is over
-Physical work
-Potential to learn new skills
-Growing company with new roles

Randstad Perks
-Weekly pay with 4% vacation pay added to your cheque
-Benefits from day 1 - Randstad offers immediate benefits for contract workers


Responsibilities
-Assembly of metal frames
-Lifting up to 50 lbs
-Following health and safety procedures
-Using hand and power tools such as grinders, cutting discs, screw guns and hammers
-Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
-experience in assembly/general labour role (landscaping, construction, roofing, etc.)
-Comfortable with hand and power tools
-Able to lift 50 lbs
-Steel toed safety boots

Summary
Apply bellow!

If this General Labour/Assembler role in Newmarket sounds like a position that interests you we want to hear from you right away!

Have questions? Give us a call at (905) 305-2843 and ask for Jordan or send an email to jordan.dewit@randstad.ca

Search all of our open jobs. If you are an expert in a specific role, let’s find a job that’s a perfect match for you. Some of the most in-demand jobs at the moment include machine operators, general laborers, warehouse workers, forklift and counterbalance drivers, and brake press operators.

If this role interests you, but is not quite the right fit, I'd love to have you give us a call so we can discuss exactly what it is that you are looking for.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: General Labourer (Shop / Buses/Trucks)
description:
About Vicinity Motor Corp.

Vicinity Motor Corp. (NASDAQ:VEV) (TSXV:VMC) (FRA:6LGA) is a North American supplier of electric vehicles for both public and commercial enterprise use. The Company leverages a dealer network and close relationships with world-class manufacturing partners to supply its flagship electric, CNG and clean-diesel Vicinity buses, the VMC 1200 electric truck and a VMC Optimal-EV shuttle bus. In addition, the Company sells its proprietary electric chassis alongside J.B. Poindexter business unit EAVX, the Companyâ€™s strategic partner, for upfitting into next-generation delivery vehicles. For more information, please visit www.vicinitymotorcorp.com.

 

We are currently looking for a Shop Helper /Mechanical Assistant/General Labourer

 

Responsibilities:

  • Assist the Heavy Equipment Technicians on the shop floor
  • Maintaining the cleanliness of the shop
  • Moving tools, equipment, and other materials
  • Cleaning work areas and equipment
  • Sorting and picking of parts
  • Parts runs, washing equipment
  • General yard cleanup and maintenance
  • Other duties as required

 

Qualifications:

  • Previous general labourer or shop helper experience in a similar environment would be preferred
  • Pre-apprentice training in a heavy equipment environment with aspirations towards a career in trades would be an asset
  • Possess a proven mechanical aptitude and a keen interest in heavy equipment
  • Welding experience would be considered an asset
  • Valid driver's license required
  • Forklift experience is an asset (recertification will be provided if necessary)
  • Ability to lift at least 80 lbs. as the work will be physical on a regular basis
  • Must be a hard worker, self-motivated with organization and cleanliness being the key focus
