title: Carpenter
description:
PME Inc. provides civil site work and common construction services to the oil and gas industry in Western Canada with primary focus on the Northern Alberta region. The key bases of work have most recently been to the oil refineries, oil sands development and oil and gas pipeline sectors.

At PME Inc, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values. Then we simply give them the freedom to take their career further.

Duties and Responsibilities :

  • Ability to read and understand technical guides, drawings and specifications
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs
  • Comfortable working at heights
  • Ability to work in adverse weather conditions
  • Manual dexterity and ability to use carpentry tools safely

Qualifications:

  • Apprenticeship
  • CSTS 09, WHMIS 2015
  • Fall Protection & Rescue, Aerial Platform, Confined Spaces, Rigging/Hoisting and Hand Signals, and First Aid/CPR certification would be an asset
  • Meet drug and alcohol policy requirements

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it! These positions are set to start in Spring 2022.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

description:

$20.13 - $36.80 /hr, plus benefits

We are looking for General labourers with construction experience. Must have a valid driverâ€™s license and your own vehicle. The following experience would be an asset:

title: Labourer
description:
Job Description:

ClearStream is seeking Labourers, in the Nanaimo area, with industrial experience in oil and gas service.

 

â€¯Please note that this is an expression of interest posting to strengthen our pool of candidates in the Nanaimo area. These positions could be starting immediately and could run for several months.

 

What would you be doing?

  • Demolition and site  clean.
  • Cleaning and maintenance of  tools, and equipment.
  • Transport materials,  tools, and equipment.
  • Load and unload materials,  tools, and equipment.
  • Assist skilled trades and Equipment Operators in various tasks.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Does this sound like you?

  • Have 1 or more yearsâ€™ experience on industrial sites.
  • Valid and up to date safety tickets:  H2S Alive
  • Standard First Aid  is an asset.
  • Have a high regard for personal safety, safety of company assets and employees.
  • Self-motivated, capable of performing tasks with minimal supervision.
  • Able to prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Ability to work well under pressure and handle strict deadline.

Perks of the job

  • Competitive  Pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary.
  • Working for a reputable and safety conscious company that  values  employees.

title: Labourer (Casual)
description:
Job Description:

Part-Time; Event-Based
Wage: $24.61/hour plus 10% in lieu of benefits and vacation

Date Posted: March 3, 2022

 

Who We Are

 

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 112-year-old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams:   the 15-day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events.   The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance.   The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best, we can be.

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organizationâ€™s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution.   With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to â€œDeliver Memorable Experiencesâ€ for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees, or the community.

We are seeking diligent and hard-working individuals that have a passion for the Events industry and the Pacific National Exhibition (PNE). Our Labourer team works work under the direction of the Director, PNE Maintenance & Facility Operations and are responsible for site maintenance, and setup/teardown of events. They will operate vehicles and tools/equipment in compliance with all health and safety requirements as determined by WorkSafeBC, and all other applicable legislation and company policies.

 

Why join our Team?

 

  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work environment
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!

 

What will you do this year?

 

In your role as a Labourer, your primary accountabilities will be to:

  • Help in the set-up of events by moving equipment, furniture, assembling barricades, setting up seating etc.
  • Perform maintenance and janitorial tasks including cleaning washrooms, mopping, sweeping, vacuuming, and stocking supplies as needed.
  • Service and maintain equipment operated by site maintenance.
  • Effectively use heavy and light equipment, depending on the jobsite/assignment.
  • Assemble and dismantle special event facilities.
  • Maintain a safe and clean work environment.
  • Perform other related work as required.

 

What else?

  • Previous general labour and janitorial experience is required.
  • Must be capable of lifting 50lb objects; be highly motivated and able to work alone.
  • A valid class 5 BC driverâ€™s license is required.
  • Previous experience operating a forklift is preferred.
  • A valid forklift operating license is an asset.
  • A valid aerial lift or fall arrest ceritifcation is an asset.  
  • Knowledge of materials, methods and equipment used in janitorial work.
  • Knowledge of methods and practices used in servicing and maintaining equipment operated.
  • Knowledge of methods, materials, tools, and equipment used in assembling and dismantling special event facilities and in performing maintenance and janitorial tasks.
  • Successful completion of grade 12 preferred.
  • OFA Level I (or higher) is considered an asset.
  • Skill in the operation of construction and maintenance equipment and the use of tools used in servicing, minor maintenance tasks are desirable.
  • Ability to carry out work orders and prepare and maintain work records.
  • Must have CSA approved steel toe boots.
  • Must be available to work a variety of shifts including weekends, week days, and overnight shifts.
  • Must be comfortable working an event based schedule, as hours of work will vary.
  • The PNE has implemented a Proof of Vaccination policy and due to requirements of this position the successful candidate must provide proof of vaccination.
  • Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check.

 

Who are you?

 

  • Team Player
  • Passionate
  • Skillful communicator
  • Proactive
  • Committed

 

Where and when to APPLY?

 

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

The PNE is proud to be an  equal  opportunity  employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at  

hr@pne.ca

.

title: Carpenter and Handyman
description:
We consistently hire reliable, customer service-focused employees who are both knowledgeable and skilled. They are experienced in many areas of handyman repair and they know the value of building relationships with our clients. Our team of qualified experts live our code of values of Respect, Integrity, and Customer Focus while having fun in the process!As Handyman/Carpenter, you are a key member of our team responsible for quality repairs, remodeling, and home improvement projects. You will build customer relationships and uphold our standard for excellent customer service. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.You have a strong background of skilled tradesman experience and have proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.  You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines.Specific Responsibilities:
  • Complete small to medium repairs, remodeling, and home improvement projects
  • Communicate with customers about scope of work and cost estimates
  • Insure the efficient use of materials and maintain adequate stock of necessary equipment
  • Collect payment and/or payment information from customers for work performed
  • Keep company vehicle and equipment properly serviced, clean, and in good working order and condition
  • Complete invoices, daily route sheets, and weekly reports as required
  • Perform other duties as needed which may include cross-training in related positions
Job Requirements:
  • Skilled tradesman with 10 years of experience in home maintenance/repair and remodeling
  • Strong carpentry background
  • Must have own tools fit for many job types
  • Proficiency to navigate tablet based technology
  • Team player who can work independently
Benefits: New work van, fuel, uniforms, paid holidays and vacations, bonus opportunities available.We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow-up!Proudly serving: West Calgary, Bearspaw, Springbank, Strathmore, Cochrane, Airdrie and surrounding areas.

Notice

Mr. Handyman International LLC is the franchisor of the Mr. Handyman® franchised system. Each Mr. Handyman® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, Mr. Handyman International LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. Mr. Handyman International LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent Mr. Handyman® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither Mr. Handyman International LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. Mr. Handyman International LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: General Labourer
description:
Overview:

If you  have experience in a shop, warehouse, or general labour position, come start a career with  Fountain Tire Sudbury (Elisabella) as a General Labourer! We are willing to train interested applicants who are looking for a career in the Automotive Industry  and love to work with their hands.

 

What do we offer?

  • $16 an hour
  • On the job training
  • The opportunity to work with an excellent team and great customers in a clean, safe and respectful environment
  • Regular day shifts, with opportunity for overtime during our busy seasons (spring and fall)
  • Competitive wage, benefit programs for you and your family, including a RRSP program with company matching
  • Discounts for you and your family on tires, parts and services at all Fountain Tire locations
  • The opportunity for growth into apprenticeships and  leadership positions - own your own Fountain Tire location!

You will be responsible for:

  • Installing, balancing, rotating, and repairing passenger and light truck tires and wheels  
  • Resetting and repairing tire pressure monitoring systems (TPMS)
  • Maintaining tire service equipment on a regularly scheduled basis
  • Completing specialty tire work
  • Operating company and customer vehicles in a clean and safe manner

What does it take to get on track?

  • A valid driver's license
  • Some experience in an automotive shop would be great, but mostly we are looking for reliable candidates with a willingness to learn!
  • A customer-service focus with the ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with team members and customers
  • A keen attention to detail
  • Basic computer skills
  • Ability to consistently lift 25 kilograms

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply online or in store today!!

title: Labourer
description:
The Labourer is key member of our team, responsible over our property for cleanliness and organization, and assisting plumbers & apprentices to complete large scale jobs. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.  

Ideally you have prior experience in the plumbing industry and have proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.  You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines.  

Mr. Rooter Plumbing of Ottawa is interested in hiring people looking to be introduced into the plumbing trade, or those looking to gain experience in the trade. We are confident that the variety of jobs that are performed at our company will be helpful in education and skill development.

 

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Supporting plumbers and apprentices to complete large scale jobs which may involve digging, chipping concrete, and other labour-intensive tasks.
  • Perform minor to non-complex service work on plumbing systems in commercial and residential environments

  • Communicate problems, propose solutions, and explain billing to customers

  • Organizing tools, materials, and coordinating job activities with team members.
 

Job Requirements:

  • Prior industry experienced preferred

  • Valid Driver's License

  • Ability to operate basic hand tools necessary for the craft

  • Attention to detail

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Professional appearance and personality

 

Benefits: Benefits package varies by location

 

We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Notice

As a service to its independent franchisees, Mr. Rooter LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. Mr. Rooter LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent Mr. Rooter® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither Mr. Rooter LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. Mr. Rooter LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Part-time General Labour
description:
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?
Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,500 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.

Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.

Maple Leaf Foods Bradford Plant is Hiring for multiple General Labour positions within our Production team!
The General Labour position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other general activities related to food processing.
We are offering part-time work opportunities for people who are interested in working afternoonshift, 2-3 days per week.

Job Title: General Labour
Department: Production
Reports To: Production Supervisor

We have numerous positions available for the following shifts:
  • Tray Pack Department: Monday - Friday, 5:30 pm - 1:30 am (or end of shift)
  • Cut-Up Department: Monday - Friday, 6:30 pm - 3:00 am (or end of shift)
Details regarding wages and shift premium will be discussed when contacted.

Responsibilities:
  • Manually pack product into bags, trays and other packaging formats as per customer specification
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects
  • Cut-up product and hang poultry
  • Operate single-function machines
  • Load product onto packaging line for processing
  • Ensure work area is clean and tidy
  • Follow all GMP and food safety principles
Experience:
  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to perform repetitive lifting
  • Can work well in a team environment and support fellow team members
  • Good communication skills

Why Maple Leaf Foods?

  • Training provided where needed, specifically in Human Resources, Health & Safety, Food Safety and on-the-job training
  • Reputable company and well-known brands
  • Competitive Wages
  • Great team environment
  • Strong focus on internal advancement and promotion
  • Employee Assistance Program and Mental Health support


If interested, please send resume by email to:

Jessica.madia@mapleleaf.com

or apply to our job posting onlinewith an updated resume and phone number atCareers and Jobs – Maple Leaf Foods, or through our other job boards.

These positions will remain open until filled.


We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. We ensure that our recruitment practices are supportive of this commitment.

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Come build with a BC Top Employer 2022 winner!

Jacob Bros Construction is immediately hiringSkilled & GeneralLabourers (Civil Construction)for projects throughout the lower mainland.

Your ​Rewards:

  • Full-time, permanentemployment
  • Work 10-12/h days, 5-6 days per week
  • Earn overtime after8 hours per day, and double time after 12 hours per day
  • Group Medical, Extended Health and Dental Plan
  • Group RRSP contribution
  • Vacation pay
  • 5 Year Service Award (Trip for twoanywhere in North America)
  • Eligibility for up to $2000.00 Referral Bonus Program
Responsibilities:
  • Manual labour, cleaning and preparing sites
  • Raking, shoveling, unloading trucks and maintenance tasks
  • Digging trenches, raking and shoveling
  • Cleaningdebris and removing waste materials from sites
  • Operate hand tools as directed
  • Worksafelyaround heavy construction equipment
  • Other labour duties as assigned
Requirements:

  • One (1) year proven civil constructionexperience for a privately held or family-owned general contracting business is preferred
  • Must be legally eligible to work for any employer in Canada

About Jacob Bros:

At Jacob Bros, our team of talented construction professionals is taking on some the most challenging projects in British Columbia's construction industry.

We are one of BC’s largest and most respected construction organizations, offering construction services in a variety of markets including heavy civil construction, major public infrastructure, and industrial, commercial, institutional and residential projects.

Jacob Bros has proudly served every major sector of Western Canada’s construction industry since 2008, and has been consistently recognized as a BC Top Employer.

Jacob Bros employs over 300 construction professionals, including staff and craft employees.

title: General Labourer (Dufferin Aggregates) - $24 - $29/hr
description:
Job ID:  402839 

Work Type:  Full Time Permanent 

 

It is a great time to join the Dufferin Aggregates team! Dufferin Aggregates is going through an exciting business transformation which demands first-class Talent Management support to drive results.


We are building a world- class team. Make your mark!


You will be a successful addition to our team if you look at change as an opportunity to develop and contribute to the business. You will be successful in your role if you like partnering with the business, presenting new ideas and providing excellent customer service.

Dufferin Aggregates, a divison of CRH Canada is looking to hire!

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work in a team environment with other co-workers, supervisors and managers.
  • Complete cleanup assignments using shovels and/or small, heavy equipment.
  • Assist in maintenance inspections and activities using appropriate procedures.
  • Operate crushing and screening plant as trained and directed.
  • Report any malfunctions or safety risks to supervisor immediately.
  • Specific job duties will often vary from day to day depending on business needs.

Qualifications:

  • Experience in construction, mining or operating heavy machinery is preferred but not required.
  • Minimum Ontario high school diploma (OSSD) or equivalent.
  • Reliability – Showing up to work on time.
  • Be willing to work rotating shifts, overtime and weekends when required.
  • Physical ability to walk around the plant.
  • Basic maintenance/mechanical aptitude, welding and fitting is preferred but not required.
  • Dependability – follow instructions and respond to direction. Good communication skills are required.  
  • Working outdoors/indoors under varied temperatures and weather conditions.

Health and Safety:

  • Comply with OHSA and all of its applicable regulations.
  • Strict compliance with Dufferin Aggregates safety rules, PPE, policies and procedures.
  • Be aware of environmentally sensitive areas and be alert to correct environmental problems that may develop in the assigned work area.
     

What Dufferin Aggregates Offers You:

  • Pension and benefits included after probationary period.
  • Shift premium applies to night shifts.
  • Bonus pay based on safety and performance.
  • High competitive starting wage with multi-tier wage structure based on skill and ability.
  • Overtime opportunities are available as required.
  • PPE and tools allowance are provided by company for some positions.
  • Company provides training and appreciation events.
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

Visit our website for more information: http://www.crhcanada.com

CRH Canada Group Inc. recognizes Canada’s diverse landscape. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Junior Carpenter
description:
Job descriptionGENERAL DESCRIPTION

Under the general supervisor of a Carpenter, this position will be responsible for assisting with renovation work. This position requires someone that has versatility in the ability to work on various construction projects interior and exterior and be able to adapt to a wide variety of conditions.

The majority of your work will include: drywall installation and repairs, installing all types of floor coverings, ceilings, panelling, trim and framing. You must be able to use a wide variety of hand and power tools and maintain them in good, safe working order.

NATURE and SCOPE

Duties shall include but not be limited to:

  • Various carpentry duties including but not limited to: sawing, nailing, panelling, framing, painting, installing.
  • Moving heavy equipment in and out of vehicles and into buildings where they are needed.
  • Removal of debris, content and cleaning of areas.
  • Discuss job requirements with Carpenters prior to starting in order to obtain a complete understanding of what work needs to be performed.
  • Conduct an accident/incident investigation in accordance with company policy should a work site injury or loss of equipment or property occurs.
  • Notify the company Health and Safety Coordinator of the details related to the accident or incident.
  • Maintain and promote good customer relations at all times.
  • Assist the Mitigation Department when required with jobs involving water and/or fire damage to buildings, and responsible for the damage tear out, removal of debris, contents and cleaning of areas.
SKILLS and KNOWLEDGE

The ability to pass a criminal background check and a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record is required for this position.

The ability to read, interpret and carry out written and oral instructions; write legibly; work under pressure; maintain good working relationships with supervisors, peers and the public; organize and prioritize work.

Must be physically able to lift heavy items above and below shoulder height, and perform continuous standing, walking, reaching and bending.

Benefits:

  • Vacation & paid time off
  • Dental care
  • Life insurance
  • Company events & social hours
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care
  • Disability insurance
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$22.00 per hour

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Labourer is required to perform tasks involving physical labour at commercial construction projects, and to operate a variety of hand and power tools.

Qualifications

  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools
  • Minimum of 1 year previous construction labour experience preferred
  • Knowledge of workplace safety, and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Knowledge of First Aid and CPR preferred
  • Valid Drivers License and clean abstract preferred
  • Out of town work may be required. Work in all weather conditions.

 



Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.', 'Educational assistance\xa0for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education']

description:

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. Job Description

The carpenter is responsible for constructing and maintaining buildings.

Required knowledge includes: construction and remodeling trades, practices, procedures, techniques, tools and equipment, materials, specifications, quality control, cost control and safety.

The carpenter must be proficient at the following tasks: hanging doors, drilling and setting door hardware, setting windows, layout for stairs and common rafters, formwork, and reading blueprints. The carpenter must also possess the mathematical and analytical skills necessary to do materials estimates.

Qualifications

  • Ticketed Journeyperson Carpenter
  • Experienced with a large general contractor
  • Valid drivers license and clean drivers abstract preferred

title: Laborer
company: On The Greener Side Lawn & Tree Service
description:
Looking for a seasonal laborer.
The hours will be 40 hours per week and some Saturdays may be required.

Requirements:
  • Must have a driver's license and a vehicle to get to work.
  • Stamina and strength to perform manual labor.
  • Excellent hand-eye-coordination skills.

The job is to:
  • Assist with the installation of underground sprinklers, so there are physical demands and will be working outdoors.
  • There is digging, backfilling raking.
  • Some lifting is involved in this job, so you must be physically fit.

title: Carpenter - Non-Journeyman
description:
Job Description

Key Responsibilities

  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings and sketches to determine specifications and calculate requirements
  • Prepare layouts and patterns in conformance to building codes using measuring tools
  • Plan sequences and methods of work
  • Load and unload construction materials, including moving materials to work location
  • Select, measure, cut, shape, assemble and join materials made of wood, wood substitutes and other materials using nails, staples, screws, bolts or glue
  • Frame floors, walls, roofs, conduct exterior and interior finishing
  • Fit and install doors, windows, flooring, cabinets, stairs, handrails, paneling, molding and ceiling tiles
  • Trim and sand joints, molding or other wooden parts to be assembled using hand and power tools
  • Install floor beams, lay sub-flooring and erect walls and roof systems
  • Attach previously fabricated walls, ceilings and floors together
  • Install insulation in flooring and walls
  • Assemble wood and metal products such as metal siding, window sashes, doors, door jambs, boxes, and pallets, using screws, bolts, staples, glue or other fasteners
  • Reinforce assembled products with dowelling or other supports, and install hardware such as knobs and hinges
  • Set up and operate woodworking equipment
  • Scrape and sand the unit and apply a finish such as paint, stain, plastic laminate, varnish or lacquer
  • Repair and fix/remodel existing structures
  • Assist with maintenance of machinery if necessary
  • Establish high standards of personal performance with a continuous emphasis on achieving quality of work, delivery on time and within budget
  • Provide suggestions for improving construction systems and processes, methods of work, tools, etc.
  • Prepare ad-hoc detailed specifications and cost estimates

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or GED.
  • At least three years' experience as a carpenter preferably in residential, commercial, light industrial construction and renovation industries.
  • Valid Class 5 driver's license with clean drivers abstract
  • Good math and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Outstanding critical thinking skills.
  • Specialized knowledge and experience working with modular structures.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with others.
  • Flexibility and adaptability.
  • Ability to work 10 hours per shift in the remote site location
  • Physically fit and able to lift up to 50 lb. on a consistent basis.
  • Preference will be given to candidates with certificates in Fall Protection (OSSA), Confined Space (OSSA), CSTS, ESTS, Wilderness/Bear Awareness, Aerial Work Platform, Fork Lift, Scissor/Boom Lift, Rigging and Hand Signaling, and Standard First Aid.
About Us

Civeo Installations Employees LP is a premier remote workforce lodge installations and maintenance provider for the Western Canadian resource industry. We help people maintain healthy, productive and connected lives while living and working away from home. Our unique approach focuses on guest wellbeing, operational efficiency and community building - making us a leading provider of accommodation solutions.

title: Maintenance
company: Northview Canadian High Yield Residential Fund
description:
At Northview, we are a passionate, community-focused team dedicated to making our properties the best they can be. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve, next to our residents, hotel guests and commercial tenants across Canada.

We are looking for a Maintenance team member to join our Hotel team in Yellowknife, NT. Reporting to the Operations Manager, Hotel you will play a key role in ensuring that Northview’s Hotels show pride of ownership and respect for our Customers, by making sure they are kept in good repair, and that maintenance issues are resolved in a timely and cost efficient manner.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring the safety of common areas, and complying with Northview’s Health and Safety requirements
  • With a  focus on customer service, troubleshoot and prioritize work orders and handle emergency situations
  • Drywall repairs, painting prep and painting
  • Minor electrical repairs
  • Minor plumbing repairs, including boiler checks and hot water tank replacements where applicable
  • Perform water and sewer line repairs where applicable
  • Dealing with subcontract labour
  • Maintain company vehicle where applicable
  • Assisting with and or performing suite renovations and other upgrades
  • Moving furniture, equipment, materials and supplies, including clearing of vacant units
  • Maintain clean vacant lots, removal of garbage and debris from building and grounds
  • Maintain tools and equipment
  • Snow removal and ice control from all entrances/exits and walkways as required
  • Completion of suite inspections
  • Assisting with the development and implementation of preventive maintenance programs
  • Other related duties as assigned by the manager

Qualifications:

  • Able to work independently, is a self-starter an takes pride in a job well done
  • Three years previous experience in building maintenance
  • Proven ability to work productively and safely while under pressure
  • Good customer service skills and pleasant demeanor
  • An ability to speak and write English fluently
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs
  • Able to provide a criminal record check free of relevant convictions
  • Hold a valid driver’s licence  with a clean drivers abstract
  • Flexible schedule, able to work on call and weekends as needed

Benefits

    • Competitive pay
    • Extended health care including medical, dental and vision coverage
    • Life insurance, drug coverage and wellness programs
    • Discounts on rent at Northview properties
    • Vacation travel subsidization for northern employees

    About Northview

    Northview is a leading property management company operating in six provinces and two territories. We manage over 11,000 multi-residential units, 1.1 million sq. ft. of commercial space, three hotels and 200 executive suites. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve.

    As a condition of employment, all Northview employees are expected to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or can provide reason for exemption based on a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. The successful candidate will be required to demonstrate their vaccinated status or reason for exemption before they start work with Northview. Northview will review and consider requests for exemption and will accommodate where required. Personal preference is not sufficient grounds for an exemption.

    If your background matches the qualifications listed above and you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference in the communities we serve, please submit your resume in confidence to www.rentnorthview.com/about/careers. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue through the selection process will be contacted. Northview welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require a specific accommodation, please contact

    hr@northviewfund.com

    .

title: General Labour
description:
Since 1953, ALMAG has built a reputation as an industry leader in extruding high-visual, tight tolerance, complex, thin-walled, lightweight and precision aluminum extrusions. Pushing the limits of industry standards, ALMAG is capable of providing Solutions to some of the most complex designs by combining its skills, knowledge and experience with engineering to deliver best in class, quality Solutions with the industry’s shortest lead times.

We are growing and looking for energetic and dedicated people to join the ALMAG team. If you are energized by a fast pace work environment where every day presents new experiences and challenges, explore a career with ALMAG.

We are looking for Night Shift General Laborer’s (Packers) to work in our packing department. As a Packer, you will work in pairs to inspect and pack finished goods, placing the final touch of quality and customer service on all of our products before they are shipped to our customers.

This position starts at a base rate of $17.50 an hour with a $1.00 shift premium.

During your first year at ALMAG you have the potential for regular increases after 3 and 6 months of service and an ongoing annual increase during your career. We offer our employees a competitive benefits package after 3 months of service, a health care spending account after 1 year of service and a lucrative profit sharing program after 13 months of service.

What you will be doing

  • Double checking material before it is packed to ensure final quality, count and weight
  • Partner with your team and supervisor to pack material according to priority and customer need
  • Use tools, box makers, banding, tape, box knives etc. to custom build high quality cardboard packaging for a wide variety of custom made extrusions
  • Utilize our inhouse software to review and record data as well as print labels for outgoing material
  • Partner with your colleagues and Supervisor to ensure a safe work environment by following safety procedures and reporting concerns immediately

What you bring to the table

  • You have 1 or more years of experience working in a warehouse or industrial environment
  • You have some high school education; a high school diploma or GED is an asset
  • You can communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal
  • You have a command of basic math skills and an ability to take and read precision measurements
  • You are familiar with using computers and computer programs like Microsoft Office
  • You are comfortable lifting up to 30lbs repetitively during your shift

We offer a full and competitive benefits package after 3 months of service including:

  • Profit sharing
  • Health care spending account
  • Education assistance program
  • Health and dental
  • Life AD&D
  • Long-term disability
  • Critical illness insurance
  • Gym memberships
  • Wellness programs
  • Monthly social committee activities

title: Carpenter / Drywall / Home Improvement Professional
company: Mr. Handyman of Burnaby and New Westminster
description:
Are you seeking independence?  Have you worked hard to acquire the skills and experience of a professional, do quality work, get great customer feedback, and yet still feel unappreciated today?  Are you ready to be supervised like an adult; working independently with customers to complete their projects, while still working as part of a high performing team?Do you want more control of your compensation beyond working more hours, or days, in a week?  Would you like most weekends off?  Do you love the craft side of this business, but realize the ‘back office’ headaches of going independent – including lead generation, websites, non-stop estimating – are not your strengths or how you want to spend your time?At Mr. Handyman we’ve built this business with you in mind.  At Mr. Handyman you’ll focus your time and energy on your current customer.  The office staff manages the marketing, answers calls and qualifies leads, books jobs, schedules work and deals with insurance and paperwork.We hire seasoned professionals and then treat them as such.  Most of the homes you visit in a given week are pre-qualified jobs to be worked.  We’re not running the tires off your vehicle chasing estimates.  You’re working and getting paid.Our office and in-home staff work as a team to deliver a consistent and remarkably better customer experience to everyone we serve. Check us out online and you’ll find we have a great reputation, which keeps us (and you) busy.   We're looking for an experienced, motivated and organized home improvement professional that can work directly with customers to successfully complete current projects and open doors to future projects.
Specific Responsibilities/ Job Requirements

  • Deliver a consistent & remarkably better customer experience when working in their home

title: Skilled Labourers
description:
Skilled Labourers
This is a physically and mentally challenging position involving heavy lifting, hard work, solid people skills, willingness to take direction and a desire to perform requested duties with a focus on safety and appropriate precautions.

Requirements:
  • Must pass a pre-employment Drug & Alcohol Test
  • Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Class 5 driver’s license with clean drivers abstract
  • Comprehension and compliance of all safety procedures
  • A disciplined work ethic and ability to take initiative as well as accept direction
  • Remain alert, and maintain a high level of concentration along with problem solving skills
  • Have good judgement and the ability to react quickly
  • Capable of working in both a team and individual environment
  • Physically fit and capable of long hours
  • Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
Duties:
  • Must have a good handle on the use of power and hand tools (drills, impacts, wrenches, etc).
  • General unbolting and bolting back up
  • Removing and re-installing PSV’s
  • Installing and removing Pancakes
  • Setting up air movers
  • Removing and installing valves
  • General clean up

Valid H2S Alive and First Aid safety courses would be an asset
Ability and certification operating small equipment such as forklift and skid-steer would also be an asset.

The Company:
If you are energetic and excited to work as part of a team, focused on completing each job to the highest standards and want to contribute your skills and experience then we want to hear from you!
We thank all applicants in advance for your interest in Torque Industrial Ltd, and this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Labourer
description:
ROLE
The Labourer is responsible for performing general construction activities.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Perform various general construction activities such as:
    • Set up and install trench boxes.
    • Erect and take down skid piles.
    • Erect fencing (t-posts and snow fencing).
    • Assist with stringing activities.
    • Assist with lowering in activities.
    • Manual material handling.
    • Operate hand and power tools.
    • Clean and prepare sites.
    • Unload and set up traffic controls and safety equipment.
    • Perform spotting for various types of equipment as well as overhead powerlines.
Note: In addition to these duties personnel are required to carry out such other duties as may be reasonably required in order to support the objectives of the company.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Qualifications
  • Various safety tickets/certificates as required depending on project.
Experience
  • Previous work experience in the pipeline construction industry would be an asset.
Skills and Knowledge
  • Knowledge of pipeline construction industry is considered an asset.
  • Knowledge of workplace safety requirements and procedures.
  • Knowledge of handling hazardous materials and industry waste.
  • Good vision and hand-eye coordination.
  • Physically able to lift and handle heavy objects.
  • Manual dexterity.
WORKING CONDITIONS
This position is field based and often works within remote project locations. Travel and/or living in temporary accommodations is required.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS
The Labourer reports to the Foreman of his/her crew. The position has no supervisory duties.

title: Nutrien Redwater: Scaffolder Journeyman and Apprentice (Redwater, AB)
description:
SCAFFOLDER - APPRENTICES AND JOURNEYPERSON: Local Drive-in position

Shift is 5x10


MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Must have a previous Scaffolding experience.
  • Valid certification from an accredited apprenticeship board.
  • Must be able to work for 8 hours at a time in an environment where temperatures may reach from 0 to 60° C, both indoors and outdoors in the sun.
  • Work in an environment in which vibrations and noise are moderate to severe and noise level may require the wearing of hearing protection devices.
  • Must be able to work in confined spaces for 4-7 hours per day; stand or walk for long periods.
  • Able to wear a full-face respirator for extended periods.
  • Climb and maintain balance on ladders and scaffolding at extreme heights.
  • Stoop, kneel, crouch and crawl.
  • Lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 pounds often and occasionally up to 100 pounds.
  • Maintain footing on surfaces which are sometimes slippery.
  • See well (naturally or with correction) and distinguish colors.
  • Hear well (naturally or with hearing aid).
  • Must be able to effectively communicate with other employees and supervision.
  • Use arms and hands to reach for, handle, and feel objects; and coordinate well the use of hands or fingers and eyes.
  • Must have reliable transportation to and from the work location.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
  • Must comply with all safety regulations of Brock Canada.
  • Ensures that work is performed in accordance with Contractor Specifications and/or as directed by the Contractor’s Representative.
  • Ensures they are following the applicable Contractor’s Safety Procedures, OH&S, Provincial and/or Contractor’s safety requirements.
  • Assures that the proper materials, tools and equipment is being used for the specified tasks.
  • Reads specifications, such as blueprints and data, to determine requirements.
  • Able to install steel pipes, support braces and clamps to form bases for scaffolds.
  • Able to dismantle scaffold upon job completion.
  • Can identify the type of scaffolding material to be used for the job (frame, tube & clamp, system).
  • Able to thoroughly describe scaffolding materials.
  • Sort and organize material
  • Able to count and place orders for material
  • Required to complete safety paperwork such as FLRA’s, Start Cards, etc.
  • Other duties as assigned

Department: Operations
This is a non-management position
This is a contract position

description:

title: General Laborer
description:
Are you an enthusiastic, driven, and passionate individual? Do you want to make money this summer and get jacked doing so?

If you answered yes to those questions, then this is a perfect opportunity for you! 

BB Window Cleaning is one of the Student Works franchises. We operate in Courtice, Bowmanville, Newcastle, and, Cobourg. We offer our clients Window Cleaning, Eavestroughs Cleaning, and Pressure Washing services. We offer a welcoming and positive environment for all of our employees. Apply today to be part of an incredible team of individuals.

Currently hiring for full-time work from May 1st - August. Flexible, full-time work for the summer.

What this job does for you:

  • $17-$25/hr starting wage means great earning potential

  • Leadership opportunities as a crew chief or production manager

  • Muscles you never thought you had will show up to say hello
  • Employee-centric team environment
  • As many hours as you can work
  • We hire for attitude, not experience. Although experience is an asset

Looking for: enthusiastic, hardworking students from the ages of 17-25 with access to a vehicle. If you want to have a fantastic summer and make great money while doing it, apply to get jacked and clean some houses while you're at it.

title: Carpenter / Handyman
company: Mr. Handyman of Toronto N Richmond Hill Markham W
description:
For over 20 years, we've consistently hired reliable, customer service-focused employees who are both knowledgeable and skilled. They are experienced in many areas of handyman repair and they know the value of building relationships with our clients. Our team of qualified experts live our code of values of Respect, Integrity, and Customer Focus while having fun in the process!

As Handyman/Carpenter, you are a key member of our team responsible for quality repairs, remodeling, and home improvement projects. You will build customer relationships and uphold our standard for excellent customer service. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.

You have a strong background of skilled tradesman experience and have proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.  You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines.

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Complete small to medium repairs, remodeling, and home improvement projects
  • Communicate with customers about scope of work and cost estimates
  • Insure the efficient use of materials and maintain adequate stock of necessary equipment
  • Collect payment and/or payment information from customers for work performed
  • Keep company vehicle and equipment properly serviced, clean, and in good working order and condition
  • Complete invoices, daily route sheets, and weekly reports as required
  • Perform other duties as needed which may include cross-training in related positions

Job Requirements:

  • Skilled tradesman with 15+ years of experience in home maintenance/repair and remodeling
  • Strong carpentry background
  • Must have own tools fit for many job types
  • Proficiency to navigate tablet based technology
  • Team player who can work independently

Benefits: Dental/Drug after 6 months (Sunlife Financial)

title: General Labourer (Night Shift)
description:
General Labourer (Night Shift)

Apply now »



Date:Apr 29, 2022


Location: Toronto, ON, CA


Company: RailWorks




Job ID: 13542


Position Summary





The Labourer will be reporting to the Foreman/Superintendent. The Electrical Labourer performs all necessary inspections, tests, and maintenance on his assigned territory as well as assisting other Maintainers as required. The work is physically demanding and performed outdoors in a field environment, near live track.





Job Responsibilities/Duties






+ Maintain tools and equipment in ready-for-service condition.


+ Perform all periodic inspection and tests as per railway and PNR standards.


+ Perform special duties as assigned by the Supervisor.


+ Work cooperatively with other maintainers on technical issues and troubleshooting.


+ Perform general labour tasks as necessary including operating equipment.


+ Comply with railway and PNR safe work practices and signal work procedures.


+ Other Duties as assigned






Qualifications






+ 3-5 years of experience in Construction


+ Diploma or experience with electrical an asset


+ Experience in Signals & Communications field experience an asset


+ Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions






Physical Requirements






+ Work is outdoors in all weather conditions.


+ Exposure to live track/trains and high voltage.


+ Work is safety sensitive and protective equipment is required.









All successful applicants must be in compliance with PNR RailWorks Inc. Mandatory COVID Vaccination Policy, which will be provided prior to hire.








All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with PNR RailWorks without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by law.


PNR RailWorks Inc. is committed to fostering an equitable, accessible, and inclusive workplace. As such, PNR RailWorks Inc. will ensure reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process, including the interview. If selected for an interview, requests for accommodation can be confidentially made to a member of the recruitment team who will arrange in advance for reasonable and appropriate accommodation for fair and equitable assessment throughout the process.


All successful applicants must be in compliance with PNR RailWorks Inc. Mandatory COVID Vaccination Policy, which will be provided prior to hire.

title: Carpenter - Residential / Light Commercial
description:
To meet the demands of our rapidly growing base of satisfied customers, Drops::AccountDrop is seeking an experienced carpenter.  This skilled craftsman would ideally have a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work.  Our customers love us!  We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

What You Will Receive

  • Earn $30-45/hour or up to $1,900/week, depending on your skills and availability
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking, billing
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well-qualified customers
  • Branded apparel and signage
Responsibilities

The Carpenter performs and coordinates the cutting, shaping and installation of building materials during the construction, remodeling or repair in a residential and light commercial setting. You must have experience as a residential carpenter, and you must have a positive attitude.

  • Constructing, installing, and repairing structures and fixtures of various types of wood, plywood and wallboard.
  • Ability to determine and clearly identify proper materials and material quantities for new and existing projects.
  • Evaluate customer requests, price projects, troubleshoot customer issues and present a description of a work order to a customer.
Requirements

  • Must have current Driver's License and submit to a background check
  • Must have tools, vehicle and good references
  • Must have experience in the remodelling or home repair trades
  • Must pass a screening process
  • Independent Contractors must carry liability insurance and workers comp
  • Must have a smartphone and access to the internet
Please, no Project Managers or those whose experience is primarily New Construction.

Ready to Learn More?

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.

What our customers say:

Watch More

Why Handyman Connection?

title: Labourer
description:
Labourers with Cando perform a variety of railway related tasks. Working for the Transload department, the Labourer ensures safety is a high priority at all times and procedures are respected and followed.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Perform general labouring tasks around the rail yard for Central Manitoba Railway
  • Work in teams of two (2) to load 100lb bags of various product
  • Use any necessary tools safely and efficiently
  • Participate in daily job briefings
  • Learn and operate equipment as required
  • Advise when services are needed on equipment; perform daily maintenance on equipment

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities

  • Able to work as a team player and take direction from foremen and supervisors
  • Be physically fit with the ability to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Understand, record, and apply oral and written instructions; document work activities, and prepare required reports or work orders
  • Mechanically inclined; capable of performing troubleshooting and maintenance
  • Willingness to adapt to new technological changes and improvements and participate in training and self-development programs
  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions

Education & Experience

  • Ability to pass and maintain clean drug and alcohol testing
  • Hold and maintain a valid driver's license   

Note: This description is not intended to limit the assignment of work or be construed as a complete list of the many duties to be performed by the incumbent. The qualifications are provided so interested candidates understand the level of expertise required in this position.

title: GENERAL LABOURER
description:
Job Description

You’ve probably seen quite a few positions as labourer, but being one at EACOM Sullivan, a subsidiary of INTERFOR, means having both hands in something bigger than life. You’re going to be handling wood and more wood. Keeping a close eye on everything that’s going on will help you keep the yard and the mill clean and tidy. We’ll be relying on you to keep everything in its place and running smoothly. You’ll be making a living in a job with us, in our sawmills rooted in northern regions of Ontario and Québec. You’ll discover that they transform much more than wood – they enhance our communities!

Are you hard-working and resourceful? Are you effective at moving into action? Come and see EACOM. We’ll bend over backwards to make things work. The team awaits you.

What you’ll actually be doing:

  • Fastening bundles of raw wood for drying outside;
  • Redoing and stacking bundles of raw or planed wood in the yard;
  • Cleaning up the yard and the mill;
  • Managing sawdust indoors and outdoors;
  • During halts in work, cleaning in places that are inaccessible during operations;
  • Handling related tasks (this may make you nervous, but you’ll learn plenty of new things that will serve you well).

What do you need to succeed with us?

  • Working well on a team;
  • Demonstrating self-reliance and initiative;
  • Showing vigilance and a concern for health and safety.
Qualifications

Your background will help you:

  • High school diploma, vocational diploma or equivalent;
  • Previous work at a mill is an asset;
  • Availability for day and/or night shifts;
  • Be available to work 42 hours per week;
  • Earn $ 22.87 / hour.


Additional Information

At EACOM, we’re there for you.

EACOM supports employment equity, and diversity is welcome – in fact, we encourage it! We’ll contact you if you’re selected for an interview. If you need any special accommodation, let us know. Any information you send us will be handled respectfully and in complete confidence.

title: General Labour
location: North York (Jane And Finch), ON, ON
description:
General Labour - must be able to read

We are looking for 7-10 strong individuals who are comfortable lifting 15lbs to 50lbs.

You will be responsible for lifting boxes onto the convey and labeling the boxes. Once the boxes are labeled you are required to sort the boxes on the convey to the appropriate skid for delivery.

The shift starts at 7am and ends at 4pm Monday to Friday. We have lots of overtime available.

Must be fully vaccinated, WHMIS, safety shoes and be reliable.

We will be hiring 7 individuals permanently with benefits after 3-6 months. The bus stop is right in front of the building for those concern about transportation.

title: General Labourer (12AM to 8AM)
description:
Organization: Real Food for Real Kids 

Website: www.rfrk.com 

Location: East End of Toronto, ON

Job Title: General Labourer

Shift: Tuesday-Friday, 12am-8am

Compensation: $19 per hour + premium + $2.00 (12AM-6AM)

Perks: 2 weeks vacation + 8 PAID Personal Days per year, Health Spending Account, Profit Sharing, RRSP Matching

And

Working at RFRK comes with other perks too:

  • Competitive salary

  • Employee Savings Program (RRSP/TFSA Matching)

  • Health Spending Account (after 6 months of employment)

  • RFK Discounts

Hiring Bonus: 

  • There will be a $500 bonus once you pass your 3 month probation 

Real Food for Real Kids (RFRK) is a growing company on a mission to make real food the standard rather than the exception.

A multiple award-winning company recognized for excellence and innovation, we’re a leading healthy catering company for child care centres, schools and camps. RFRK proudly serves nutritious meals and snacks to over 20,000 children throughout the Greater Toronto & Hamilton Area every day. We’ve also recently launched our Real Food Delivery service, Real Food Kitchen, to get our yummy food directly into households. 

Our Pack team is looking for a fantastic person who loves to organize and arrange food to join us as a Pack Team Member / General Labourer. If you like the sound of us so far, keep reading to see if you have the experience and skills needed for this rewarding role!

About the Role:

At the Real Food Kitchen, a team of cooks, bakers, kitchen helpers, packers, porters, and Super Drivers help to prepare, pack, and deliver nutritious and delicious meals to feed thousands of kids in the GTA. As a member of the production team, you’ll help support the production staff, and ensure that their tasks are performed effectively and to the highest possible health and safety standards. The Pack Team Member jumps in where they are needed to make sure our food gets to the kids every day.

Main responsibilities include ensuring appropriate items and quantities are packed according to the pack sheet. 

Some of the things you’ll get paid to do:

Packing

  • Pack food according to pack sheets
  • Stage and pre-kit items for pack
  • Ensure that FIFO guidelines are followed when staging, pre-kitting or packing products
  • Organize, pack and palletize frozen recipe items 
  • Conduct weekly inventory of all frozen items
  • Ensure that items being packed meet our quality standards, and bring issues to the attention of the kitchen manager 

 Assist Production Staff

  • Support all production related tasks associated with next day production
  • Assist with set-up: organizing items, weighing, and counting food items
  • Ensure that items being packed meet our quality standards, and bring issues to the attention of the production manager
  • Keep fridges and freezers organized

Clean Work Environment

  • Maintaining a clean work environment 
  • Carefully follow health and safety rules
  • Clean-up at the end of shift 

Waste Disposal

  • Disposal of waste in a proper and organized way
  • Help with waste removal
  • Help with dishwashing duties  

Other

  • Carefully follow health and safety rules
  • Carefully adhere to all Covid-19 safety and social distancing policies
  • Other duties as required
About You
  • Positive attitude, with a passion to get things done right!
  • Respect for food safety practices
  • Hard-working
  • Punctual
  • Works well in a team environment 
  • Ability to work on your feet for an 8-hour shift
  • Ability to repetitively lift a minimum of 25 kg
  • Ability to work in cold environments (-10 to 4 degrees Celsius)
  • Attention to cleanliness
  • Ability to read, write and speak English
  • Basic math skills, including: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division 
Working at RFRK comes with other perks too:
  • Competitive salary
  • Employee Savings Program (RRSP/TFSA Matching)
  • Health Spending Account (after 6 months of employment)

To apply, please upload your résumé and cover letter, including salary expectations, explaining why you’d be a great fit for this role!

Real Food for Real Kids is an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage applications from diverse backgrounds and communities. 

Real Food for Real Kids welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

No phone calls or emails, please. We’ll contact applicants that fit the bill, and invite them in for an interview. 

Thanks for your interest in Real Food for Real Kids! Copyright © 2022 Real Food for R

title: Labourer (Victoria)
description:
Kinetic Construction provides Construction Manager and General Contracting services on Vancouver Island and the Lower Mainland. “Together Building Better” is who we are, in our day to day these values operationalize as “Relationships, Passion and Continuous Improvement”. Kinetic provides a variety of project delivery methods to complete large commercial, institutional, and multi-unit residential projects for private and public clientele. The organization is 100% employee owned with offices in Victoria, Vancouver and Courtenay. We collaborate with like-minded partners to create a better industry for everyone.

Our people are the most important factor to our shared success. We provide a collaborative, caring culture and the necessary support for everyone to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you see yourself as a continuous learner, curious and driven to succeed as a team we want you to be part of our team.

We are looking for a Construction Labourer to work on projects based in Victoria. This position requires working on construction project sites, assisting the Superintendent and Skilled Tradespersons while also performing labouring activities. In this role, no day is the same! It’s a fast-paced industry and there is a positive energy in the business.

Responsibilities and Duties

Labouring duties include performing tasks involved in:

The physical labour of building a project
Operating hand and power tools of a large variety as necessary
Site preparation and clean-up

Our ideal candidate has the following skills and experience to bring to our team:

Positive, can-do attitude
Natural willingness to pitch in and do what’s needed to help get the job done
Physical capability to safely perform the work on site (i.e., lifting, carrying, standing, walking, kneeling, etc)

No Calls Please

title: Carpenter
description:
Do you like building and installing things?
Do you have experience with carpentry?
Are you looking for a PERMANENT position?
This could be your next great opportunity!

We are looking for talent that is experience in carpentry for a PERMANENT position in Wallenstein. This opportunity is available on a day shift with half days on Fridays and starting at $23/hr! This is a family owned business with a friendly environment. If you have a reliable vehicle, are looking for a permanent position and have experience with this type of work don't hesitate and apply today!

Advantages
- $23/hr
- Straight day shift 7am - 5 pm on Monday to Thursday and half days on Friday!!
- PERMANENT position
- Small family-oriented environment
- Friendly environment
- Immediate start!

Responsibilities
- Building shacks
- Trim carpentry
- Painting
- Window installs
- Install metal doors and frames and all applicable hardware
- Other duties as assigned


Qualifications
- High attention to detail
- Reliable vehicle and able to travel to Wallenstein
- You take pride in your work
- Willingness to learn new skills and improve
- In the off season you would be trained to manufacture wood products

Summary
Perks of working with Randstad:

- Paid Weekly + 4% Vacation Pay Added
- We offer a competitive benefits package, available to you on your first day!

If you are interested in this opportunity, review how to apply.

How to apply:
1) Respond directly to this job posting
2) Apply at www.randstad.ca and follow up with a phone call an hour afterward to 519.772.0181 X1 and ask for Lashauna or Jackie

You can also email lashauna.mcbean@randstad.ca or jackie.kurtz@randstad.ca

Our services will never be at a cost to you. Registration with Randstad offers you the benefit of our industry knowledge and client database which spans across many industries.

Randstad Waterloo is committed to helping you tackle the challenges and take advantage of promising career opportunities. Connect with us today to learn more about the many positions we have to offer at Waterloo Randstad.

Ask us about our new MyRandstad app, or our text notifications, which send automatic alerts about new opportunities that you can accept or decline depending on your availability.

Lashauna
Jackie

Phone Number:
519.772.0181 x1

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: General Labourer
description:
Do you have experience troubleshooting and thinking on your feet? Are you looking to support and involve yourself with a high-energy, devoted team? Do you have a passion for building things and helping people? Most importantly, are you looking for a chance to grow and develop with a company that has your back? If you answered yes to any of these questions, you should keep reading to learn more about this exciting opportunity!

With the rapid growth of The Canadian Brewhouse, we are looking for a high energy physically fit labourer to join the #BrewCrew! Candidates will report to the site supervisor and assist in different tasks within the construction of our upcoming locations.

 

Requirements:

  • Ability to lift heavy objects, walk and stand for long periods of time and perform strenuous physical labor
  • Valid class 5 drivers license
  • Adequate hand tool skills
  • Ability to operate required equipment in a safe and responsible manner
  • Comfortable working in all weather conditions
  • Effective verbal and listening communications skills

 

Some of the benefits of joining the Brew Crew: 

  • Competitive pay and perks based on experience
  • A company healthcare spending account that covers:
    • Dental Care
    • Vision Care
    • Extended Healthcare
  • Consistent 40 hours per week
  • Paid Vacation
  • Friendly, fun and supportive colleagues
  • In-house discounts â€“ bring your family and friends, show off your workplace!
  • Advancement opportunities are endless with the right attitude and passion - our CEO started out as a dishwasher!
  • Working with a team of like-minded individuals who have your interests at heart. Our team is our family - We Are Brew Crew!

 

 

Company Information

Welcome to The Canadian Brewhouse (https://youtu.be/fyKRJzJWiu4), Canada's fastest-growing independent restaurant group! We are proud of being the only Canadian-themed sports bar in town, and we know that without our incredible teams we wouldn't be a fraction of where we are today. Our teams live and breathe our Core Values; these are 6 key principles that influence all of our decisions as an organization.

  • Take Care of Each Other and Yourself
  • Think Like a Customer
  • Support Your Community
  • Hurry, Donâ€™t Rush
  • Embrace Innovation
  • Be Persistent

When not at work, you may catch us out in the community volunteering, raising funds for The Canadian Mental Health Association or the local Children's Hospital, or having a couple of drinks with friends. The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. We believe it's our duty to provide all of our employees with a safe, fun-filled work environment with endless advancement opportunities. Let us tell you more about why you should join the best team in Canada, today!

Powered by JazzHR
