title: Labourers
description:
• An excellent opportunity to start your career in a cutting-edge organization!
  • Enjoy a competitive $22 hourly wage plus overtime and other attractive benefits! 
  • Travel to various locations throughout Northern Alberta and BC! 

About White Water Management Ltd.

Whitewater Management is a cutting-edge fluids management company, started by industry leaders with decades of expertise in the industry, a great reputation, and an excellent environmental and safety record. Experts in engineering, remediation chemicals, and regulatory compliance; we handle water and industrial fluid needs for our clients, offering them the best and most flexible water management programs. 

For more information about our organization, please visit our website by clicking here.

About the Opportunity

White Water Management is currently looking to employ multiple Labourers to join our Water Transport Technician team on a full-time, casual basis. Our projects are primarily based in Chilliwack, Grande Prairie, Fort St. John, Red Deer, Fort McMurray, Prince George, and other cities throughout Northern Alberta and BC. 

Reporting to the Site Superintendent, your responsibilities and duties will include:

  • Rigging in hose lines for water transfer
  • Operating equipment (loader, skidsteer)
  • Operating, maintaining, and troubleshooting water pumps
  • Tracking water flows and water pressure
  • Building and tearing down frac ponds
  • Testing, repairing and maintaining hoses
  • Changing out equipment as needed
  • Communicating regularly with site supervisors and team members
  • Completing other related duties as assigned

More About You 

In order to qualify for this role, you will need a valid Class 5 Drivers' License, with a minimum of 3 years of off-highway driving experience with a pick-up truck, hauling a trailer or other comparable vehicle. In addition, you will need to have completed H2S Alive and First Aid training. Previous experience in the oilfield or water management industries will be considered an asset, but are not required. 

As our ideal candidate, you are safety oriented and customer focused. You have a mechanical aptitude, basic math skills, and strong communication and teamwork skills. Candidates who are reliable, self-motivated, and eager to learn are strongly encouraged to apply.

This opportunity is Veteran friendly, and we also welcome seasonal workers from the Agricultural background during off-season. 

Please note: Pre-employment illicit drug testing will be required.

About the Benefits

In exchange for your hard work and dedication, you can expect a competitive starting wage of $22 per hour plus overtime, along with:

  • Transportation to/from project sites from our depot locations in Grande Prairie & Innisfail, Alberta
  • Paid travel time while en route to and from project sites
  • Accommodations provided
  • Meals provided (or a meal allowance when away from our camps)
  • $100 boot allowance
  • Extended health, vision and dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Wellness program
  • Growth opportunities
  • Company events such as our annual Christmas party
  • The opportunity to join a friendly tight-knit team environment

If you are a collaborative team-player and this opportunity excites you, then we want to hear from you - apply today!

title: General Labourer
description:
At Samuel, Son & Co., your success is our business. As a leading metals and industrial products manufacturer, processor and distributor, we leverage our industry expertise, breadth of experience and the passion of our people to help drive success for North American business—one customer at a time. We go beyond quality, price competitiveness, reliability and service. As a strategic supplier, we work collaboratively with our customers to understand their challenges and opportunities, and to develop innovative solutions that create value and meet real business needs. Our people are the source of our strength, vitality and reputation. We are a team—always moving, improving and getting things done. We focus on doing the right thing for our customers and employees— and we never compromise our integrity. We safeguard our employees’ health and well-being, give back to our communities and demonstrate respect for the environment. Samuel, Son & Co. Because it’s not just business. It’s family. 

Here is some of what we have to offer:

  • Competitive wage: $20.61- $24.48 per hour
  • Rotating Shift: Days, Afternoons, Evenings
  • Company Paid Benefits
  • Paid Vacation 
  • Defined Contribution Pension Plan with company match 

RESPONSIBILITIES: 

  • Secure lifts with banding and packaging. 
  •  Prepare packaging materials 
  • Package material to customer specification. 
  • Replenish packaging materials. 
  • Assist in the set-up of the stacker/carousel. 
  • Help maintain safety and good housekeeping in work areas. 
  • Assist with various other duties as assigned by Operator/Foreman and train new employees as required. 
  • Wear all applicable PPE (i.e. Gloves, safety glasses, and wristlets). 

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Steel processing experience is an asset 
  • High School Diploma 
  • Forklift certification and at least 2 years experience operating a forklift 
  • Previous experience in an industrial environment 
  • Commitment to continuous improvement, and health & safety
  • Computer skills, including Microsoft Dynamics system is an asset

title: Temporary Summer Student Labourer
description:
Temporary Summer Student Labourer - (22000052)

Description

 

Compass Minerals is a leading provider of essential minerals that solve nature's challenges, including salt for winter roadway safety and other consumer, industrial and agricultural uses, and specialty plant nutrition minerals that improve the quality and yield of crops. The company produces its minerals at locations throughout the U.S. and Canada and in the U.K. Though the company’s history stretches back as far as 1844, Compass Minerals became a public company in December 2003. The company is part of the S&P MidCap 400 Index, the Russell 1000 Index and was included in Fortune magazine’s 2010 listing of the “100 Fastest-Growing Companies.” Named one of Forbes’ 100 Most Trustworthy Companies in America in 2015 and 2016, Compass Minerals’ mission is to be the best essential minerals company by delivering where and when it matters.

 

Summary:  We are currently seeking to fill a General Labourer Position which is described below. This is a Temporary Summer Student full-time position located in Amherst, NS.

Essential Job Functions:Include but are not limited to the following:  

(Management reserves the right to add or modify the duties and responsibilities at any time.)

  • General labour i.e. cleaning, painting and janitorial duties
  • Operate packaging equipment
  • Forklift and other heavy equipment operation
  • Loading bulk trucks
  • Dust collection duties
  • Sanitation related inspections and cleaning
  • Must be able to work at heights and confined spaces.
  • Shifts may vary
 

Qualifications

 

Qualifications:

  • Minimum High School Diploma, post-secondary education in a related field preferred.
  • The ideal candidate will have experience in a process-related industry, be knowledgeable about process equipment and control systems, and be flexible to different task assignments.

Education and/or Experience:

  • Minimum High School Diploma, post-secondary education in a related field preferred
  • 3 – 5 years’ experience in a warehouse environment. Preferably in a manufacturing setting
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Previous experience driving a forklift would be an asset
  • Previous experience working shift work would be an asset
  • Able to work in a warm and dusty area at times
  • Must be able to pass criminal background check and drug testing

 

Compass Minerals is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Compass Minerals is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, contact 519 524 8338 orcareers@compassminerals.com.

title: Carpenter/drywall
description:
Reports To: Operations Manager

"A mind built for excellence. A spirit built for service."
 What does a Carpenter / Drywaller with Paul Davis do?
  • Serve others within your community in their time of need
  • Make a difference for others that have had a disaster strike their property
  • Work hard and take pride in completing projects 
  • Be empathetic and show a sense of urgency. 
Why Join The Team? Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We love creating an opportunity for our team members, providing industry training, and giving technicians the opportunity to become experts in the field of restoration.

Values: Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.Vision: To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.Mission: To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.
 
 Why The Team Needs You? Serving others after a disaster has struck their property is not easy. Everyone within Paul Davis needs to have a world-class work ethic, serious attention to detail and love to help people. It is challenging to make customers happy when faced with a traumatic event but you enjoy helping them get back to their lives through your skill. Team Compensation and Benefits:
  • Leadership Development - our company grows from the inside. If you are determined and motivated enough, ask about participation in our leadership development initiative to grow your career and explore new opportunities
  • Cross-training opportunities to advance your career
  • Flex schedule - at Paul Davis we are committed to our team and their well-being. We have instituted the ability for flex hours that ensures team members get the time they need for personal matters while still being able to work full time.
  • Paid training
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Great culture and team dynamic
  • Most of our files allow for piece work.  If you can do multiple trades and you are efficient, this position is for you.
 Team Qualifications (Requirements):
  • Desire to join a world-class team and contribute a positive attitude
  • Dedication to customer service
  • Valid driver's license with a clean record
  • Have the ability to work on rotation with an on-call schedule for emergencies
  • Ability to lift 75 LBS frequently
  • Desire to continually learn new things
 Role on the Team (Job Responsibilities):
  • High-level performance of drywall, texture, and paint repairs
  • Carpentry - framing, cabinetry, roof construction, decks, and fences.
  • Focus and dedication to providing excellent customer service.
  • Maintain a clean, properly stocked, and organized truck and maintain all company equipment.
  • Be accessible by phone and participate, as necessary, in the on-call schedule as emergencies occur
  • Assist in warehousing and facility-related tasks when necessary.
  • You will assist other team members as you see opportunities arise and be a leader for the team when needed.
 Please apply if you think you have what it takes to serve others and deliver a world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.We support and hire Veterans and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!

title: Laborer
description:
With locations across Western Canada, Canada Cartage System is a recognized leader in transportation logistics delivering customized solutions for the transportation, distribution and warehousing marketplace.

Canada Cartage is seeking a hardworking Swamper to be based out a number of our lower mainland stores.

What we offer:

  • 40+ hours per week
  • Full Benefits (Health, Dental, Vision, MSP, Pension)
  • Mon - Fridays (5 days/week)
  • 8:00am start time (may vary)

Responsibilities:

  • Load, unload and move products and materials by hand or with material handling equipment
  • Work as a team
  • Help drivers route plan/navigate
  • Provide customer service where required

General Requirements/Qualifications:

  • Experience considered an asset
  • Provide a criminal background check; must be bondable
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude
  • Must be able to commute to a number of different locations across lower mainland.

Work Conditions

  • Must be able to work in a cold/hot environment; outside work
  • Physical ability to lift up to 75lb unassisted
  • Work in fast paced/physically demanding environment

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups and women

title: General Labourer
description:
Responsibilities:

  • Perform routine maintenance jobs and repairs – inside and outside
  • Move furniture, equipment and supplies
  • Empty waste containers
  • Snow clearing/salting
  • Shipping duties if required
  • Driving duties as required
  • Running Cable (Voice/Data/Video)

Qualifications:

  • Able to work without supervision in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Valid driver’s license with own transportation
  • Able to work overtime when required
  • Basic knowledge of Computers
  • High school diploma

What we Offer:

  • Employer funded benefit program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life Balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career Progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social Events and Sport Teams

Location: Burlington, ON (Only candidates located in Ontario will be considered)

About:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery. Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertz’ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers. With over 1500 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

 

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz

title: Maintenance
description:
Ã‚  :

 

Our Maintenance People,

 

As Canadaâ€™s largest residential landlord, CAPREIT prides itself on the smooth operation and safety of our properties. Our Maintenance Crew is responsible for the coordination of all major repairs and improvements necessary for a portfolio of properties. They key goal of the team is to maintain a properly functioning and inviting environment throughout the building for our staff and residents.

 

An ideal candidate for this position should have excellent communication skills, a background in building mechanics, good knowledge of painting and accessories, general HVAC/plumbing knowledge, and the ability to handle multiple jobs in an organized fashion. In order to be considered for this position, candidates must possess a means of travelling between properties throughout the day.

 

Please note that applications from all interested individuals are appreciated; however, we will only contact candidates that are selected for an interview.

 

CAPREIT values diversity in the workforce and is an equal opportunity employer.  

CAPREIT welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Labourer
description:
Looking to Start Your Driving Career? Looking to Learn New Skills? Austin Powder is seeking to add a career-minded entry-level team member! This is a full-time opportunity to handle site maintenance, manage inventory, be responsible for customer deliveries, as well as, customer support and assist the at job sites.

This position offers a competitive wage and generous benefits. Our benefits include extended health, dental, voluntary RPP, AD&D, weekly income (STD), long term disability, group life and dependent life. If this sounds like the opportunity that you've been searching for, apply for this blasting worker position today!

ABOUT AUSTIN POWDER

Austin Powder manufactures a full line of industrial explosives and provides blasting services to customers in the quarrying, mining, construction, and oil and gas industries -- all for the purpose of providing aggregate, energy, and mineral products to consumers.

Our values of commitment to safety, attention to detail, and the power of family are the very bedrock upon which our company's culture is built. We truly value our team which is why we offer competitive opportunities for career growth and advancement.

A DAY IN THE LIFE

As a Labourer, you will handle packaged explosive products, operate manufacturing vehicles on the job site (if licensed), and load and drive box trucks (if licensed). All activity is done in strict compliance with safety and company procedures. You will assist blasters load and stem blast holes prior to initiating the blast. This position involves being outside in all weather conditions, lifting and carrying 50+ pounds of product and other materials, and frequently squatting and bending as you prepare for the shot.

Safety is always a priority whether you are driving or assisting the Blaster in charge with site preparation and equipment setup. Under the direction of the Blaster in charge or Location Manager, you will inspect product bins, inventory of product, and complete required paperwork. To keep your truck and equipment running properly, you will perform both general and preventative maintenance. You will enjoy keeping busy and being on the move throughout the day.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must submit drivers abstract with resume
  • Valid Class 5 - no restrictions and desire to obtain Class 3
  • Preferred Class 3 license
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions
  • Physical ability to lift 23 kg.
  • Must meet requirements of all Provincial and Federal explosive laws and qualify as an ERD explosive possessor

Are you a self-starter that is hardworking and passionate? Do you enjoy being outdoors? Are you a dependable team player? Are you willing to learn and expand your skills? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this Labourer position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, and for inquiring about, discussing or disclosing compensation. Moreover, these regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Nutrien Carseland: Scaffolder Apprentices
description:
SCAFFOLDER - APPRENTICES : Calgary Local Drive-in position

NEW LOA $125 Daily Tax Free

SUMMARY:
A Scaffolders’ duties may vary from site to site, however the main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.
On going work in 2023 and turn around for 2024.Large project and turnaround.
4-10 hour shifts (Monday-Thursday) with Overtime after 10 hours. 

Journeyman rate: $38.46 and there is room to advance those with the right skill sets for the upcoming turn around as we will be looking to fill supervisor positions. This is also a very diversified site where can also look to pursue getting involved in other roles such equipment operating, fitting and HVAC, scaffold and insulation.

MINIMUM SAFETY TICKET REQUIREMENTS:
  • CSTS-09 
  • Fall Protection
  • Ability to pass an A&D test
If you feel you would be a good fit, please apply with your resume and safety tickets!

title: Landscape Construction Labourer (Clone)
description:
BOFFO LANDSCAPING INC.

Boffo Landscaping Inc. is a family-owned and operated landscape maintenance, construction, and snow & ice control service operation.  Established in 1996, Boffo Landscaping is now a leader in the landscape industry throughout the GTA.  Boffo has been a proud and valued member of Landscape Ontario since inception and Boffo will continue to provide exceptional services for years to come.  Boffo is currently seeking high quality, highly motivated and experienced individuals who are willing to join our Landscape Maintenance Team as a full-time position.

 



LANDSCAPING & CONSTRUCTION PROFESSIONAL

 

DEPARTMENT:                      Landscaping & Construction

 

COMMENCEMENT:                        Spring 2022   

(** Immediate positions available **)

 

SUMMARY:  Boffo Landscaping Inc. is looking for hard working, punctual, dependable and motivated individuals with an excellent work ethic.  Candidates should have a minimum of 1 year landscaping/construction experience (with flexibility for increased training).  This position is "full-time" seasonal with the potential for year-round employment & an opportunity for future growth and advancement in this field.     

 



REQUIREMENTS, FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Perform all aspects of the company's "Landscaping & Construction" Operations including: tree and shrub planting, grading, sod work, interlocking, retaining walls, natural stone work, soil/mulch installation, etc.
  • Should have knowledge, experience and capability in using various tools, equipment, and machines required for landscape construction work (for example, skid steer, backhoe, mini excavator, plate tampers, concrete saw, etc.).
  • Knowledge and hands-on competence of various plant material, aggregates, and other landscape construction materials and supplies required for project work (is an asset).
  • Perform both small and large scale landscape construction enhancements/improvements as assigned to crew unit. Ensure efficient completion of work in the allotted timeframe for each project in conjunction with Crew Foreman. 
  • Continually deliver a high standard of work and productivity with field work operations. Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and respect for customers, suppliers, and co-workers.  Effectively and safely operate crew trucks & tandem trailers, crew equipment, and machines.  Ensure safe use and operation of all equipment and machines.   
  • Must be a "team player" dedicated to achieving both crew and company goals. Perform other related duties, as assigned, that are in accordance with job responsibilities or necessary department and corporate objectives.  Must arrive to work in a timely fashion and in uniform.
  • Learn, uphold, understand, and respect the rules and regulations as outlined in the company's "Corporate Policy Manual" and "Safety Manual". Manage and enforce all safety policies and procedures.
  • Must have a high school diploma and possess minimum 1 year experience in landscaping/construction. Candidates should have a valid "G" license and a clean driving record and reliable transportation to and from work.

 

**** Opportunity for full-time, year-round employment will be available for successful candidates ****

**** $25.00-$35.00/hr depending on qualifications****

 

 

SUBMIT RESUME & CONTACT:

Boffo Landscaping Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Please submit your resume:

 

* Office:  905-832-3850                                                  Address: 12000 Keele Street, Maple, ON

* Email: careers@boffolandscaping.com                                     L6A 1S1                    

 

Note:  We would like to thank (in advance) all applicants for their resume submittal and interest; however, we will only be contacting those candidates who are selected for an interview.

title: General Labourer
description:
Job ID:  395062

 

Oldcastle BuildingEnvelope®, a CRH Company, is the leading supplier of products specified to close the building envelope. They include: custom-engineered curtain wall and window wall, architectural windows, storefront systems, doors, skylights and architectural glass.

 

We believe that working with OBE should be what you WANT to do, not just what you have to do!
We believe in relationship over transactions and casual over formal.
We strive every day to make OBE's environment like coming home.
We do this because we know that when you enjoy what you do, you just do it better!

 

Working with Oldcastle means commitment to work/life balance but also offers so much more!!
•    Health & Dental benefits 
•    4 paid flex days annually
•    6% Vacation after 3 years 
•    5% RRSP/DPSP Match
•    All PPE provided with boot allowance (we pay up to 60% to a max of $120.00 every 2 years) 
•    Cross training and advancement opportunities

 

We’re looking for motivated team players to join us as General Labourers. Please note the shift is Monday to Friday from both 7am to 3pm or 3pm to 11pm shifts, with potential overtime in busy months.

 

Job purpose
You play a critical role in our glass manufacturing process. You will work safely with the departmental team to sort, tag and move all outcoming glass product from various departments. You will check every piece to ensure it meets quality standards prior to loading and preparing for transport and report any issues to the Lead Hand or Supervisor for correction.

 

Duties and responsibilities

•    Become part of the team by communicating positively with lead-hand, co-workers, and supervisor
•    Ensure all equipment is in safe operating condition including daily PPE checks
•    Unloading glass will require crane operation and/or manual lifting of no more than 75lbs
•    Measure tempered glass for accuracy and quality; reject if incorrect and advise operator accordingly to uphold quality standards
•    Adhere tags to completed glass and place on distribution dolly based on tag location requirements
•    Select the appropriate tagged glass and load onto dolly by size and dimension to ensure all safety policies and procedures are followed
•    Use appropriate glass separators for glass type to maintain quality control
•    Helping at the load end of the furnace and in Swiping when required
•    Role will include multi-tasking in the department and cross training in different functions
•    Communicate dolly completion and move throughout the plant as required
•    Responsible for proper disposal of broken glass and general housekeeping within the department
•    Operate a forklift as required

 

Qualifications

•    Positive attitude with team orientation
•    Willingness to learn new things and cross train in new areas
•    Responsive to change in priorities and immediate demands
•    Entry level position
•    Maximum manual lifting requirement of up to 75 lbs
•    Will provide all training as required

 

Working conditions & Physical requirements

•    Must be able to consistently lift up to 75 lbs at plant location
•    Be able to maintain composure in a continuously changing environment
•    Be able to remain in an upright position for long periods of time 
•    Daily and/or weekly overtime required, not to exceed statutory legislation
 

 

What CRH Americas Offers You

 

  • Highly competitive base pay
  • Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
  • Group retirement savings program
  • Health and wellness programs
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

 

About CRH Americas

 

CRH Americas has a long and proud heritage as one of North America’s largest corporations. We are a proud reflection of the hundreds of family businesses, local and regional companies and mid to large sized enterprises that together form the CRH Americas family. CRH Americas operates with a decentralized, diversified structure, letting you work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of a large enterprise.

 

CRH Americas is a great place to grow! If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our career site. Please complete your online profile which will be sent directly to the appropriate Hiring Manager. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest in the CRH Americas family!

title: Labourers
description:
Ocean Pipeis currently looking for responsible, safe, and dependable Labourers to join our local team. As a Labourer you will support plant needs by ensuring a safe and productive work environment. In this position, you will have the opportunity to use different skills every day and fill in for vacancies in various areas of our plant.

We offer:
  • Secure, long-term employment
  • Competitive wage and benefits package
  • Training and development
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • OT available
What You Will Get to Do:
  • Operate mobile equipment on plant property (loader, haul truck, water truck, etc.)
  • Maintain cleanliness of plant work areas
  • Assist with plant tasks including lubrication, maintenance, repairs
  • Transport materials to and from storage and shop areas
  • Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental regulations, as well as company policies and procedures; assist with physical inspections of plant property/departments.
Who We Are Looking For:
  • High school diploma or GED required
  • Experience using (or ability to learn) plant mobile equipment
  • Desire to work cooperatively as part of a productive team
  • Ability to work safely, and independently without constant supervision
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Capable of learning through on the job training
  • Able to work inside and outside in year-round weather conditions
  • In good physical condition, able to lift and carry up to50 lbs., sit and stand for extended periods of time, kneel, climb ladders, and walk on varied terrain
  • Ability to work different extended hours, holidays and/or overtime required

**Lehigh Hanson is a drug free workplace. Our pre-employment process includes reference checks, medical screening, drug & alcohol testing and a drivers abstract may be required.

title: Landscape Construction Labourer
description:
We are looking for Landscape Construction Crew Members who are interested in working in the natural playground industry. As a Landscape Construction Crew Member, you will be responsible for helping to build and install natural playground components for various clients both public and private.

Minimum two years experience using tools relevant to the landscape and carpentry industry
Skidsteer and excavator experience an asset
Ability to lift at least 70 lbs
Valid G license

Preference will be given to candidates with one of the following qualifications, or more:
Applicants with examples of superb organization ability and meticulous attention to detail
Minimum of one year in cabinet making, deck building or carpentry
Chainsaw experience an asset

Daily Tasks:
Follow health and safety policies
Following directions from supervisors and executing tasks
Blueprint and site plan reading
Using machinery and power tools to build playground components
Pickups and deliveries.
Working in a team environment and meeting production deadlines

Incentives for You:
Full-time, permanent position
Winter work in our production facility - without snow removal
Competitive salary
Training and development opportunities
Workwear provided
Comprehensive bonus program
Overtime pay after 44hrs/wk

title: Construction Labourer
description:
Year-round employment

Overtime available

Opportunity to advance

Competitive hourly wage

Benefits (medical and dental)

Retirement Savings Plan

Craft training on residential, architectural and landscape projects

To apply, visit http://careers.calibreconcrete.ca/apply

Company Profile

Calibre Concrete was originally founded in 1997 as John's Concrete Forming. In 2014, John's Concrete Forming re-branded as Calibre Concrete to better represent the type of service and product offered in order to produce perfectly crafted concrete while functioning as a valuable partner in larger industrial, commercial, and residential projects.

Position Summary

Reporting to the Foreman, the Labourer will work with the team and crew, to perform concrete construction work and assist the Foreman and/or Lead Hand with other duties as required or assigned.

Key Duties and Responsibilities

  • Work with the assigned team/crew to complete tasks and fulfill project requirements
  • Help motivate the team or crew on the job site to perform work in an efficient manner
  • Assist in forming and pouring of concrete footings, walls, slabs, floors and stairs (commercial, residential and landscape)
  • Assemble and disassemble form work and place/tie rebar per drawings and scope
  • Assist with foundation and anchor bolt layout
  • Pour and finish concrete as required
  • Operate equipment if proper training/licensing has been obtained (i.e. skid steer, mini excavator etc.)
  • Build custom forms when required
  • Track and report materials/inventory taken from yard
  • Must be flexible and available to work overtime and Saturdays as required
  • Pre-trip inspections as required
  • Own transportation to Calibre yard
  • Participate in the training of employees
  • Comply with Calibre Concrete’s H&S Policy & OHSA, PPE requirements

Position Specifications (Qualifications)

Education / Knowledge / Experience

  • High School diploma or GED if applicable; post-secondary education is an asset
  • Experience in building construction is an asset
  • Experience operating construction equipment is an asset (i.e. skid steer, mini excavator etc.)
  • Knowledge of construction materials, methods and equipment is an asset
  • Experience reading construction drawings is an asset
  • WHMIS certificate
  • Working at Heights training certificate
  • Knowledge of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and safe work practices

Skills and Abilities

  • Mathematically inclined
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong communication skills; listening, oral, written and read
  • Good manual dexterity including ability to use small to mid-sized hand tools
  • Good judgement and self-motivated
  • Valid driver’s license, clean driver’s abstract and own transportation are required as is the ability to drive a company truck and be covered by fleet insurance
  • Ability to read a map and deal with traffic

Personal Attributes

  • Patient and tactful
  • Personable, reasonable and approachable
  • Positive attitude

Environment / Working Conditions

Work Environment

  • Construction work sites
  • Work outside in all weather conditions; must be able to endure outdoor environment (extreme cold and heat)
  • Company truck

Physical Demands

  • Ability to stand, walk, climb, stretch, bend, crouch, kneel, squat, push, pull, reach, and grasp
  • Driving in all weather and traffic conditions
  • Ability to lift and carry 100 pounds frequently and on a daily basis

Compensation

  • Paid Hourly
  • Benefits
  • Retirement Savings

Check out some of the work we do at www.calibreconcrete.ca https://www.instagram.com/calibreconcrete/

To apply, visit http://careers.calibreconcrete.ca/apply

We thank you for your expressed interest and wish to inform that only successful candidates will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $18.00-$25.00 per hour

title: Carpenter – Residential / Light Commercial
description:
Carpenter – Residential / Light Commercial

We have year-round work with over 50% repeat/referral customer base and are seeking experienced Craftsmen and Technicians with a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company serving (INSERT City/Metro Area/County/Local geographic reference) with excellent customer service and quality work

What You Will Receive

  • Earn $40-45/hour or up to $1,200/week, depending on your skills and availability
  • Work as an Independent Contractor or an Employee - part-time or full-time - on your own schedule
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking, billing
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers
  • Branded apparel and signage

Responsibilities

The Carpenter performs and coordinates the cutting, shaping and installation of building materials during the construction, remodeling or repair in a residential and light commercial setting. You must have experience as a residential carpenter, and you must have a positive attitude.

  • Constructing, installing, and repairing structures and fixtures of wood, plywood and wallboard.
  • Ability to determine and clearly identify proper materials and material quantities for new and existing projects.
  • Evaluate customer requests, price projects, troubleshoot customer issues, and present a description of a work order to a customer.

Requirements

  • Must have current Driver's License and submit to a background check
  • Must have tools, vehicle and good references
  • Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades
  • Must pass screening process
  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet

We are always looking to speak with an experienced handyman or craftsman who has experience as a Remodeler, Carpenter, Electrician, Plumber, Painter, Mason, or Installer or any skilled tradesman (apprentice, journeyman or master level) from the residential or commercial construction industry. Please, no Project Managers or primarily New Construction.

Ready to Learn More?

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.

What our customers say:

Watch More

Why Handyman Connection?

title: Skilled Construction Worker
description:
Are you looking for a job where you can put your physical strength, stamina, and team-player attitude to work for you? Our growing company is looking for an experienced construction worker to help lead our on-site crews. Previous job-site experience is required and an understanding of construction methods, BC Building Code, tools, and equipment. You’ll work with a team of other skilled laborers and tradesmen to bring construction plans to life. If you have a strong work ethic, a good track record of attendance and punctuality, and are ready to take your construction skills to the next level, please apply today!

Compensation:

$30 - $35 hourly

Responsibilities:
  • Carry, load, and unload tools and building materials such as sheetrock, saws, lumber, tile, grout, etc.
  • Run hand tools, power tools, and heavy equipment such as survey equipment, jackhammers, and forklifts as required

  • Punctuality
  • Strong communication skills
  • Assigning and explaining tasks onsite
  • Supervising the company's unskilled and semi-skilled workers, and subcontractors onsite in conjunction with the Project Manager
  • Performing all carpentry duties required, including both rough and finish carpentry, ICF Forming, and exterior façade work
  • Manage on-site tools and equipment and keep an accurate inventory
  • Regular updates to the Project Manager
  • Willingness to keep learning
Qualifications:
  • Possess a valid drivers license
  • Solid mechanical skills are needed, as are good eye-hand coordination and depth perception
  • Able to work in inclement weather like extreme temperatures, rain, etc.

  • The ability to read, understand and interpret blueprints
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Effective communication skills
  • Critical thinking
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Good Understanding of safety policies, and safe work practices
  • Strong leadership skills
  • Positive attitude and great interpersonal skills
  • Ability to walk, stand, crouch, and carry out strenuous physical tasks.
  • Ability to work in a variety of weather conditions
  • Previous experience with ICF is an asset
  • Basic hand tools
  • Safety Boots
About Company

Sharpshooter Group is a diverse company that is involved in a variety of projects and ventures including but not limited to new residential construction, ICF building, land development, the subdivision of property, commercial development, and renovations. We are striving to build a team of like-minded people who support our Core Values. 


  • Connection – We are uncompromising in the belief that relationships outweigh all
  • Integrity – We do the right things, even when no one is watching
  • Gratitude – We value blessings and trials for the growth they develop
  • Ingenuity – We open opportunities that people thought were closed or did not know existed

title: CHARPENTIER - MENUISIER
description:
Bâtir et grandir ensemble!

Animés par la passion, motivés par l'excellence et le développement de nos équipes, nous réalisons des projets de constructions d'envergure. Depuis plus de 10 ans, nous sommes une entreprise qui choisit continuellement de placer l'humain au cœur de nos actions. Chez Unigesco, nous créons des expériences exceptionnelles pour nos clients, nos collaborateurs et surtout, nos employés. 

Unigesco grandit.  Vous souhaitez vous joindre à une organisation qui vous offre un milieu de vie des plus stimulants et qui multiplie les opportunités de dépassement tout en priorisant le développement de vos talents? Travailler chez Unigesco, c'est choisir une entreprise authentique et collaborative qui vous offre une flexibilité dans la gestion de vos horaires et qui prône la conciliation et l'équilibre entre le travail et votre vie personnelle/familiale.

Joignez-vous à la grande famille unigescoise et bâtissez votre projet de carrière avec nous!

POSTE : MENUISIER

*Le poste est ouvert aux hommes et aux femmes, le masculin est utilisé pour éviter d'alourdir le texte.

  • Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un menuisier capable de travailler en équipe à un rythme soutenu sur des projets commerciaux, institutionnels et industriels.
  • Le candidat doit être autonome, débrouillard et polyvalent.
  • Il doit être compétent et flexible pour accomplir des tâches très variées tel que le système intérieur, pose de portes et quincaillerie, travaux de finition et même de la démolition de temps à autre.
  • Historiquement, nos menuisiers travaillent à temps plein toute l'année, nous offrons donc une opportunité de travail permanent et en continu.

Attitude et aptitudes

  • Passionné par l'industrie de la construction
  • Travaillant
  • Débrouillard
  • Organisé
  • Positif
  • Ponctuel

Qualification et expérience

  •  Charpentier menuisier détenant ses cartes CCQ

title: General Labourer
description:
Description:


Aerotek is currently hiring General Labourers to fill a role for a manufacturer in Ayr, Ontario. They manufacture pre-cast concrete for the construction industry. Most of what they produce is concrete pipe.


Responsibilities:


Contractors will start their days by checking in with their team leads. More often than not they'll start by cleaning and prepping equipment, that includes scraping dried mix off forms and oiling machines, adding reinforcements where necessary. They'll also be asked to do some painting, using a stencil just spray painting the necessary logos. They will also be sweeping and shoveling to keep the facility clean.


Qualifications:


+ Minimum 6 months experience in physical role (ideally construction). Where they were lifting 50 lbs., constantly on their feet.

+ Ability to lift 50 lbs. without assistance


Nice to Have;


+ Experience with industrial forklift or overhead cranes can earn higher pay

+ Concrete experience

+ Experience with power tools


Working Conditions:


They run a straight day shift and a straight night shift. However, each shift has two different start times.


+ Days (5am-7am/2:30pm-4:30pm) *Must be open to starting at both times but will usually start at 7am*

+ Nights (1am/2am- 10:30/11:30am)


Environment:


+ The facility is heated so warm in the winter but very hot in the summer.

+ Production floor is kept clean but it’s concrete mix, there's dust and mix on the ground. You'll get it on your hands and clothes everyday.

+ Forms are constantly being washed so they do everything they can to keep the place as clean as they can.

+ Teams of 3-8 depending on department.


Benefits:


Only applicable once hired on perm...


+ Benefits (full coverage, dental, health)

+ RSP matching after 2 years.

+ Annual boot allowance.

+ Annual bonus (profit sharing).


À propos d'Aerotek:


Notre monde nous tient à cœur. Reconnu Best of Staffing MD par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aerotek MD Inc. se distingue comme chef de file du recrutement et en de la dotation de personnel grâce à sa grande compréhension des liens entre le talent et les affaires. Étant donné qu'Aerotek est un partenaire stratégique de plus de 18 000 clients et 300 000 employés contractuels chaque année, son approche axée sur les gens lui permet d'offrir un avantage concurrentiel à ses clients et des emplois gratifiants à ses employés contractuels. Aerotek, dont le siège social est à Hanover, au Maryland, exploite un réseau de plus de 250 bureaux non franchisés, comptant plus de 8 000 employés internes dévoués à servir nos clients. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Pour en savoir davantage, consultez le site aerotek.com/fr-ca.


About Aerotek:


We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com.


The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: General Labourers
description:
Company Description

Bionera and its parent company, PRT Growing Services, are the leaders in establishing and managing large-scale woody biomass plantations to help solve energy, waste management and environmental issues.

We offer a range of short rotation willow crop services that are ideally suited to municipal and industrial operations, including establishment and maintenance of short-rotation willow crop plantation. Together, with our associates in the environmental consulting and irrigation industries, we can provide low-risk, turn-key solutions for disposal of municipal and industrial waste, including biosolids and wastewater.

Job Description

We are currently looking for temporary labourers to work on willow plantation establishment and maintenance. This engaging, high paced, physical position offers a safe work environment, on job training and an opportunity for growth and career development.

What a position with Bionera offers:

·         Duties will be to assist with land reclamation project: planting willow shrubs

·         Work will start in early to mid-May and will last for 3-6 weeks, depending on weather conditions

·         Salary: $20 /hour

·         Potential for ongoing work in plantation management through the summer

Qualifications

What you need for a position with Bionera:

·         Energetic with attention to detail

·         Positive attitude, punctual, reliable and a team player

·         Work is meticulous, repetitive, and requires good eyesight, manual dexterity and good physical condition

·         You will stand or walk for lengthy periods of time, repetitive lifting, (light to medium weight willow bundles), and perform repetitive movements

·         Must be prepared to work in outdoor elements

·         Appropriate attire required (raingear, sunglasses, CSA approved steel toed footwear, water)

·         Hard hat and hi-visibility vest will be provided

·         Reliable transportation to Paintearth Mine is essential



Additional Information

Location:

Westmoreland Paintearth Mine. candidates will be required to meet (marshalling point) at Westmoreland Paintearth Mine near Forestburg, AB.

About Bionera:

We offer a range of short rotation willow crop services that are ideally suited to municipal and industrial operations, including:

o    Establishment and maintenance of short-rotation willow crop plantation

Together, with our associates in the environmental consulting and irrigation industries, we can provide low-risk, turn-key solutions for disposal of municipal and industrial waste, including biosolids and wastewater.

How to Apply:

4 – 5 positions available

Please submit a resume through the Career Page of prt.com

 Applications will be accepted until April 31, 2022. To learn more about Bionera, please visit: www.bionera.com

Thank you for applying; however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Laborer
description:
Laborer - ( 22006727 )

Primary Location : Canada-Ontario-Kingston

Flexible Work Location Acceptable: : No

Shift : Day

Travel : No

FLSA Status : Non-exempt

Job : Labor General/Skilled/Trade

Equal Opportunity Employer

What is the value of a WM job?

The value of a WM job is more than a paycheck. It’s one way to create opportunities for you and your family.

We Are People First: We foster an environment where all teammates feel welcomed, valued and seen

We Are Committed to Growth: Training and progressive opportunities for professional development

We Are Stable: Our employees are at home every day and doing essential and meaningful work

We Are Investing in You: Competitive compensation, significant benefits, people first and much more!

Who are we? #WeAreWM

_Ready to roll with us?_ Click Apply to join the Waste Management team today.

I. Job Summary

Performs a variety of general manual labor tasks under direct supervision.

Salary: 18.41$/h

II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned.

+ Performs general manual labor tasks including, but not limited to,

+ lifting and moving materials,

+ loading and unloading vehicles,

+ digging and refilling holes,

+ and other activities in a helping or assisting mode.

+ Conducts other duties and tasks as assigned.

III. Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory duties.

IV. Qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.

A. Education and Experience

+ Education: None required.

+ Experience: No prior work experience required.

B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements

+ Licenses as required by Local, State, Federal, Environmental and/or Health/Safety Regulatory agencies.

C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required

+ None required.

V. Work Environment

Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. _Reasonable accommodations may be made_ to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

+ Required to use motor coordination with finger dexterity (such as keyboarding, machine operation, etc) occasionally;

+ Required to exert physical effort in handling objects less than 75 pounds most of the work day;

+ Required to be exposed to physical occupational risks (such as cuts, burns, exposure to toxic chemicals, etc) occasionally;;

+ Required to be exposed to physical environment which involves dirt, odors, noise, weather extremes or similar elements occasionally;

+ Normal setting for this job is: manual labor.

Benefits

At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, company pension, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site.

If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click "Apply."

_Waste Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Waste Management welcomes and encourages applications from candidates with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process. If you require disability-related accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact Careers at_ _Careers@wm.com_

title: Landscape Construction Operator/Laborer
description:
Why CSL? 

CSL Group is a dynamic family-based company committed to its employees. We are a growing company with a fantastic reputation and are searching for new team members to grow and develop. If you are looking for a career, not just a job, we offer exciting growth and advancement opportunities. All employees at CSL are committed to our company values (SHARING - Safety, Humility, Accountability, Respect, Integrity, Nurturing, Growth). If working for a company that is committed to upholding its SHARING values excites you, please apply today! 

Job Duties:

  • Coordinate and monitor day-to-day operations â€“ direct activities of Landscape Construction Labourers as per work orders.
  • Responsible for short-term (day-to-day and weekly) planning and keeping operations managers aware of decisions being made.
  • Adhere to CSL Group Ltd. policies and procedures; lead by example, complying with safety regulations and maintaining clean and orderly work areas.
  • Complete all necessary reports and records related to Aspire and SiteDocs â€“ JSAâ€™s, Toolbox Talks, etc.
  • Report vehicle defects, accidents, or damage to vehicles/equipment.
  • Report defective material and report those and any unusual situations to Operations Manager.
  • Perform regular preventive maintenance on machines and equipment.
  • Operate hand and power tools, as well as heavy equipment related to Construction work.
  • Experienced in concrete installation such as: smoothing, sealing, etc..
  • Utilize pumps, compressors, and generators to provide power for tools, machinery, and equipment, or to heat and move materials such as asphalt.
  • Dig ditches or trenches, backfill excavations, compact and level earth to grade specifications, using appropriate tools.
  • Install sewer, water, and storm drain pipes
  • Load, unload construction materials, and identify building materials, machinery, and tools, and distribute them to the appropriate locations, according to project plans and specifications.
  • Read and interpret plans, instructions, blueprints, structural drawings, rough sketches, and specifications to determine work activities.
  • Identify, pack, and transport hazardous materials.

Job Requirements:

  • 3-5 years experience in the industry required with proven abilities in leadership(experienced leading a crew of 4-5 people)
  • Ability to operate required equipment in a safe and responsible manner
  • Time management and project management skills
  • Ability to read building specifications and blueprints
  • Mathematical skills and analytical skills necessary for construction
  • Possess a valid driver's license and clean drivers abstract.
  • Able to work well under pressure with a strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to transition into winter duties - snow and ice management.

Work Benefits

  • Company paid health benefits
  • RRSP program with company contribution
  • Safe & healthy work environment
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Company paid uniforms
  • Boot allowance
  • Appreciation Activities

Other companies may call this job: Full Time, Full-Time, Landscape, Landscaper, Labour, Construction,Lead Hand, Supervisor

title: Skilled Labourer (FT)
description:
We are searching for a dependable Skilled Laborer to join our excellent construction crew. The Skilled Laborer's responsibilities include ensuring worksites are clean and safe, a demo of windows, and torched on roofing, spreading gravel, using drills, saws, and other power tools, and providing assistance with heavy machinery. You should also be able to take instruction from superiors and complete on-the-job training. To be successful as a Skilled Laborer, you will have completed apprenticeships and acquired suitable skills. An outstanding Skilled Laborer should be hungry to expand their skill set and increase their level of expertise. You should also be willing to learn from other crew members and receive off-site training wherever possible.
With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team!
Location: 844 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC V8W 3M5
Responsibilities:
  • Clean interior suites and possible areas around so the site.
  • Installing exterior air barrier and assisting Superintendents do daily tasks.
  • Interior suites wood working on windows frames and trims.
  • Moving materials to the worksite and ensuring all tools, machinery, and other equipment are safely set up.
  • Assisting with various window removal and roofing demo procedures.
  • Obeying health and safety codes, as well as the company's principles.
  • Removing hazardous materials from sites.
  • Driving scissor and boom lifts if necessary.
  • Performing site and equipment inspections.
  • Ensuring tasks are completed to deadlines.
  • Other duties that may be assigned.
Requirements:
  • High school diploma or similar.
  • Completed apprenticeships recommended.
  • Driver's license recommended.
  • Sound knowledge of construction and practical experience with tools.
  • Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills.
  • A good understanding of safety procedures.
  • Great hand, eye, and foot coordination.
  • Willingness to learn and be flexible.
  • Positive attitude and great interpersonal skills
Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.

title: Construction Labour
description:
CONSTRUCTION LABOUR POSITION

About WaterFarmers:

WaterFarmers Urban Agriculture is a progressive environmental design/build firm that supports the next generation of farmers, gardeners, and property managers. We provide consultation, general contracting, and construction services to clients interested in operating farm properties or producing food, as well as those interested in greening their urban environment or community. We are a small company entering our fifth year of operation, and are looking forward to a busy year working on a variety of interesting projects with a talented and diverse team. Our upcoming projects include greenhouse construction, irrigation system installations, rainwater harvesting installations, and landscaping for rain gardens and native plant/ pollinator gardens. We work with a wide variety of clientele, including homeowners, farmers, property managers, municipalities, academic institutions, not-for-profits, and other food related commercial operations. We enjoy the ongoing challenge of creating custom solutions for our clients, whether we are working on a simple backyard vegetable garden or a sophisticated indoor agriculture facility.

WaterFarmers is based in Guelph and operates across Southern Ontario, most often along the Highway 6/ Guelph-Hamilton corridor, and occasionally farther abroad when project budgets allow for travel expenses. Our worksite is located in Morriston, just south of the 401 and east of Highway 6.

 

Job Description:

WaterFarmers is looking for an ambitious, hard working, positive individual for part-time work (minimum 24 hours / week) providing on-site labour for a variety of tasks related to our upcoming landscaping and construction projects. A typical workday would consist of arriving at a project site, reviewing work tasks and safety concerns, moving material and tools, and assisting with physical labour tasks to accomplish on-site goals. Staff are expected to work safely, efficiently, and bring concerns to the attention of team leaders. Staff are also expected to participate in project discussions via email & mobile messaging in order to report on progress, raise concerns & issues, ask questions, and share photos. Daily input of timesheets for hours worked is required. We work indoors and outdoors year round, and provide all PPE and tools required. Safety & machinery training is provided to staff as needed. 

Basic Requirements:

  • Reliable transportation. Must have a valid G license and access to a vehicle

  • Work safely and effectively in a construction or farm environment

  • Physical ability & stamina to work outdoors and lift/ move heavy construction and landscaping materials around project sites

  • Access to mobile phone for daily communication via Email, Slack, Trello, and to input timesheets via QuickBooks T-Sheets

Assets:

  • Familiarity with hand tools, power tools & machinery is an asset

  • Construction, plumbing, landscaping, horticulture, or farming experience are assets

  • Ability to work independently and solve problems

  • Effective written and verbal communication skills

  • Entrepreneurial interest is a plus - we are open to employee ideas for running the best business possible, fostering a positive staff environment, and pursuing new projects, products, opportunities, and collaborations

Compensation:

  • Starting wage: $18 per hour

  • 24 hours minimum scheduled hours required per week

  • Potential for more shifts as projects and availability dictate

  • Paid training where required (WHMIS, Standard First Aid, Working from Heights, etc.)

  • Breaks throughout day - flexible and based on work tasks & staff needs

  • 1 hour unpaid lunch

  • 3 month probation period

  • Upon completion of probation period, access to profit sharing program and allowances for work boots, seasonal work clothing, phone expenses, and gas expenses.

  • Opportunities for advancement of roles & responsibilities

 

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

WaterFarmers is committed to treating our staff in a respectful and fair manner, and ensuring a safe and healthy work environment. We are an equal opportunity employer and invite any candidate who meets the above requirements to apply. Only successful candidates will be contacted for an interview. Interviewees will be paid $36 (2 hours @ $18/hour) for their time, and will be asked to complete a paid trial shift.

 

Application Process

This job posting is open until April 15, with an immediate start date following a paid trial day. To apply, please send resumes and brief cover letter to

garrett@waterfarmers.ca

title: General Labour - Summer Painter
description:
Hard-Working Individuals Needed!


 

Looking for 10-12 dedicated people to work as Painters over the 2022 summer season. As a successful Painter within my business, you will possess a positive attitude, deliver quality results to our customers, and leave an impression that lasts.


 

Some benefits of painting with SWP West:

  • Surround yourself with like-minded people who also want to work hard
  • Full training on all proper work-related tasks and safety elements
  • Company events to unwind after we've passed major milestones in the summer
  • Competitve wages, employees average between $16-$18/hr and top earners make $25/hr


 

Responsibilities of a Painter include:

  • Arriving on time to work, every time
  • Setting up new job sites upon arrival
  • All surface preparation and application of materials
  • Final inspection of quality on all projects
  • Going above and beyond to ensure our clients are happy


 

Requirements of a Painter include, but are not limited to:

  • Ability to work at heights and from ladders
  • Ability to lift, carry, and use heavy equipment
  • Ability to transport their person and their equipment to and from each jobsite frequently and reliably
  • Ability to perform repetitive tasks for long periods of time (8-10hrs)


 

Here at SWP West we are goal-oriented, focused, and driven. We strive to be the hardest working painters in the industry, and put ourselves at the top by making sure our clients are our top priority. We know that each and every person is unique and has plenty to offer, which is why we take pride in being a diverse workplace. We understand that Equal Employment Opportunities are important in seeing the talents of today's up-and-comings come to fruition, which why we invite any and all to apply. Best of luck to those of you that try, and we can't wait to see you out there representing our business!

title: Scaffolder - All Levels
description:
SUMMARY:
A Scaffolders’ duties may vary from site to site, however, the main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Apprenticeship level ticket or proof of hours. 
  • CSTS, Fall Protection, H2S Alive, Confined Space, Common Safety Orientation 
  • Must be local to Medicine Hat  Area
  • Must be able to work for 8 hours at a time in an environment where temperatures may reach from 0 to 60° C, both indoors and outdoors in the sun.
  • Work in an environment in which vibrations and noise are moderate to severe and noise level may require the wearing of hearing protection devices.
  • Climb and maintain balance on ladders and scaffolding at extreme heights.
  • Stoop, kneel, crouch, and crawl.
  • Lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 pounds often and occasionally up to 100 pounds.
  • Maintain footing on surfaces which are sometimes slippery.
  • Must be able to effectively communicate with other employees and supervisors.
  • Use arms and hands to reach for, handle, and feel objects; and coordinate well the use of hands or fingers and eyes.
  • Must be able to supply a negative Drug & Alcohol Pre-Access test.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
  • Must comply with all safety regulations of Soogadin Field Services
  • Ensures that work is performed in accordance with Contractor specifications and/or as directed by the Contractor’s representative.
  • Ensures they are following the applicable Site/Contractor’s Safety Procedures and safety requirements.
  • Assures that the proper materials, tools, and equipment is being used for the specified tasks.
  • Reads specifications, such as blueprints and data, to determine requirements.
  • Able to install steel pipes, support braces, and clamps to form bases for scaffolds.
  • Able to dismantle scaffold upon job completion.
  • Can identify the type of scaffolding material to be used for the job (frame, tube & clamp, system).
  • Able to thoroughly describe scaffolding materials.
  • Sort and organize material
  • Able to count and place orders for material
  • Required to complete safety paperwork such as FLRA’s, Start Cards, etc.
  • Other duties as assigned

title: Maintenance
description:
Company Description

We are more than just your local restaurant. We are a collection of hardworking small-business owners.

Did you know that from coast to coast, we serve delicious choices to more than 2.5 million people in over 1,400 locations every day, or that we have proudly helped more than 387,000 Canadian families with sick children through Ronald McDonald House Charities?

 

Job Description

Our offer

Working with us means that you will have the opportunity to earn and learn, flexibility, and a safe and inclusive work environment. What this means in practice is:

·       Access to education and skills development opportunities that take you further

·       A total rewards package that includes discounts, incentives, and recognition perks

·       Flexible hours/shifts that suit your needs

·       A safe, respectful and inclusive workplace

·       Bring your authentic self to work – welcoming people of every age, background, and culture – just like the guests who visit our restaurants every day

The job

We are sure that you have an idea about what working with us is like, but just in case here are some of the highlights on what your job will entail:

·       Maintaining a clean, safe, and secure work environment for guests, coworkers, and yourself, leveraging your knowledge of safety regulations and equipment.

·       Multi-tasking in between troubleshooting, tending to store areas and appliances during your shift, and repairing décor and equipment, whether it’s during the day or throughout the night.

·       Managing priorities, staying organized, and keeping on top of the various tasks with limited supervision.

Your vibe and experience

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You’re a curious mind. You love to see how things work and are fascinated by the intricacies of objects. You’re good with your hands and mechanically adept. You’re always willing to learn and grow. You remain cool, calm and collected in a fast-paced environment. You’d rather do a job right the first time, than do it twice.

Additional Information

About us

In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald’s history. In 1967, the first McDonald’s Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we’ve been growing with our communities and serving quality food at great a value ever since. Today, McDonald’s Canada is proud to be one of the world’s leading foodservice retailers, offering job opportunities at corporate-owned restaurants or restaurants owned by independent franchisees.

McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Carpenter / Carpenter Apprentice
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?
Join our NRB Modular Solutions team, where our people are driven by a desire to innovate, do social good, and move construction forward.

As a Carpenter you will be responsible for the construction of structures and components of portable buildings that are made of wood, wood-substitutes, and other materials. 

This position is safety sensitive and requires drug and alcohol testing as a condition of employment.

Your work will include:

  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings and specifications.
  • Determine specifications and calculate requirements.
  • Measure, cut, shape, assemble and join moldings, wood materials, drywall and plastic materials.
  • Fit and install windows, doors, stairs, moldings and hardware.
  • Instruct apprentices and carpenter’s helpers/labourers as required.
  • These tasks require work with the following tools: sawzall, skill saw, chop saw, table saw, radial arm saw, drills, drill press and air tools.
  • Complete daily Job Hazards Assessments and Pre-Job Task Hazard Analysis forms.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Extended health and dental benefits.
  • Opportunity to learn under Journeyperson.
  • Award winning safety culture.
  • Work indoors year-round.
  • Whereas other companies are downsizing, we are growing!
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader.

Follow NRB Modular Solutions on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Education background equivalent to high school is required.
  • Knowledge of the construction/manufacturing industry is considered an asset.
  • Must have taken some courses in carpentry/wood-working.
  • 2 years of related knowledge and experience in the carpentry trade.
  • Able to operate all hand and power tools required to perform tasks specific to trade.
  • Perform heavy manual labor, including bending, stooping, reaching, carrying and lifting heavy objects weighing up to 45 lbs.
  • Requires manual dexterity of both hands and feet to perform activities such as lifting overhead, twisting and bending while lifting, climbing ladders and stairs while wearing protective equipment, and working in confined spaces, including repetitive arm motion below, at, and above shoulder level.
  • Walks approximately 2-4 kilometers per day on a variety of surfaces including, concrete and gravel.


Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.
