title: Carpenter
description:
Are you seeking an opportunity to work in a remote picturesque environment? This is not just an opportunity to utilize your expertise and experience but an opportunity to see nature in its purest form!

MATRIX is a national company providing camps, logistics and aviation management services to a diverse range of clients in the resource and service sectors, focusing on our people.

MATRIX is a drug and alcohol-free company; with over 250 employees annually, we offer excellent career advancements for all skillsets. 

We are currently seeking Carpenters for our various remote Canadian project locations!

Job Requirements:

You are team oriented, motivated, and have a high attention for details, accuracy and can prioritize tasks. You will play a key role at one of our remote exploration camps by performing all primary responsibilities in a timely manner independently. This position reports to the Camp Lead.

Responsibilities:

 

â€¢ Perform tasks according to safe work practices and safe job procedures.

â€¢ Camp Labour will help with the tear down of a camp.

â€¢ Report all incidents and accidents immediately.

â€¢ Practice good housekeeping in the work area at all times.

â€¢ Participate in daily Toolbox meetings.

â€¢ Perform labour intensive duties by lifting up to 50lbs.

â€¢ Support camp lead on additional duties outside of your labour position when needed.

â€¢ Participate in daily Toolbox meetings.

â€¢ Work in a team environment or independently.

 

Required Knowledge & Experience:

 

â€¢ Minimum of three (2) years working in a remote camp as a Labourer 

â€¢ Organizational and problem-solving abilities.

â€¢ Good communication skills.

â€¢ Highly motivated, team-oriented individual with attention to detail.

â€¢ Ability to work a rotation schedule.

â€¢ Physical ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.

â€¢ Able to lift and move heavy objects, walk and stand for long periods of time and perform physical labor.

â€¢ Able to maintain a high level of performance over a 10 â€“ 12 hour shift.

How to Apply:

Please submit your resume, cover letter and supporting documents/certificates online at www.matrixco.ca/careers. Please note those short-listed for interviews will be contacted. Candidates may be subject to a criminal record check and certified medical exam.

For more information on the MATRIX group of companies, please visit our website at: www.matrixco.ca

title: Skilled Laborer
description:
The Opportunity

In this construction role you will work directly under the supervision of a qualified tradesperson and assist on our projects using your variety of skills and team player mindset while conforming to local building codes.

 We are looking for construction workers with diverse skills including tile, light framing, finish carpentry, painting etc.


Do you? Skilled Laborer

  • Thrive working on a team and producing top-notch work?
  • Possess the skills to implement award-winning custom-designed kitchens, baths, etc?
  • Want to work in a fun yet professional environment with like-minded individuals?


If so we want to hear from you!



Qualifications

  • Strong working knowledge of job site safety as well as ability to complete a company specific safety orientation
  • High standard of integrity and professionalism
  • Drug free at all times
  • Must have a good driving record
  • Must have reliable transportation
  • Must be able to lift 50 pounds

title: CARPENTER / HANDYMAN
description:
$65,000 to $75,000 

Craftsman with Carpentry, Drywall, Electrical and Plumbing skills needed.  Work independently with benefits.  We have office staff to handle the paperwork for you so you can do the work in a family atmosphere. 
Benefits:

  • Paid Vacation
  • Paid Holidays
  • Company Vehicle
  • Competitive Pay
  • Bonus Eligible
  • Health Insurance Available
Specific Responsibilities/ Job Requirements 

  • Perform carpentry, drywall, plumbing and electrical repairs in homes and commercial properties.
  • Complete small to medium maintenance/repairs and mid-size home improvement projects
  • Strong ‘multi-skill’ background desired. Must have/own ‘day to day’ tools of the trade.
  • Deliver a consistent & remarkably better customer experience when working in their home.
  • Communicate with customers about scope of work, cost estimates, manage expectations.
  • Leave customers thrilled with your current work, and open doors to future work.


We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow-up!

Proudly serving:
Calgary South West and East as well Calgary ‘s surrounding areas of Cochrane, Airdrie, Chestemere, Okotoks.
#ZR

Notice

Mr. Handyman International LLC is the franchisor of the Mr. Handyman® franchised system. Each Mr. Handyman® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, Mr. Handyman International LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. Mr. Handyman International LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent Mr. Handyman® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither Mr. Handyman International LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. Mr. Handyman International LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Labourer
description:
JOURNALIERS POSTES DISPONIBLES DÈS MAINTENANT!
Prim d'embauche $1000
Êtes-vous prêt à travailler avec une équipe dédiée à la sécurité et à la croissance de ces employés? Triumvirate Environmental ne fait pas que promettre des opportunités de croissance, nous les créons par la formation et le mentorat des employés. Joignez-vous à une équipe aussi dévouée à votre carrière que vous l'êtes!
Triumvirate Environmental est l'une des plus grandes entreprises de services environnementaux en Amérique du Nord. Triumvirate offre des services et des conseils diversifiés pour aider à gérer la conformité des institutions de premier plan des secteurs de l'enseignement supérieur, des sciences de la vie, des soins de santé et des secteurs industriels. Chez Triumvirate, nous nous efforçons d'épater nos employés et nos clients. Notre culture unique favorise la croissance, le développement, l'éducation et la créativité.
Responsabilités et les tâches essentielles:
  • Le déchargement et le chargement des camions.
  • Préparation des déchets et des documents; révision de la réglementation et de la sécurité.
  • Gestion de l'inventaire des déchets .
  • Apprendre et appliquer une connaissance de base des pratiques de travail quotidiennes.
  • Se familiariser avec les directives d'emballage et le choix des installations d'élimination.
  • Développer une compréhension des réglementations SIMDUT, des pratiques de santé et de sécurité de Triumvirate, et des réglementations TMD.
  • Communiquer efficacement avec les autres employés pour résoudre des problèmes complexes.
  • Développer le respect et les relations de travail avec ses collègues.
  • Démontrer sa capacité à être créatif et à résoudre des problèmes uniques.
  • Attitude positive!
  • Épater les clients internes et externes!
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe.
  • Suivre une formation sur les chariots élévateurs à fourche et être capable d'utiliser la machinerie en toute sécurité.
Qualifications requises:
  • Diplôme d'études secondaires.
  • Connaissance de base ou le désir d'aquérir des connaissances dans le domaine des déchets dangereux.
  • Passer un test d'ajustement pour un respirateur et être à l'aise pour porter un respirateur pendant plusieurs heures par semaine.
  • Permis de conduire valide.
Les exigences énumérées ci-dessus sont représentatives des connaissances, des compétences et/ou des aptitudes requises. Une formation sera donnée sur place.

title: Hardscape Labourer
description:
ALL-PRO Landscaping & Carpentry Ltd. specializes in hardscape construction projects for our residential clients (homeowners) in Ajax, Pickering, and East Scarborough (West Rouge, etc.): interlock pavers/slabs, wall systems, steps, natural stone (armour stone, square-cut flagstone, etc.), decks, plus sod, mulch, etc.

 

The HARDSCAPE LABOURER candidate must have a minimum of 1 year of experience.

 

The WAGE RANGE for this position is $21-$25 /hour, depending on the skill level, experience, and education of the successful candidate .

 

The preferred candidate:

>  Has a minimum of 1 year of experience in hardscape landscaping (especially interlock pavers).

>  Has a high-school diploma/GED or equivalent.

>  Has a valid Class G DRIVER’S LICENCE (clean driver’s abstract) with the use of one’s own vehicle to drive to/between project sites (preferred).

>  Must be a physically fit individual with the ability to lift approx. 50 lbs. and deal with a physically demanding hardscape construction work environment.

>  Must provide their own steel-toed safety boots (CSA-approved) and gloves which must be worn in the workplace. 

>  Must have a keen attention to detail and worplace safety.

>  Must be able to take direction and follow through with instructions, working well both in a team setting and independently.

 

We are looking for a Team member with a positive attitude and desire for continuous learning and improvement in a fast-paced environment. Someone honest, hardworking and punctual.

title: Labourer
description:
The Labourer is an entry level member of our team, assisting with day to day work on plumbing systems in commercial and residential environments. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.   You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and are able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines.  Specific Responsibilities:
  • Assist plumbers in conducting their work
  • Assist our concrete crew in concrete cutting, demolition, and finishing
  • Operate a variety of hand and power tools safely and effectively
  • Identity proper materials and quantities for new and existing projects
  • Keep company vehicles and equipment properly serviced, clean, and in good working order and condition
Job Requirements:
  • No previous plumbing experience is required
  • Valid Driver's License with minimum 3 years driving experience
  • Ability to operate basic hand and power tools necessary for the craft
  • Attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Professional appearance and personality
  • Ability and desire to work as part of a team
Benefits: Co-pay benefits package starts after successful completion of the probationary period. 

We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Notice

Mr. Rooter LLC is the franchisor of the Mr. Rooter® franchised system. Each Mr. Rooter® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, Mr. Rooter LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. Mr. Rooter LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

I acknowledge that each independent Mr. Rooter® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither Mr. Rooter LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. Mr. Rooter LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: GENERAL LABOURER
description:
OUR 2022 SEASON STARTS IN APRIL



Crystal Cleaning, Montreal’s leader in Window cleaning, is looking to hire full-time & part-time candidates to join our dynamic team. The employees will be part of a two to three-person crew carrying out residential and commercial maintenance such as window cleaning, gutter cleaning, and power washing. Feel free to reach out to us anytime as we review all applicants.



Responsibilities:




  • Learning proper cleaning techniques.

  • Working outdoors.

  • Safely using a ladder.

  • Operating essential equipment.

  • Maintaining residential & commercial properties.

  • Cleaning windows, siding, gutters and much more.



Skills and Qualifications:




  • Healthy physical condition.

  • Good listening skills.

  • Team player.

  • Punctual.

  • Focused on Excellence (Gets the job done right the first time)

  • Experience in window cleaning or working in a blue-collar position in the past is an asset.

  • French and/or English.

  • Class 5 driver's license is an asset.

  • Comfortable with heights.



Additional Information:




  • Work days are generally scheduled Monday-Friday from 7am-5pm.

  • Transportation  vehicle utilized to get to job sites are provided by the employer.

  • Teams meet each morning and at the end of the shift at our office in Saint-Laurent.

  • Benefits include end of season bonus.

  • Career growth opportunities.

  • Team lunches once a month.

  • Employee of the month bonus.

  • End of year christmas party.

  • Refreshers and snacks provided by employer daily.

  • All necessary equipment and uniforms are provided.

  • Hours vary according to workload, but generally range from 40 - 50 hours per week.

  • Job Types: Full-time, Part-time,



Standards: Crystal cleaning has high standards when it comes to our service process, customer experience & respect towards colleagues and clients. We want our clients to have a smooth and pleasant experience when receiving our services. We ask that everyone follows our service process to ensure the satisfaction of the client. At Crystal Cleaning we have a no tolerance to verbal or physical abuse nor comments pertaining to race, sex, religion, sexual identity and political beliefs.

title: LABOURERS - Inventory (various areas)
description:
LABOURERS - INVENTORY


IMPORTANT MESSAGE:

When you submit an application for this selection process, you are not applying for any specific position, but to an inventory in anticipation of future vacancies. Applicants who meet the essential qualifications will have their application included in the inventory for this ongoing selection process. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.

Your application in this inventory will be active for 180 days

Cobalt Group specializes in the "Design - Build - Maintain" services providing a fully integrated, upper tier level of service in the industrial construction and maintenance arena across Western Canada. We are seeking interest from persons looking for an exciting and rewarding career in positions that provide exposure to new environments, challenges and opportunities.

Safety is an integral part of our company's operating philosophy and is a key component of our overall success. We are committed to the safety and well-being of our employees.

We are committed to working with, investing in and developing individuals who are driven to succeed in their chosen career. We also provide competitive living-out allowance and travel benefits.

Labourers interested in the various positions throughout British Columbia and Alberta are encouraged to apply.

LABOURER Requirements:

  • Load, unload, and transport construction materials;
  • Mix, pour, and spread materials;
  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools;
  • Remove rubble and other debris at construction sites;
  • Tend equipment and machines used in construction;
  • Direct traffic at or near construction sites;
  • Ability to complete assigned tasks under stressful situations;
  • Ability to work in outdoor weather conditions including heat, snow, rain;
  • Strong organizational, and time management skills, calm and positive attitude under pressure;
  • Represent the company in a professional manner and treat fellow team members with dignity and respect;
  • Must be comfortable working at heights;
  • Good understanding of the English language;
  • Good communication, oral and written skills;
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision;
  • Ability to pay attention to the minute details of a project or task;
  • Driven to perform all tasks to the best of one's ability;
  • Ability to comprehend complex technical topics and specialized information;
  • Perform all duties in a safe and efficient manner according to company and OSHA safety guidelines and wear the proper protective equipment as required.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

  • This work position is required to work in sawmill, pulp mill, mining or OSB environments;
  • While performing duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to work near moving mechanical parts; toxic or caustic chemicals and risk of electrical shock;
  • The employee is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles such as dust; extreme heat (non-weather) and vibration;
  • The noise level in the work environment is usually loud;
  • May have to lift heavy objects and work in awkward positions while bending, stooping, or standing to work overhead;
  • Labourers may work outdoors, often in inclement weather, or indoors, sometimes in a confined area designed to contain sparks and glare. When working outdoors, they may work on a scaffold or platform high off the ground.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
  • Standing
  • Walking
  • Lifting
  • Pulling and Pushing
  • Carrying
  • Grasping
  • Reaching
  • Stooping and Crouching
  • Color Determination
  • Speaking
  • Listening

***Essential functions and basic duties have been included. It is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all functions, responsibilities, skills and abilities. Additional functions and requirements may be assigned by supervisors as deemed appropriate.

INFORMATION YOU MUST PROVIDE:

  • Resume
  • Pre-screening questionnaire (it is important to answer each question in order to be considered for the position)

title: General Labourer - Fittings
description:
Here at KP Building Products, our employees are at the forefront of everything we do. We are the leading Canadian manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and strive to be the best in customer experience. We are a company rich in history and proud to be Canadian owned and operated.

KP Building Products has an immediate employment opportunity in the Brampton area for General labourers for the fitting department. The Special Fittings Operator workers manually produce specially formed fittings by heating and molding, bending, joining and cutting PVC plastics using tools such as molds, mold presses, and a press cutter.

Shifts: 8 hour shifts
Salary: $15.50 per hour

We offer:

  • Health and Dental benefits
  • RRSP
  • Ongoing training initiatives
  • Yearly Safety Boot Allowance
  • Prescription Safety Glasses Allowance
  • Vacation & paid time off

Responsabilities:

  • Determines parts to be made as per customer order
  • Cut long PVC flat sheets using cutter
  • Cut plastic sheets using band saw
  • Cut pipe using table saw
  • Welding and assembling of pieces
  • Heat plastic for forming into molds and bending
  • Set-up and replace molds and cutters
  • Cut holes into parts using a hole cutter
  • Application of labels to parts; packing of parts
  • Participate in training as required by the company
  • Adhere to all applicable company policies and procedures, including quality and health and safety
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Requirements:

  • Completed high school diploma, GED, or equivalent.
  • Two (2) years experience as a special fittings operator within a manufacturing environment, preferably working with PVC plastics is an asset
  • Ability to follow instructions from team lead and plant manager
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those candidates who fit the requirements of the role will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Skilled Carpenter
description:
You are a skilled Carpenter with experience to support us on industrial oil & gas projects. You will be an integral part of the team working on the CBR Cogen project. This is a long term construction project that includes replacement of three coke fired boilers with two 400 MegaWatt cogen units. The project is conveniently located right outside of Fort McMurray at Suncor Baseplant.

Essential Responsibilities:
  • Comprehend drawings to prepare layouts including selecting materials, planning sequences and methods of work, and measuring and marking materials to avoid costly mistakes or omissions
  • Understand industrial concrete forming and engineered forming systems to accurately build concrete forms
  • Check completed units to be sure they are level, square, plumb, and the right size, shape, and location
Qualifications:
  • Have a Journeyperson Carpenter Ticket from a recognized provincial training authority
  • Non-ticketed carpenters must provide proof of hours relevant to the industrial carpentry trade.
  • Must successfully complete pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Successful candidates will require CSTS 2020, CSO or BSO
Work Conditions:
  • Project is located in the Fort McMurray AB.
  • Project commenced in July 2021; this is a role with long term potential
  • 14 days on /7 days off schedule, working 10 hours per day
  • Site based camp provided
  • Charter Flights from either Edmonton or Calgary
  • Must be fully vaccinated and provide valid COVID-19 vaccination record for air travel (unless you have a legitimate recognized medical or religious reason for not getting vaccinated), or agree to submit to testing requirements
  • Travel allowance for candidates who qualify
  • Driving to Fort McMurray is an option as there is camp parking available
  • Benefits provided by CLAC

description:
Terzetto Homes


Lead Carpenter

“Transformative home remodeling that celebrates your unique lifestyle!”


 We are looking for an experienced Lead Carpenter (w/ Tile experience) who is an adaptable, personable, and proactive team leader. 

For more information, please visit: https://terzettohomes.com/

  • Other construction related duties as required to meet client and business needs 


Qualifications:

With decades of residential remodeling experience, the Terzetto team expertly manages home renovations with lifestyle-focused design. Craftsmanship, premium finishes and livable spaces are the hallmark of a Terzetto home.

title: Skatepark Construction Builders / Finishers
description:
Are you a passionate, creative team player with a desire to travel and work and make a difference in communities across Canada? We have openings for experienced Carpenters and Concrete Finishers who take pride in their workmanship. Successful candidates will possess a positive attitude, be community driven, adaptable, responsible and have the ability to work and travel out of town for extended periods of time. We provide very comfortable homes away from home, travel provided to and from locations and a healthy compensation allowance for living away from home.

We are looking for individuals with experience in carpentry and formwork, welding and concrete placing/finishing. Experience with shaping and finishing vertical shotcrete and experience with concrete line pumps an asset. With safety as our top priority, we are interested in individuals with Health and Safety certifications and relative training certifications.

Preference may be given to those with a journeyman carpentry ticket, previous concrete finishing work experience, ACI certification. We are seeking interested candidates with experience in: framing and excavation, ability to read architectural drawings, rebar and form installation, measure/calculate concrete volumes, handling and troweling concrete.

New Line Skateparks offers a productive fast paced work environment in an exciting industry. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. We offer a complete benefits plan including, medical, dental, and insurance as well as a performance bonus program.

title: Labourer
description:
Steel River Solutions is seeking Labourers for a potential upcoming pipeline integrity project in Salmon Arm, BC. 

The Labourer is responsible for a wide range of general construction activities.

Key Job Duties:

  • Perform demanding physical work activities and operate hand tools and trucks in a safe manner
  • Assist operators and perform a wide range of tasks at construction sites
  • Active participation in all safety and planning meetings, identification of hazards
  • Load, unload, identify and utilize tools and materials required to perform the various tasks to be executed by the crew
  • Assist with assembling and dismantling of equipment
  • Act as a spotter for trucks and other heavy equipment entering the work area
  • Clean and prepare construction work areas where needed
  • Ensure the appropriate use of Personal Protective Equipment while performing tasks
  • Adhere to all Company policies, plans, standards and procedures
  • Identify safety risks and hazards, and comply with relevant safety procedures and regulations
  • Other tasks as assigned as deemed appropriate by management

Job Requirements:

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Various safety tickets, certificates and Personal Protective Equipment are required depending on the project and position
  • Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License or government issued photo identification
  • Must successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • High school diploma or equivalent; and/or a combination of education and relevant work experience is an asset
  • Previous construction experience in a labourer position is an asset

Skills & Knowledge:

  • Excellent hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity
  • Knowledge of handling hazardous materials and waste
  • Physically able to perform manual labour for long hours outdoors and in all weather conditions
  • Physically able to handle and lift heavy objects up to 50 pounds
  • Knowledge of workplace safety requirements and procedures
  • Knowledge of the pipeline construction industry
  • Ability to receive instructions and carry out instructions in a safe manner
  • Excellent time management and organization abilities
  • Manual dexterity with the ability to use various hand tools
  • Ability to be reliable and have a strong work ethic
  • Strong communication skills: written and verbal skills, listening skills, proven attention to detail, and ability to develop positive working relationships
  • Ability to work in a growing, dynamic and changing environment
  • Optimistic/collaborative approach and attitude towards work

Working Conditions:

  • Field based. Applicants must be willing to work long hours outdoors
  • Schedule: 6 days on, 1 day off with 12-hour shifts
  • Anticipated Project Start/End: May 2022 â€“ October 2022

Why Steel River Solutions?

Steel River Solutions offers a diverse range of pipeline and civil construction, maintenance, and management support services to meet the ever-growing demands of the oil and gas construction industry. Services include all the disciplines required to plan, build, execute, and maintain a project from beginning to end. Our focused dedication to completely understand a project allows us to deliver efficient, cost-effective services that also create value for our Indigenous partners.

Our objective is to provide our clients with outstanding service and to be first in class in construction, maintenance, and facilities. Through our alliances, we can provide turnkey project solutions including design, engineering support, and world-class design and construction expertise.

The Steel River team is equipped with substantial experience and has worked on small to large diameter pipeline and related pipeline projects across Canada. Steel River strives to find innovative solutions that promote health, safety, and environmental sustainability.

Our commitment is to look beyond any one single project, to cultivate opportunities, create long-lasting relationships, and to seek sustainable initiatives that enhance the communities in which we operate.

Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook for the latest job postings and news.

Steel River Solutions is an equal opportunity employer.  Only selected candidates will be contacted.  Thank you in advance for including us in your career search! 

#LI-DNI

title: Labourers - Northwest Territories
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for Labourers with large earthworks construction or mining projects experience.
 
 
Nuna is the largest Inuit-owned heavy civil construction, earthworks, and mine construction contractor in Canada.
 
Nuna Logistics is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective, and innovative operator in the north.
 
 
We offer: 
  • 3 week on / 3 week off rotations; 12-hour days
  • Competitive hourly rate with Overtime pay (1.5x),
  • Extensive benefits including company matching RRSP plan;
  • Employee recognition program,
  • Rotation allowances,
  • Commercial flights and accommodations are covered,
  • Long-term employment opportunities
This position is located on our project site located in the Northwest Territories.
 
PLEASE NOTE: Only candidates from NWT will be considered for this role.
 
Pre-access requirements include:
  • Drug Test
  • Medical 
  • Criminal Record Check
  • Covid screening 
 
 
Locations available:  
  • Snap Lake
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Load and unload construction materials
  • Working around heavy equipment
  • Assist heavy equipment operators; spotting of trucks and other heavy equipment
  • Manual labor including shoveling, sweeping, raking
  • Working in remote locations in a camp setting
  • Experience with radio communications and protocols
  • Capable of working independently in a fast-paced environment with good safety awareness


QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Ability to lift to 50 lbs. on a regular basis
  • Must be 18+ years old
  • Must be willing to work outdoors and in various weather conditions
  • Willing and capable of committing to a 3x3 rotation

How to Apply:
Interested applicants are asked to apply online at http://nunalogistics.com/jobs.html  
Or by email:hr@nunalogistics.com
 
Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.   
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Maintenance Summer Student
description:
We are a major energy infrastructure business that has experienced tremendous growth over the past decade. This growth has provided our employees with stability, positive challenges, new career paths and opportunities to work in a dynamic team environment. As one of Alberta’s Top 75 Employers we are proud to say no matter where your role at Inter Pipeline may lie, you are provided ample opportunities for valued contribution and innovation, with a strong emphasis on employee growth.

Located out of our Cochrane Extraction Plant, the Maintenance Summer Student will report to the Maintenance Senior.

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Currently enrolled in a technology or engineering post-secondary program, having completed a minimum of one year

Skills:

  • Experience with the safe use of hand tools/power tools
  • Working at heights
  • Forklift/Manlift/Telehandler operation experience
  • Safety conscious
  • Punctual
  • Communication skills verbal/written
  • Pleasant personality and positive outlook
  • Positive attitude, self-motivated and dependable with a strong work ethic
  • Demonstrated commitment to safety and compliance to processing facility procedures

Key Activities and Responsibilities:

  • General shop cleanup and organization
  • Updating spare parts requirements
  • Provide logistical support when large numbers of contractors are on site
  • Assisting with routine preventative maintenance activities
  • Equipment cleaning and filter changes
  • Coordinating ‘As Built’ or ‘As-Found’ documentation updates
  • Investigate dormant open work orders with a goal of reducing current work order backlogs
  • Gather supplies from town when necessary
  • Assisting E&I and Mechanical groups on an “as needed” basis

Hours:

40 hours/ week

May 2022 – August 2022

As this position is identified as safety-sensitive, employment of a final candidate will be conditional upon completion of pre-employment medical, drug/alcohol  assessments with satisfactory results.

Proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required for this position as a condition of employment. Requests for an exemption under applicable human rights legislation due to medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

While diversity is a fact, inclusion is the act of recognizing the value of our differences and leveraging them for the betterment of our organization. At Inter Pipeline, we are dedicated to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that values, represents, and supports the communities in which we work. We are committed to maintaining a respectful workplace and we are building a culture that supports the diverse needs of our employees. We welcome applications from all individuals including those who are Indigenous, racialized, of varied abilities and ethnicities, members of gender and sexually diverse communities, as well as with any other dimension of diversity.

title: Laborer/Junior Building Operator
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald is currently seeking an entry level Labourer/Junior Operator to join our Vancouver team! If you are a hands-on, customer service-oriented, and technically-inclined professional searching for the opportunity to build a solid foundation for your career, this position is for you. This position is located in Vancouver and will report directly to the Supervisor.

The Labourer/Junior Operator for the Single Room Occupancy (SRO) Sites in the Downtown Eastside (DTES) Vancouver area is responsible for maintaining safe conditions inside and outside of the facilities, performing minor tasks, cleaning, and minor repairs. Under the direction of the Building Operator, Supervisor or Project Manager, this individual will conduct minor mechanical inspections and maintenance of equipment using Facilities Management & Operations processes to ensure optimum operation. For the right individual, this position offers the potential to grow into a Building Operator role.

  • In conjunction with the Building Operator, Supervisor/Project Manager and the team, execute responsive and planned maintenance in accordance with the computerized maintenance management system (CMMS).
  • Respond to Housing Operator requests and complaints.
  • Perform basic tours and log reading of equipment, as instructed.
  • Assist in the movement of materials to various work areas.
  • Assist tradespersons, technicians or sub-contractors as required.
  • Establish methods to meet work schedules and co-ordinate work activities with other subcontractors.
  • Perform light duties such as cleaning, painting, garbage removal, plumbing and other mechanical duties.
  • Direct pedestrian traffic when assisting with building exterior work & building washing.
  • Assist in purchasing parts and materials when requested.

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Continuous Learning
  • Customer Focus
  • Values and Respects Others

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

  • High School completion would be an asset.

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 1-3 years' experience as a general Labourer would be considered an asset.
  • 1-3 years' experience working within commercial buildings/facilities or in construction would be considered an asset.
  • Knowledge and experience of working in the DTES location with 1-3 years social housing experience may be an asset.

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills required.
  • Ability to follow written and verbal instruction.
  • Must be a team player, work well with others.
  • Excellent customer service skills.
  • Maintain a professional demeanor at all times with fellow employees and customer.
  • Must be comfortable working within the DTES environment.
  • Comply with all company policies and procedures and adhere to company standards.
  • Must be available for occasional Emergency after hours duties.
  • Available to travel within the DTES.

We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Carpenter Apprentices - Belle River, ON
description:
We are helping North America Construction (1993) Ltd., - NAC Constructors Ltd. (NAC) find caprenter apprenctices in the Belle River area! 

NAC is Canada’s leading multi-trade builder and provides true Master Builder services to the civil, municipal and energy biofuel marketplaces. The depth of our resources is evident in the variety of projects we construct. From water filtration to wastewater treatment; dams to ethanol; we build it all…and more! The contagious energy and excitement within NAC creates a variety of rewarding and challenging opportunities for individuals to achieve their goals.

NAC is currently seeking Carpenter Apprentices (level 3 & 4) to join our Denis St. Pierre Water Pollution Control Plant Expansion Project located in Belle River, ON.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

 

Position Description

 

  • Assist Carpenters with daily tasks and duties contributing to on-site day-to-day operations
  • Assist in the assembly and erection of forms for concrete, wood and metal frame construction and use plans and instruments to prepare for excavating and shoring
  • Participate in Tool Box Talks daily and communicate any safety concerns
  • Maintain a clean, safe work environment, and comply with all Health & Safety regulations
  • Operate and maintain carpentry tools and equipment
  • Keep a daily log of tasks
  • Respect and respond to direction given
  • Handle and transport job materials to the work area as needed
  • Advise Journeypersons/Forepersons of any variances to schedule and/or material issues
  • Perform other related duties, including minor duties of other trades where certification is not required and the work does not exceed own limitations
  • Understand and comply with all company policies and procedures

 

Qualifications and Requirements

  • 1-3 years’ experience working in the construction industry
  • Experience using advanced formwork systems (LOGO or Peri preferred)
  • Knowledge of concrete pouring experience
  • Flat concrete finishing experience is an asset
  • Experience on 7 meter high walls is an asset
  • Experience working with circular formwork tanks is an asset
  • Knowledge of workplace safety and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Ability to operate carpentry tools and required equipment in a safe and responsible manner
  • Ability to read building specifications, prints and as-builds
  • Proactive in ensuring job knowledge is current
  • Respect diversity - treat others with respect
  • Valid WHMIS, Health and Safety Awareness Training for Workers and Working at Heights/Fall Arrest certificates are required.

BENEFITS:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Opportunities for career growth, development and advancement, including financial assistance
  • Comprehensive benefit plan (dental, vision, health, etc.)
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program
  • Excellent company matched pension plan
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plans
  • Additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day
  • Community involvement opportunities
  • Friendly working environment
  • Numerous team activities and various company events

How to apply:

Click on the link to complete an online application AND assessment: http://www.supportontarioyouth.ca/apprenticeships/

  1. Attach a detailed cover letter and resume.

We will ONLY be in touch with candidates who qualify for the positions.  We wish all applicants success.

title: General Laborer (Landscape Construction)
description:
General Laborer (Landscape Construction)

Reports to:  Crew Foreman

Company:

We are a growing company that specializes in Design Build Landscape work in a busy landscaping and excavation industry. Ability to grow with company, options for advancement.  No weekend work, working Monday to Friday approximately 40-50 hrs. With Fridays being a shortened day. Paid weekly, bonus on a yearly basis. Great rate of pay, training available. Options to work yearly. Snowplowing and excavation work in the winter months. Working hours are 7-5pm, except Fridays. 

Character:

We are looking for motivated employees, that have valid transportation, clean drivers abstract, ability to work as a team member in an environment that promotes professional workmanship, quality work, and passion for working in one of the most rewarding and wonderful industries.  Abilities should include, fast thinker, problem solving, attention to details, abilities to work in a fast-paced environment, working in all weather conditions. Working with and around heavy equipment.  Good mathematical skills, some knowledge of small engine repair and maintenance.  Priorities will be given to those with previous experience, and or AR, DZ or AZ licenses. 

Summary:

The Landscape Laborer is responsible for performing a variety of work tasks (generally physical labor) in order to assist with the completion of landscape construction projects. The landscape laborer will be required to operate a variety of tools and equipment to carry out specified job tasks.

  Core Capabilities:

  • Customer and quality focus
  • Effective communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Teamwork
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities
  • Responsibility and dependability
  • Ethics and integrity

  Job Duties:

  •   Assist in the preparation of jobsites prior to the beginning of a project
  • Operate various tools and equipment, including chainsaws, jackhammers, laser levels, measurement equipment, shovels, hammers, drills, etc.
  • Mix, pour, and spread concrete
  • Assist in the construction of walkways, fences, decks, posts, etc.
  • Perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment by conducting inspections, lubricating, and cleaning on a daily basis
  • Dig ditches or trenches
  • Perform land clearing activities
  • Plant and maintain garden beds and lawns
  • Load and unload materials, tools, and equipment required to complete landscape construction projects
  • Transport materials using shovels, wheelbarrows, carts, dollies, and hand lifting/carrying
  • Assist foreman with job-related tasks
  • Read and interpret blueprints, structural drawings, and specifications to perform work activities
  • Always wear appropriate personal protective equipment
  • Comply with all company policies and regulations
  • Work in accordance with all local health and safety laws and regulations

  Requirements:

  •   High School Diploma, GED or equivalent
  • Minimum one year experience in the landscape/construction industry
  • Capable of operating required equipment and tools in a safe and responsible manner
  • Effective communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Time management skills
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints and specifications
  • Knowledge of specific materials, methods, tools, and equipment required to complete various landscape/construction practices
  • Ability to work both independently with little supervision, and as part of a team
  • Ability to walk, stand, crouch for long periods of time and carry out strenuous physical tasks
  • Preference will be given to candidates with a valid driver’s license and safe driving record

Work Conditions:

  • Ability to work with hand tools, power tools, small engine equipment, and materials
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs. repeatedly through an entire work shift
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Requires good manual dexterity
  • Excellent stamina is required
  • Work near heavy equipment and other vehicles on a regular basis
  • Work outdoors in various conditions including heat and humidity, rain, dust, noise, and cold
  • Flexible working hours including occasional weekend work

Wages:

Wage Rate start at $19.00 and can range to $24.00.

Winter work avaliable for those wishing to work with our snowplowing division.

title: Scaffolder
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is actively recruiting Scaffolder - Adhoc for offshore Newfoundland and Labrador  

 

This position will require you to travel to offshore Newfoundland and Labrador via helicopter or supply vessel. Individuals

must be comfortable working in remote locations, confined spaces, and at heights.

 

Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to:                                        

  • Erect and dismantle scaffolds in accordance with Scaffold Operating Procedure.
  • Monitor scaffold materials and highlight any overages / shortages to Offshore Scaffold Lead.
  • Ensure that all equipment is fit for purpose condition prior to use and quarantine any defective materials.
  • Execute scaffold inspections as per Scaffold Operating Procedure.
  • Ensure that documentation is maintained in accordance to Scaffold Operating Procedure.
  • Must be conversant with all relevant standards, specifications, rules, regulations etc. including Permit to Work (PTW).

Ensure work is executed in accordance to agree guidance documents (i.e. work packs, work instructions, procedures and governing specifications).

 

Skills / Qualifications:

Candidates should possess the following qualifications:

  • Must have successfully completed a scaffolding training program from a recognized training institution and deemed to meet the requirements of â€œCompetent Scaffold Erectionâ€ and â€œAdvanced Scaffold Erectionâ€ as per CAPP guidelines.
  • Must have a thorough understanding of the applicable construction procedures and regulations related to the erection of scaffolds (i.e. CSA Z797 â€œCode of Practice for Access Scaffoldingâ€).
  • Must maintain scaffold certification in accordance to CAPP Guidelines.
  • Experience in an industrial maintenance environment (preferably in the offshore or petro-chemical / refinery industry).
  • Familiar with various types of scaffold materials (i.e. system scaffold, tubeâ€“andâ€“clamp).
  • Any equivalent combination of experience and / or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved may also be considered.                                                              

For this position, the following training/certifications would be considered and asset:

  • Basic Survival Training (BST) including HUET and HUEBA.
  • Hydrogen Sulphide (H2S) Alive.
  • Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015).
  • Offshore Safety Regulatory Awareness.
  • Fall Protection.
  • Confined Space Entry.
  • Emergency First Aid.
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Maintenance - Lead Hand
description:
PURPOSE OF POSITION:

This role is primarily responsible for assisting in the management of the day to day workload for the maintenance team to ensure an effective and efficient service is delivered and departmental targets are achieved, including the planning and resourcing of Planned Preventative Maintenance (PPM) and maintenance shutdown. Drive a culture of continuous improvement throughout the team. Provide leadership to the team, coordinating and overseeing their workloads, providing support to ensure that the team delivers, monitoring any issues, and ensuring targets.  Assist in developing the team by focusing on individual performance and support requirements to achieve high standards, while helping foster a culture of working safely. 

 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Assist in running an efficient maintenance operation which is able to fulfil operational and customer demand and meet set targets
  • Perform effective diagnosis of breakdowns and timely repair of equipment to maximize availability
  • Perform scheduled planned preventative maintenance in accordance to minimize unplanned downtime
  • Assist in the analysis of issues to root cause and development of countermeasures, improvement actions and/or suggestions to improve
  • Control and source maintenance tools, equipment and spares
  • Document breakdowns, identifying root cause and remedial action to help identify and resolve recurring issues
  • Effectively lead the maintenance team, working with manager and colleagues to ensure smooth workflow with maximum output
  • Provide technical expertise to the team
  • Assist in the identification of areas of development within the team to achieve a flexible and responsive team which can support the demands of the organization
  • Motivate and coach the team to operational success
  • Consistently promote high standards through personal example and roll out through the team so that each member of the team understands the standards and behaviours expected of them
  • Assist the departments to efficiently use materials, labour and equipment to meet and exceed production targets.
  • Strong leadership and communication skills along with organizational skills are required
  • Undertake continuous training and development
  • Assist management in the coordination and communication of the department during vacations and absences.

 

Health & Safety

  • Enforce and actively promote safe work and good housekeeping practices within the current Ontario Safety legislation and the Active Safety program by employing daily job observation.
  • Adheres to safety practices and lockout applications. Participates in all 5S activities.

 

 

Training & Supplies

  • Ensures proper training and instruction of team with respect to expected standards of work performance, and job safety.
  • Advises on and applies technical knowledge / training to the team. Ensures required supplies for the team are on hand. Troubleshoots processes and equipment.

 

General

  • Completes and ensures that all necessary reports and written documentation in order to comply with Active Exhaust Policies and Procedures.
  • Participate in Continuous Improvement of department.
  • Ensure fair treatment of all employees consistent with the Employment Standards Act, the Human Rights Code, Active employee relations policies and the Collective Bargaining Agreement.
  • Immediately advise Manager of any circumstances that affect production, or safety.
  • Performs other duties as assigned

 

Requirements:

  • Min. grade 12 or equivalent
  • 3 years relevant experience (maintenance)
  • Computer literate
  • Highly developed written and communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a team player

title: Maintenance Temp
description:
Location



First Canadian Place - 100 King Street West



Business




Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations — bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It’s why the world’s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.




If you’re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.




Job Description




Working within a multi-task team environment performing and/or assisting in maintenance routines on building equipment. The position demands flexibility, availability to work primarily day shifts, and a positive, cooperative work attitude. Perform preventative maintenance routines on building equipment and washroom deficiencies.




RESPONSIBILITIES:



+ Perform standard maintenance routines on building equipment and systems.


+ Perform standard washroom inspections and minor repairs.


+ Respond to Tenant calls regarding lighting and plumbing issues.


+ Cleaning and Painting as required.


+ Other duties as assigned.


+ Embody and support Brookfield Properties’ Safety, Health and Environment Policy.


+ Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate hazards to reduce risk to the workplace.


+ Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely.


+ Take action to stop work if it cannot be executed safely or if conditions or behaviours are unsafe.


+ Immediately report SH&E incidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and/or at-risk behaviours to their supervisor; then diligently work to correct the problem.


+ Promote safe work practices and safe working conditions in accordance with all Brookfield Properties Safe Work Procedures.


+ Wear Personal Protective Equipment when required.





SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS:


Service oriented with excellent communication skills. Must be self-motivated, with the ability to work both independently and in a team, while learning from others. Must have a positive attitude and present a professional image.




EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:



+ General building maintenance experience


+ Available to work afternoons





EDUCATION/DESIGNATIONS/LICENSES:



+ Minimum Grade 12 education


+ A certificate in Building Systems Engineering or working towards it.






We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will accommodate the needs of all qualified applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

title: Carpenter (FT)
description:
As a Carpenter, you will be responsible for reading blueprints and working with lumber, plywood, wallboard, and other materials to help within the scope of our Building Envelope projects. You may build and repair wooden structures and use a variety of tools such as hammers, power saws, tape measures, drills, etc. depending on the needs of our Building Envelope project.

With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team!

Responsibilities:
  • Installing wooden structures such as roofing frames, rafters, partitions, joists, and stud work
  • Selecting lumber by size and strength to suit each job, sourcing wood to suit the customer’s budget and style
  • Calculating the number of fasteners required for each job
  • Reading blueprints and designs to work to specifications prepared by other construction professionals, architects, and building code recommendations
  • Liaising with clients, suppliers, and other construction professionals
  • Other duties assigned.

Requirements:
  • At least 2 to 3 years of experience as a Carpenter or equivalent.
  • A certificate in the relevant area is preferred.
  • Experience in using hand and power tools such as drills, chisels, sanders, saws, and nail guns.
  • Commitment to the job site safety and project quality
  • Understanding of construction procedures, equipment, and Safety Guidelines
  • Excellent organizational and execution skills
  • Experience using construction machinery is an asset

Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, stable work-life balance, positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.

title: General Labour
description:
Location : Hamilton ON 

City : Hamilton 

State : Ontario (CA-ON) 

Country : Canada (CA) 

Requisition Number : 20683 

Position Summary:

This position involves various shift arrangements and the incumbents must be flexible to accommodate the frequently changing shift arrangements.  Shifts can be day shift, Monday to Friday 0700 hours to 1530 hours. However the incumbents will frequently be required to fill in on twelve hour rotating shifts as a spare person on shift.  Shift schedules and job assignments for this position are arranged by the Material Handling Supervisor in accordance with the business requirements for the various plant areas.  The position requires a conscientious person in the areas of operational procedures, quality control, GMP, reporting, safety and housekeeping and customer service.  This area of responsibility requires a person whom can work flexible schedules, on relatively short notice, as directed by the needs of the business.

This position will start out doing general housekeeping type work in the plant.

 

 

Core Functions:

  • Totally responsible for any area of operations assigned to during all hours of work to which assigned on a particular shift or week.
  • Compliance with any Work Instruction – Operational Procedures
  • Maintaining the safe and efficient use of all equipment, ensuring only the equipment that needs to run is operating and in good order
  • Maintaining Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) at all times
  • Safely and efficiently operating the Locomotive Switch Engine and Trackmobile as required.
  • Safely and efficiently operating the plant Bob Cat and Case Skid Steer as required.
  • Safely and efficiently operating the plant forklift as required.
  • Safely and efficiently operating the rail car tugger as required.
  • Maintaining a stock of sufficient cleaning supplies and equipment in the stockroom.
  • Maintaining a stock of sufficient safety supplies in the stockroom, and distributing the same to various plant storage areas.
  • Cleaning up of plant grounds and perimeter areas as required and directed by Supervision.
  • Loading of meal and hulls products and unloading of incoming beans and seed rail cars, trucks and vessels (ships) as required.
  • Completing the proper paperwork for all loads received and loaded.  As these loads are shipped and received in bulk, the incumbents are responsible for the accurate operation of truck and rail bulk weighing scales and accurately recording of the weights received or shipped, as the case may be.
  • Basic computer and keyboard skills sufficient to accurately use the plant OneWeigh and System 2000 programs. 
  • Maintaining Safety Standards in all areas of the operation
  • Maintain and clean all areas of the operations at all times. Will also be responsible for cleaning in any other area of the plant as required by Supervision.
  • Maintaining personal hygiene, cleanliness and appearance including compliance with Bunge Hamilton dress code as, at times, this person will be dealing directly with our customers.
  • Must comply with Bunge Safety Policy E-3 Respiratory Equipment.  The incumbent must be and remain sufficiently free of facial hair so as to guarantee the necessary proper fitting of respirator equipment at all times while on site and be willing to undergo periodic fit testing as required by the policy.
  • The ability to wear and use proper fall restraint apparatus when working at heights.
  • Provide written reports of Operational/Equipment problems and discrepancies to the Supervisor, utilizing the “Employee Departmental Report” form, and following the “Operator Protocol for Calling the On-call Supervisor” and the Company Call-In Procedures when necessary.  Work orders to be processed through the direct report unless priority #1 during off hours.
  • Provide accurate written reports on any Incidents, Accidents, Fire or Spills as necessary, utilizing the “Employee Departmental Report” form.
  • Complying with all Bunge Corporate and Hamilton policies, including Safe Work Practices, Emergency Measures Plan, Hourly Employee’s Handbook, and the Health and Safety Act of Ontario.  Maintaining Safety Standards in all areas of work.
  • Reporting on small inventories needed for the area of operations
  • Call in to the Boiler Room Operator at 3:00 am for attendance check-in when on shift.
  • Must complete any other tasks required to run a safe and efficient operation or as requested by the Company

 

Skill/Experience Requirements:

  • Grade 12 education required, technical college diploma preferred.
  • Good mechanical aptitude.
  • Good computer / keyboard skills
  • Able to consistently lift up to 22.7 kg.
  • Must be able to work from heights and in confined spaces.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both oral and written

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

 

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: General Laborer (General Assembler)
description:
We Are

Thermon Canada Inc. is a World leader in Process heating systems. We are currently experiencing rapid growth due to global expansion.

We design and manufacture heating and filtration systems for the Energy sector primarily Oil, Gas, Nuclear and process heating applications.

Thermon has an established record of innovation and excellence. We recognize this is only possible with the hard work and dedication of our employees. We strive to maintain a dynamic and diverse workforce.

We offer environments where collaboration, mentoring and professional growth are encouraged. Ideal candidates for our team will recognize the value of being a part of an organization that not only provides a competitive wage but that also promises a great career.

The Role

In this position you will build various equipment for heating systems, for customers across North America.

What You Will Do

  • Review traveler/job package, and drawings
  • Find and use proper materials
  • Test equipment or any parts necessary (e.g. elements)
  • Assembly of the product in proper sequence as instructed and by operation date
  • Test and make sure the product is correct to all specifications provided on Job Traveler and release to QC
  • Make sure parts are free of damage before use
  • Other tasks as assigned by the supervisor or manager

Knowledge & Qualifications

  • Grade 12
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

What You Bring To This Role

  • Strong communication, reading, and writing skills
  • Ability to use hand and power tools
  • Hand/eye coordination
  • Team player
  • High regard for safety

title: Skilled Carpenters!
description:
We are in need of skilled carpenters!

Salary: Hourly: Min. $36.00 to $40.00 for 45.00 hours per week

Anticipated start date: March/April 2022

Terms of Employment: Permanent Full-Time

Number of positions: 2

Employment Conditions: Day

Employer: Landscapes By Lucin

Web site: www.lucin.net

Languages: English

Education: Completion of High School; some college/CGEP/vocational or technical training

Credentials (certificates, licenses, memberships, courses, etc.)

3rd period Apprentice, WHMIS Certificate

Experience: 2 years to less than 3 years

Major Work Area: Construction; Maintenance/Repair; Renovations

Type of Establishment/Work Setting Experience: Residential

Area of Specialization:

General carpentry, rough carpentry, finish carpentry, framing, form work, custom stairs, exterior siding, landscape carpentry, fences, decks, pergolas, arbours, custom screens, gazebos, belvederes, and other outdoor structures.

Specific Skills:

Determining specifications and calculating material needs, preparing site layouts, meausuring, cutting, shaping, assembling, joining mouldings, wood materials, fitting header boards, building porches, stringers, railings, stairs, and having full knowledge of all necessary power tools.

Additional skills:

Reading and interpreting blueprints, drawings and specifications, estimating labour and material costs, owning personal tools/equipment, safety gear, personal protective equipment.

Work Site Environment:

Outdoors, ladder work, noisy with possible dusty conditions, must have valid and clean "G" license with personal vehicle at all times.

title: Part Time Maintenance
description:
Weekend Maintanenace

Ottawa, On – Rideau Center

Who You’ll Work For

REEF’s mission is to connect the world to your block. 

We transform underutilized urban spaces into neighborhood hubs that connect people to locally curated goods, services, and experiences.

With an ecosystem of 5,000 locations and a team of 18,000 people, REEF is the largest operator of mobility, logistics hubs, and neighborhood kitchens in North America.

Together we are leveraging the power of proximity to keep our communities moving forward in a sustainable and thoughtful way.
 

What You’ll Do

  • Pick up all garbage and litter throughout the parking facility, including entrance and exit ramps.
  • Replace bags in the garbage cans throughout the parking facility.
  • Wipe down all garbage receptacles.
  • Pick up litter in all pay on foot vestibules.
  • Hand sweep areas of garbage where required i.e. Dirt accumulation in corners etc.
  • Parking office to be swept and mopped.
  • Wash garbage containers in the parking facility.
  • Clean the washrooms and parking office windows.
  • These are guidelines and express the minimum expectations, other duties may be assigned.
  • Staircases need to be cleaned and swept if need. 

Physical Demands:

  • Move around the property by walking for extended periods of time.
  • Must be able to lift 15 lbs on a daily basis.
  • Must be able to stand/walk for periods of time.

Working Conditions:

  • Work is performed in a covered outdoor environment.
  • Employees are subject to environmental conditions including heat and cold weather.
  • Protection from weather conditions will be provided, but not necessarily from temperature changes.

REEF Technology is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. REEF does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. REEF complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

title: General Labourer ($19/h + shift premiums + $600 signing bonus)
description:
Company Description

The launch of our production season 2022 has several surprises in store for you!!

Hurry now is the time to initiate a new career!!  You will be eligible to a $600 sign on bonuse after your probation period and will be eligible to participate in several draws with a value of up to $500, including tickets to the Montreal Canadiens and gift cards!

No experience required. We are searching for bright, hard-working and reliable individuals interested in a successful career in manufacturing. Take your chance and come join us!

Here is why you must join Techo-Bloc:

  • Competitive salary
  • Starting basic hourly rate $18.50/hour and $19/hour at the end of the probation period Bonus Overt Time  
  • Shift Premiums available
  • End of year Bonus 
  • Overtime opportunities 
  • Several shift options available (rotation, day, evening, weekend)
  • Refer a friend for a competitive referral bonus
  • Weekly pay
  • RRSP Program available in 2022
  • Group insurance plan after 3 months of service for permanent employees
  • Career path opportunities – move to production, distribution, maintenance, transportation or supervisory roles

Shifts offered:

  • 3-day weekend shift Shift premium (Friday - Sunday 5h30AM to 5h30PM)
  • Morning shift for early risers (Monday - Thursday 5h30AM to 5h30PM)
  • Night shift for the night owls  Shift premium (Monday- Thursday 5h30PM to 5h30AM)
  • Rotation shift: 1 week day shift and 1 week night shift
Job Description

Snapshot of your day to day

Are you a diligent worker that loves to work with your hands and you are looking for a stimulating and well-paid job? This is the right place for you!

At Techo-Bloc, our general laborers are a crucial part to our day to day operations. This role is a perfect fit for those newer to the industry, or anyone looking for a career steppingstone in manufacturing. 

Speaking of stones, our laborers are true concrete connoisseurs!  Your day-to-day will entail handling and inspecting concrete blocks, while serving as the ‘right hand’ to our machine operator and maintenance team.

  • Complete examination of finished product by checking height, shape, color and consistency by applying knowledge of proper company standards as instructed and applicable for in process systems;
  • Complete block checks, remove any defective pieces from pallet or board and replace defective pieces with quality pieces. These tasks vary by line and by product and process that the General Labourer is assigned to;
  • Sort, pack, crate and package materials and products;
  • Performs other laboring and elemental activities;
  • Clean machines and immediate work areas.
Qualifications

  • No experience required, training will be provided;
  • You will be using your manual skills. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds (23kg). We won’t hide it from you, this is a physically demanding position;
  • Manual dexterity, hand-eye co-ordination and a combination of sitting, standing and walking required;
  • Punctuality, concentration and thoroughness;
  • Team spirit and collaboration.


Additional Information

Interested? Here is how you can apply:

  • Apply online right here
  • Apply by phone to this number: 1 877-832-4625 ext. 2
  • If you prefer, you can drop by with your resume or fill out a form at our Saint-Hubert’s Head Office (5255 Rue Albert-Millichamp, Saint-Hubert, Quebec, J3Y 8Z8)

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have. We look forward to meeting you!

Other benefits we offer:

  • Employee discounts on Techo-Bloc’s products
  • On-site training and additional courses available such as forklift certification (if it`s a work requirement)
  • Awesome uniforms and swag
  • Newly renovated plant kitchens and bathrooms in St-Hubert plants
  • Free Parking
  • Epic barbecues and Christmas parties
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP available 24/7)

Additional information

Headquartered on the South Shore of Montreal, Techo-Bloc is a leader in outdoor landscape products. We passionately create new products to allow all design enthusiasts to transform ordinary spaces into exceptional spaces.

Why work for Techo-Bloc, you may ask? We listen and respect our employees and encourage them to make an impact. We love talent and people who are ready to roll up their sleeves to get the job done. If you're looking to put your knowledge, experience and passion into play, this is the place for you. We celebrate change, welcome your bold initiatives, and support you in bringing them to life. Our company has grown rapidly and this is just the beginning. Come join one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies and make this your next big move. You will not be disappointed!

COVID-19 considerations

The health and safety of our employees is important to us. To keep our staff safe, we've implemented safety guidelines in line with prevalent Quebec laws and regulations.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Description

Gentek is a leading manufacturer and distributor of vinyl/aluminum siding and windows and other exterior home improvement products. With 3 manufacturing facilities and 22 distribution branches in Canada we are well-positioned to provide our customers with the best products and a superior service experience.

At Gentek Building Products, we’ve made a commitment to our customers that they can rely on us to provide the quality exterior home improvement products they need. But that’s not enough. For us to be considered as their business partner, we know we also need to ensure that every transaction with us, at every point of contact, equates to a superior service experience, and that’s where our great employees come in. 

Maybe you are just the person to join our team? Keep reading!

Job Description

We are looking for General Labourers to join the team at our unionized vinyl siding manufacturing facility in Burlington, Ontario!

Must be able and willing to work required weekly rotating shifts: Days (8am - 4pm), Afternoons (4pm - 12am), and Nights (12am - 8am).

Primary Duties:
•    Pack finished product on extrusion lines
•    Monitor and check product quality
•    Responsible for all aspects of product packaging, including making boxes, crating, labeling, identification and reporting

Details:
•    $22.16/hour to start with a $1.00/hr increase after 9 months as per Collective Bargaining Agreement, plus $0.75/hr premium when working the afternoon shift and $1.00/hr premium when working the night shift
•    Full-time, 40 hours/week
•    Physically demanding job: Position requires standing and walking for prolonged periods of time, pushing, pulling, bending, twisting and lifting up to 50 lbs regularly
•    Personal Protective Equipment must be worn as assigned by the Company including but not limited to safety glasses, steel-toed safety shoes and hearing protection
•    Great benefits with 100% company paid premiums and pension plan with 100% employer contributions!!!

Qualifications

•    High school diploma or equivalent
•    Previous production experience in a fast paced manufacturing environment an asset
•    Ability to multitask, work under pressure and work flexible hours when required



Additional Information

We're growing - come grow with us! If you are qualified, please apply with your resume describing your experience. If your qualifications are a match, you will be contacted.

Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request.

title: General Labourer
description:
Stoney Soil Products Ltd. is looking for a General Laborer to join our team. We are located northwest of Cremona in the Elkton area. This position is Full-time and is open for an immediate start. 

Duties: All aspects of a custom soil packaging facility - filling and stacking bags of soil.

Qualifications:
  • Forklift and skid steer experience is an asset but not a requirement.  
  • Must work well in a team setting and have your own transportation.  
  • Must be capable of lifting up to 20kgs.

We offer a Full Benefits Package and competitive wages based on experience.
