title: General Labourers
description:
General Labourers

This is a physically and mentally challenging position involving heavy lifting, hard work, solid people skills, willingness to take direction and a desire to perform requested duties with a focus on safety and appropriate precautions.

Requirements:
  • Must pass a pre-employment Drug & Alcohol Test
  • Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Class 5 driver’s license with clean drivers abstract
  • Comprehension and compliance of all safety procedures
  • Must have a good handle on the use of power and hand tools (drills, impacts, wrenches, etc).
  • A disciplined work ethic and ability to take initiative as well as accept direction
  • Remain alert, and maintain a high level of concentration along with problem solving skills
  • Have good judgement and the ability to react quickly
  • Capable of working in both a team and individual environment
  • Physically fit and capable of long hours
  • Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
  • Ability and certification operating small equipment such as forklift and skid-steer would be an asset.

If you are energetic and excited to work as part of a team, focused on completing each job to the highest standards and want to contribute your skills and experience then we want to hear from you!
We thank all applicants in advance for your interest in RoskaDBO Inc., and this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Carpenter
description:
Start Date: Immediately

Big Loop Construction is looking for quality Carpenters to join their crew in Calgary. Big Loop is a growing construction company with multiple projects underway.

This is a full-time position with an excellent opportunity for growth. We offer competitive wages and benefits.

Candidates should be motivated, hardworking, safety-oriented, responsible, and reliable.

First Aid Ticket is an asset for this position.

Position Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Measure, cut, shape, assemble and join materials made of wood, wood substitutes, lightweight steel, and other materials; Build foundations, columns, suspended slabs, erect wood walls, and construct roof systems.
  • Actively participating, promoting, and engaging others in a culture of safety.
  • Must be organized and able to keep work area clean.
  • Willing to learn and have a "Can do" attitude.
  • Work well independently and as part of a team.
  • Communicating information clearly and effectively and working independently or as part of a team.
  • Listening and carrying out instructions diligently and speaking up when instructions are unclear.

Required Qualifications

  • Residential construction experience.
  • Ability to read blueprints.
  • Knowledge of the occupational hazards and safety precautions applicable to the work.
  • Ability to understand and execute oral and written instructions.
  • Skilled in the use and care of hand and small power tools associated with the work.
  • Proficiency with hand and air tools
  • Must be legally eligible to work for any employer in Canada.

Physical Requirements

  • Must be able to lift 30-50lbs as needed
  • Must be able to work in outdoor weather and/or unregulated temperatures for up to 10 hours/day

We thank all applicants for their interest, only those qualified will be contacted for an interview.

Job Type: Full-time

title: SEASONAL LABOURER II - CEMETERY
description:
Job Description:

 

Exciting things are happening at the City of Brampton. Take a look at what employees are working on related to our Term of Council Priorities moving us forward towards The Brampton 2040 Vision.

 

 

2022 SUMMER OPPORTUNITY - SEASONAL LABOURER II - CEMETERY

 

 

Are you looking to gain valuable experience, learn new skills and grow your career doing meaningful work with  one of Canadaâ€™s Top 100 Employers? Then consider a summer job with our Parks Maintenance and Forestry Division. If you are returning to school in the fall and are looking to gain some great experience we want to hear from you.

 

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

 

Reporting to the Foreperson, this position is responsible to assist with the daily maintenance of Bramptonâ€™s cemeteries. Ensure the safe operation of equipment and vehicles and compliance with rules and regulations.  

  • Assist with restoration and maintenance of burial plots after burial or removal of human remains â€“ i.e. level graves, topsoil, seed, sod, irrigate.
  • Assist with general turf maintenance â€“ i.e. fertilizing, mowing, trimming, seeding, watering.
  • Perform garbage collection, litter picking and maintenance of amenities.
  • Assist with grave site maintenance and care â€“ i.e. removal of flowers from graves.
  • Edge and level grave markers.
  • Assist with gardening â€“ i.e. soil management, maintain and plant flowerbeds/displays.
  • Assist with tree and shrub care â€“ i.e. pruning, fertilizing, planting and staking.
  • Report all concerns, accidents and incidents to immediate supervisor for follow up and take appropriate action.
  • Responsible for the safe and efficient operation, care of tools and equipment.
  • Communicate courteously with the general public and where necessary refer them to appropriate supervisor.
  • Understand, adhere to, and enforce Corporate Policies & Procedures, Confidentiality Guidelines, Emergency Procedures and Health and Safety Standards for all participants and staff.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

 

SELECTION CRITERIA:

  • Completion of Grade 11
  • Current Standard First from an accredited organization
  • Ability to perform physical work duties in varied/all weather conditions
  • Exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Valid Ontario non-probationary Class G Drivers Licence
  • Ability to successfully acquire City of Brampton Drivers and Equipment permits

 

**Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the selection criteria.

 

Job status:   Summer/Seasonal

Employment period is from April to September, based  on a 40 hour work week.

 

Hourly rate:    $16.75

Applications must be received by July 01, 2022

Alternate formats will be provided  upon request.

 

   

 

If this opportunity matches your interest and experience, please apply online by clicking the button above by July 01, 2022  and complete the attached questionnaire. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate(s) will be required, as a condition of employment, to execute a written employment agreement. A criminal record search will be required of the successful candidate to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted.

 

Preference will be given to students that have a permanent residency in Brampton.

 

As part of the application process, applicants will be invited to complete a self identification survey. The survey is voluntary. Participation in the survey will have no impact on hiring decisions.   All information collected is confidential and will not be shared with the hiring manager. The surveys will be anonymized and will be kept separate from applicant or employee files, such that the individuals who completed the surveys will not be identifiable.   The results of the survey will assist in the analysis of disaggregated metrics for organizational planning purposes and our commitment to advance and foster diversity, equity, and inclusion. The City may use anonymized data to produce aggregate reports for internal or external use.

 

Please be advised, the City of Brampton uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicantâ€™s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition. The City is an equal opportunity employer.  

 

The City is an equal opportunity employer.   We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If you require any accommodations at any point during the application and hiring process, please contact TalentAcquisition@brampton.ca or 905.874-2150 with your accommodation needs, quoting the job opening ID#, job title. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

title: Labourer
description:
Inland Technologies

Labourer (Seasonal Full-time)

YYZ â€“ Toronto Pearson International Airport

The members of the Inland Group of Companies (Inland Technologies, IDS and Quantem Aviation Services) are highly experienced in environmental management, aircraft de-icing, ground handling and pretty much any other aviation support service you can think of. We operate at over 50 airports in four countries. Inland Technologies core business is the delivery of airport environmental compliance programs. We are continuously innovating the technologies we use to provide our range of services including, spent aircraft de-icing fluid collection and recycling, wastewater management, and aircraft de-icing fluid manufacturing for reuse.

Our business is built on a foundation of excellence in customer service, innovation and continuous improvement and safety is at the forefront of everything we do.  We provide a workplace where respect, integrity and a high degree of ethical behaviour is a minimum expectation.  To learn more about our organization, please visit our website at:  www.inlandgroup.ca

 

We are currently providing an opportunity for a well-rounded safety focused individual to join our team in the position of Labourer at our YYZ Toronto Pearson International Airport station.

 

About You:

The ideal candidate will be someone who is passionate about safety, doesnâ€™t shy away from a challenge and is comfortable working in an environment where the noise level can be excessive at times.

 

About the Position:

Aside from the excitement of working in a busy production facility, the essential duties and responsibilities of this position include:

  • Promoting and adhering to our safety and respectful workplace culture and instilling this culture in the station while ensuring safety and regulatory compliance with all Government Labour, Health and Safety laws, regulations and policies. HAVE ZERO TOLERANCE FOR UNSAFE ACTS!;
  • Plan and carry out work assignments and handle problems in accordance with instructions, policies, previous training or accepted company practices and procedures;
  • Keep all Inland owned or managed equipment, tools and materials in good working condition, including keeping clean and returning to assigned storage areas when not in use;
  • Clean MVR plates, change filters on concentrators, clean cyclones, clean area in around and under concentrators, and cleaning heat exchanger plates;
  • Maintain facility cleanliness and appearance including garbage removal, washroom cleaning and restocking and other general cleaning requirements;
  • Promptly and accurately complete all associated paperwork as required;
  • Perform and record light maintenance tasks and immediately report any repair requirements;
  • Perform/complete other additional projects, duties, and assignments as required and/or by management request.

 

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or equivalent;
  • Valid RAIC and AVOP considered an asset; 
  • Must be available and flexible to work variable shifts including weekends and holidays for the duration of the season;
  • Ability to work independently showing good judgement;
  • Ability to read, write, speak and communicate effectively;
  • Ability to interpret documents including safety rules, operating, maintenance and procedure manuals;
  • General mechanical competence and ability to effectively use hand tools;
  • Ability to work as part of a team;
  • Ability to maintain a positive and good-natured attitude;
  • Self-starter with the ability to prioritize workload to ensure deadlines are met;
  • Willing to learn new skills and adapt to change in order to support the growth of the company and meet needs of customers.

 

About Inland: 

At Inland, we offer the following benefits, some of which are subject to eligibility:

  • A rewarding and safe work environment (company provided PPE);
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching;
  • Growth and advancement opportunities for high potential employees;
  • Employee and family assistance program;
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package;
  • Pension plan with employer contribution;
  • Access to group rates and discounts.

 

If you are a self-starter who is committed to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction and your experience and ability meet with the above minimum requirements, please forward your cover letter and resume to the Inland HR Team, quoting posting number 22-18.  Full job description available upon request. 

 

Please apply online.

Inland is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

Please note:  All employees working in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 unless provided by Inland with an approved accommodation under Canada's Human Rights Act.

title: Scaffolders (All Levels) - Wood Buffalo
description:
Brock Canada Field Services is Hiring Scaffolders of all levels for multiple sites in the Wood Buffalo Area. 

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Must have a minimum of one year's previous Scaffolding experience.
  • Valid Certification for Skill Level 
  • OSSA or ESC Fall Protection 
  • OSSA Regional or OSSA BSO or CSTS-09 and CSO
  • H2S Alive 
  • OSSA or ESC Confined Space
  • WHIMS 2015
  • Must be able to pass the pre-access A&D test requirements.
  • Double Vaccinated - As per the Federal Government and Transport Canada, you must be double vaccinated as of November 30th to board a plane.
If you think you'd be a good fit, apply now with your resume and safety tickets!

Note: In order to access worksites in this region, you must adhere to the Transport Canada Regulations. Please check your flying eligibility on the Transport Canada website for travel.

title: Labourer
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

GenAlta is looking for a Labourer to maintain and perform minor repairs to equipment associated with the MSS plant including conveyors, shakers, compressors, trammel and batch feeder.

EVRAZ is committed to maintaining and promoting a safe, healthy and injury-free environment.  It is required for all jobs.

  • Keeps work area is clean and ready to go daily

  • Responsible for maintaining a productive and consistent flow of material through the MSS, optimizing the balance between throughput and quality

  • Monitor flow of product from a raw material state through to the finished product

  • Responsible for accurately documenting daily startup and any delays

  • Keeps conveyor bearings clean and ensure they have grease

  • Reports any issues that arise immediately 

  • Assists in meeting monthly production goals

  • Performs other duties that they might be assigned

Job Requirements

  • Completion of High School and/or equivalent.

  • Previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrap-yard/auto part environment will be considered an asset

  • Ability to push, pull and lift materials up to 50 lbs

  • Standing for up to 12 hours, regular walking, squatting and climbing

  • Ability to learn and follow direction

  • Mechanically inclined

  • Able to operate the skid steer

  • Good attention to detail and quality control

  • Mentally alert to surroundings

  • Self-motivated: Initiates and takes action before being required to do so

  • Strong work ethic: uses time efficiently, work safely and making sure everyone around him/her are working safely

  • Strong command of the English language both written and spoken

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Journeyman Ironworkers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!
description:
Currently we are looking for Journeyman Ironworkers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Employee Benefit Program
  • Employee Assistance Program

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Alberta Ironworker Journeyman or Red Seal Certification
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015
  • Valid Fall Protection Certificate
  • Valid Aerial Work Platform
  • Physically capable of performing all tasks required of field Ironworkers
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment

**At this time, our client’s may request contractors, vendors and suppliers to be fully vaccinated while providing service to their sites and therefore may require candidates to attest their vaccination disclosure status**
At Phoenix Industrial, we believe we are stronger together. That’s why we believe that investing in our people and the communities in which we work and live returns to us ten-fold. We invest in your growth because we believe it is essential for our continued success. 
We are proud of our company, our projects, our sustainable growth and most importantly our people. And we’d be proud to welcome you to the Phoenix family.
Come Grow With Us!

title: General Labour - Ancaster, ON
description:
We are looking for talented, reliable and hard-working people. With multiple opportunities on packaging production lines. The current opportunities are available in several production areas of the facility but are not limited to Packing Packaging and Operating Packaging Machines.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Operating state of the art equipment to manufacture various types of food and beverage packaging.
  • Visually inspect the finished product prior to placing it into the shipping box.
  • Make boxes, load product belts, replenish materials around machines such as tape, boxes, and bags.
  • Complete hourly quality checks and assist with quality inspections as needed.
  • Ensure housekeeping standards are followed.

Requirements:

  • Ability to comfortably stand for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to comfortably walk, sit, bend, and crouch.
  • Able to lift up to 30lbs (occasionally may be required to lift up to 50lbs)
  • The ability to perform repetitive tasks with high attention to detail.
  • Works well within a team-based environment

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Location: Ancaster, ON

For more details, contact: 905-276-4040

title: General Labourer
description:
Job Description

We are looking for GENERAL LABOURERS for our clien's sawmill in NAIRN CENTRE, in Ontario.

Reporting to the production supervisor, you will be performing various tasks related to production.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Stacking lumber bundles for drying, ensuring proper placement of stickers.
  • Operating various plant equipment to ensure flow of lumber and maintain quality and efficiency of process.
  • Rotating through various roles within the assigned area.
  • Clean-up of the mill and yard, sweeping and shoveling sawdust and picking up broken pieces of wood.
  • Training on various other roles as required.
  • Perform other duties as required to ensure efficiency of the production process.

SKILLS PROFILE

  • Teamworking skills.
  • Autonomy and initiative.
  • Exercise vigilance and adhere to all health/safety policies.

Qualifications

  • Ability to work safely in an industrial environment.
  • Relevant experience is an asset.
  • Be available to work on day and/or night shifts as well as weekends.

Additional Information

If you are invited to continue the selection process, please notify us of any particular adaptive measures you might require. Any information you send us will be handled respectfully and in complete confidence.

The client is an employer that respects equal opportunities in employment.

The masculine gender is only for abbreviation.

title: Maintenance Temp (Part-Time)
description:
Brookfield Properties, Office

At Brookfield Properties, our success starts with our people. People like you.

We develop, operate, and manage more than 650 properties and 325 million square feet of real estate across the globe. Itâ€™s a feat that wouldnâ€™t be possible without our team, a diverse group of creative visionaries and innovative experts who are relentless in pursuit of one goal: to ensure our buildings donâ€™t simply meet the needs of our tenants, residents, and communities â€” but exceed them, every day.

Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations â€” bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. Itâ€™s why the worldâ€™s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.

If youâ€™re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

As part of employment with Brookfield Properties, successful candidates must be fully vaccinated and are required to provide proof in the form of a government issued record prior to their first day.

DESCRIPTION: 

Working within a multi-task team environment performing and/or assisting in maintenance routines on building equipment.  The position demands flexibility, availability to work primarily day shifts, and a positive, cooperative work attitude.  Perform preventative maintenance routines on building equipment and washroom deficiencies.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Perform standard washroom inspections.
  • Cleaning and Painting as required.
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Embody and support Brookfield Propertiesâ€™ Safety, Health and Environment Policy.
    • Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate hazards to reduce risk to the workplace.
    • Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely.
    • Take action to stop work if it cannot be executed safely or if conditions or behaviours are unsafe.
    • Immediately report SH&E incidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and/or at-risk behaviours to their supervisor; then diligently work to correct the problem.
    • Promote safe work practices and safe working conditions in accordance with all Brookfield Properties Safe Work Procedures.
    • Wear Personal Protective Equipment when required.

QUALIFICATIONS:

SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS: 

Service oriented with excellent communication skills.  Must be self-motivated, with the ability to work both independently and in a team, while learning from others.  Must have a positive attitude and present a professional image.

EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:

  • General building maintenance experience
  • Available to work afternoons

EDUCATION/DESIGNATIONS/LICENSES:

  • Minimum Grade 12 education
  • A certificate in Building Systems Engineering or working towards it.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

Brookfield is committed to accommodating the individual needs of all applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process as required under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

title: General Labour
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

The General Labourer is responsible for the transportation of raw materials, finished products, and equipment throughout the plant manually or using powered equipment. He/she will check and weigh materials and products. The general Labourer will sort, pack, crate, and package materials and products based on Flex-N-Gateâ€™s policies and procedures. This position will assist other machine operators, assemblers, and other workers when necessary. This position must clean the work areas and equipment according to Flex-N-Gateâ€™s policies and procedures. Completion of other duties as assigned will be required.

Responsibilities:

Transport raw materials, finished products and equipment throughout plant manually or using powered equipment
Check and weigh materials and products
Sort, pack, crate, and package materials and products according to Flex-N-Gateâ€™s policies and procedures
Assist other machine operators, assemblers, and other workers when required
Clean work areas and equipment according to Flex-N-Gateâ€™s policies and procedures
Perform other duties when required

 

Core Competencies:

Customer Focus
Communication
Energy and Stress  
Team Work                    
Quality Orientation                    
Problem Solving      
Accountability and Dependability
Operating Equipment            
Ethics and Integrity

Qualifications:

Requirements
STAGE 1, 2, 3
High School Diploma, G.E.D. or equivalent
1 + years of working experience in a manufacturing field would be an asset
Ability to participate in continuous improvement processes
Ability to multi-task and establish priorities
Ability to work independently in a busy environment
Able to work well under pressure
Strong attention to detail

Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Lead Carpenter
description:
Residential Lead Carpenter


  • Looking to work in the Toronto core on exciting residential projects?
  • Ready to use your carpentry skills to build the highest quality homes?
  • Wanting to find a fun and professional place to make your mark, learn and grow?


If so, we're looking for you!


Must Haves:

  • Own vehicle and valid Ontario driver’s license
  • Own tools and PPE
  • Must own a smart phone with a data plan to use Buildertrend App
  • Ability to read, understand, and explain Architectural, Mechanical and Structural Drawings and relay details accordingly

 

Qualifications:

  • 5+ Year Framing Experience in the High-End Residential Renovation/Custom Home Building field
  • 5+ years Trim/Finish Carpentry experience
  • Proven experience managing carpenters and sub-trades
  • Proven ability to work within deadlines and budgets
  • Strong Time Management and Self-Management skills
  • Strong working knowledge of job site safety and building codes
  • High standard of integrity, craftsmanship and professionalism
  • Excellent People skills; sub-trades, suppliers, clients, neighbors and SevernWoods staff
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds, climb ladders and scaffolding
  • Pay rate dependent on Experience & Skill Level

 

Responsibilities:

  • Lead all carpentry and site work; including framing, trim carpentry, window & door installation and steel/wood beam installation
  • Lead window & door installation
  • Help strategize and design steel installation
  • Supervise sub-trades on site to ensure they perform their work appropriately & correctly
  • Anticipate problems/issues and work with PM and trades to come up with solutions
  • Strategize carpentry deadlines to fulfill the Project Schedule
  • Ensure everything is built to the SevernWoods quality standards
  • Ensuring site staff have the tools & equipment they need to complete tasks effectively
  • Use Buildertrend to create PO’s, keep track of Budget & Schedule
  • Use Buildertrend to upload pictures and documents as well as input Daily Logs
  • Daily communication with the PM and participate in weekly Production Meetings
  • Hold yourself and others to the highest quality standards
  • Maintain a thoughtful approach to sustainability and energy efficiency on the project
  • Be available during work hours to answer questions from anyone on site

 

Company Highlights:

  • Join our amazing team of talented people and work as a team on interesting projects!
  • Profit Sharing Program!
  • 2 weeks paid Vacation per year!
  • Yearly Company Retreat!
  • Employee of the Quarter awards & lunch!
  • Paid Training/Learning/Skill Development opportunities!
  • Opportunity to grow into site Supervisor & Project Manager Roles!
  • Great Work/Life balance (no evenings or weekend work)!

title: Carpenter (UVic)
description:
Kinetic Construction provides Construction Manager and General Contracting services on Vancouver Island and the Lower Mainland. “Together Building Better” is who we are, in our day to day these values operationalize as “Relationships, Passion and Continuous Improvement”. Kinetic provides a variety of project delivery methods to complete large commercial, institutional, and multi-unit residential projects for private and public clientele. The organization is 100% employee owned with offices in Victoria, Vancouver, and Courtenay. We collaborate with like-minded partners to create a better industry for everyone.

Our people are the most important factor to our shared success. We provide a collaborative, caring culture, and the necessary support for everyone to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you see yourself as a continuous learner, curious and driven to succeed as a team we want you to be part of our team.

Kinetic Construction Ltd. has an opportunity at our UVic site to bring in an experienced Carpenters.

  • Minimum 5 years’ construction experience on a variety of projects including specifically working on commercial and institutional sites
  • Red Seal Carpenter’s ticket, be actively engaged in Carpentry Apprentice program, or interest in apprenticeship (all levels of Carpentry experience welcome)
  • Ability to work within a collaborative team atmosphere
  • Excellent Blueprint reading skills and the ability to work in both Metric and Imperial concrete formwork and framing
  • Clear verbal and written communication skills

Key Attributes:

  • Teamwork: Collaborates and proactively assists and involves others
  • Passion: Inspired to meet and exceed goals both individually and as a team
  • Respect: Contributes to a positive working environment
  • Excellence: Consistently challenges the status quo in the spirit of continuous improvement
  • Integrity: Accountable and transparent; ethical and fair
  • Community Minded: Actively involved in the communities in which we live and work

Together Building Better:

  • 100% employee owned
  • Competitive compensation and bonus
  • Strong benefits package
  • Substantial vacation time
  • Stable work-life balance
  • Training, education, and development opportunities
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Supportive culture
  • A healthy and positive work environment
  • Perks through our strategic partners

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected to move forward in the application process will be contacted. No phone calls please.

title: Labourer I Bolton, ON
description:
Metrie remains open as an essential business in Bolton to serve our communities as a supplier of home improvement and construction products, and we are looking for motivated individuals like YOU to join our team.

COVID-19 Note: At Metrie, we are committed to the health and safety of our team members and are following health authority recommendations in practicing regular cleaning procedures and enforcing social distancing at our facility.

Who We Are

At Metrie, we pride ourselves on our commitment to our team members! We like to have fun and we pride in our mission to turn "houses into homes" and to create beautiful interior spaces.

We offer:

  • Competitive wages and benefits
  • RRSP matching program
  • A clean and safe indoor work environment
  • Training and opportunity for advancement
  • Outstanding team support

Positions Available:

Moulder Operator - $18.60-22.50/Hour

  • Weekday Day Shift: Monday – Thursday, 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM (4 Days – 10 Hours)
  • Weekday Night Shift: Monday – Thursday, 5:00 PM to 4:00 AM ) (4 Days – 10 Hours)

Raw Line Operator - $18-20/Hour

  • Weekend Day Shift: Friday – Sunday, 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM (3 Days – 12 hours)
  • Weekday Night Shift: Monday – Thursday, 5:00 PM to 4:00 AM (4 Days – 10 Hours)

Saw Operator - $17.60-20.15/Hour

  • Weekday Day Shift: Monday – Thursday, 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM (4 days – 10 Hours)

Tool Room Operator - $18-20/Hour

  • Weekend Day Shift: Friday – Sunday, 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM (3 Days – 12 Hour)

Who You Are

We will provide in-house training to help you be successful in this role! No experience is necessary.

You are an ideal candidate if you:

  • Are reliable and able to commit to the work schedule
  • Have a positive attitude and are respectful towards your team members
  • Are able to follow instructions to ensure safety of yourself and others in the workplace
  • Are capable of performing physically demanding work
  • Warehouse or construction background preferred

title: General Laborer
description:
We are looking for a capable and reliable general laborer to join our team. You’ll take direction from the project foreman to help prepare job sites, load and unload construction materials, remove debris, assist team members, and perform any other general labor needed to get the job done right. You should be great at following instructions, with a can-do attitude. If you’re looking for good pay, flexible hours, and a job you can take pride in that lets you do something different every day, apply now!Compensation:

45000 - 60000 yearly

Responsibilities:
  • Follow all health and safety guidelines to ensure you and your team members are free from injury
  • Load, unload and prepare any tools or materials on site that will be used to complete the build, so the crew can operate efficiently
  • Work with your crew through all stages of the project to make sure that the job is done efficiently
  • Ensure that all materials, tools and other debris from the build have been removed at the end of the project to make sure the work site is clean
  • Clear away any trash, debris, or hazardous materials to prep the site before construction begins
Qualifications:
  • Our crew members must be physically able to do the work with reliable hand-eye coordination and balance
  • Should have general knowledge of building and construction, but we are willing to provide training
  • High school diploma or GED preferred
  • Must be able to take direction, work well independently and as part of a team for efficiency and productivity
  • Candidates who have experience using construction equipment such as forklift, power tools, and hand tools highly preferred
About Company

Canadian Elite Renovation has been in business for the past decade. We are one of the biggest reglazing groups in Ontario, while we have amazing spray painters we are always open to expanding and bringing on new talent on board.

title: Labourer (Layout Person)
description:
Tuesday, July 6, 2021

We are currently hiring for a full-time permanent Labourer (Layout Person) to join our growing Fabrication Team. We offer competitive wages, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities to further develop your skillset and grow your career.

Job Description:

  • Follow all safety procedures.
  • Operate band saws, ironworker, radial drill, grinder, and overhead cranes.
  • Perform proper setup of machines.
  • Perform Preventative Maintenance on machines.
  • Translate drawings into measurements for production.
  • Produce quality parts.
  • Mark out holes in Beam/channel/ angle/ plate.
  • Tack small mounts and leave for welders.

Qualifications:

  • Able to read a metric tape measure.
  • Good work ethic.
  • Positive attitude.
  • Steel Fabrication experience is an asset, but we are willing to train the ideal candidate.

At WesTower Communications Ltd. you can expect to be treated fairly. We recognize that it is our people who drive the success of our business, so we make it our priority to foster inclusive work environments welcomed to diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to accommodating prospective employees. We proudly offer a drug-free workplace with a zero-tolerance safety program.

title: Skilled Laborer (FT)
description:
Canadian Erosion and Containment is currently hiring full-time skilled laborers for the upcoming construction season. These positions will be based out of the Calgary with opportunity for travel to sites in Western Canada.

Responsibilities:
Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:
  • Assisting with the deployment of geosynthetic materials in the installation of Erosion Control Systems.
  •  Installation of erosion control measures, GCL Liners, Silt fence, Erosion Matting, Gabion Walls and Mattress, MSE walls, Wrap Slopes, Barb Wire fence, Radon Barriers, Drill seeding, and Hydroseeding.
Requirements:
  • Must have a valid Driver’s License and reliable vehicle.
  • Must have valid safety tickets: CSTS 09 WHMIS 2015. First aid and H2S Alive would be an asset
  • Must have PPE (steel toe boots, reflective vest, hard hat, safety glasses, gloves).
  • Must have a cell phone.
  • Previous industrial or construction experience.
  • Be able and willing to travel to remote locations and be away for extended periods of up to 24 days.
  • Availability to work up to 12 hours per day seven days a week.
  • Be adaptable to changing schedules.
  • Be comfortable working outdoors in various weather conditions.
  • Be comfortable working around heavy equipment.
  • Ability to lift to 50 pounds throughout the day.
  • Be a safety-focused individual.
  • Be able to successfully pass 8-panel pre-employment test as required for site-specific access.
Other details:
  • Rate of Pay: General Labourer position with opportunities for advancement within the company.
  • Paid Travel Time & Per Diems (daily food allowance) and hotels or camp provided for out-of-town work.
  • Accommodations, transportation, and travel time paid while on remote job sites.
  • Pay to be negotiated
  • Job Type: Full-time, temporary, Permanent

Local to Greater Victoria area preferred

CASMAN'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES:

Pension matching plan

Comprehensive Benefits, 50% premium paid

Compulsory life & disability insurance

Health & Dental coverage

Please contact (text or call) Jamie Sanderson at 250-812-0370

title: Labourer
description:
Casman Projects (B.C.) is seeking experienced Labourers in the greater Victoria area, initially close to downtown. Duties to include general labour, clean up and related tasks on construction projects. Applicants must be safety conscious, physically fit, able to lift up to 25 kg (50 lb), and able to work in a variety of indoor and outdoor settings.

Candidates with experience are preferred. 

Local to Greater Victoria area preferred.

CASMAN'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES: 

   Competitive wages ($21.00-$23.00 starting)

   Pension matching plan 

   Comprehensive Benefits, 50% premium paid 

        Compulsory life & disability insurance 

        Health & Dental coverage 

Casman welcomes all applications, and we thank you for your interest in our group. Only applicants of interest will be contacted.

Please contact Jamie Sanderson for more information at 250-812-0370

title: Painter/Drywall Installer
description:
The Byng Group is a leading interior renovation general contractor with more than 50 years' experience and a team of over 500, specializing in high-rise rental properties.


We are currently hiring Painter/drywaller installers throughout the Belleville, Kingston and Peterborough area to join our growing team!

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Paint walls, ceilings, doors, hallways, shelving in Apartment Units
  • Prepares surfaces to be plastered
  • Fills in nicks and cuts in ceilings, walls, and partitions using plaster
  • Repair walls with drywall
  • Sand areas after each coat making drywall paint-ready
  • Drywall Repairs, Taping and Plastering
  • Drywall Installation is considered an asset
  • Framing with Metal Studs considered an asset

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • At least 3 yearsâ€™ experience as a painter and drywaller
  • Valid Ontario Driver's License with a clean Driverâ€™s Abstract
  • Able to problem solve on-site and off-site
  • Ability to follow and complete a daily, weekly & monthly task schedule
  • Own Tools Required. They are not supplied.

WHY CHOOSE US!

  • Annual Bonus
  • Company Events
  • Supportive Team Atmosphere

SALARY

  • Earn up to $30.00 - $40.00 per hour, rate is based on skillset and performance 

#B

title: Drywall Finisher/painter
company: Handyman Connection of Metro Vancouver, BC
description:
To meet the demands of our rapidly growing base of satisfied customers, Handyman Connection of Metro Vancouver, BC is seeking an experienced Drywall Finisher.  This skilled craftsman would ideally have a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work.  Our customers love us!  We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

 

What You Will Receive

  • Receiving constant leads that can be scheduled based on your availability
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers

Responsibilities

 

The Drywall Finisher performs and coordinates the cutting, taping, sanding and installation of drywall during the construction, remodeling or repair in a residential and light commercial setting. The candidate must be proficient working with all drywall hand tools, mechanical tools required to complete their work. You must have experience as a Drywall Finisher, and you must have a positive attitude.

 

·        Ability to texture and refinish plaster services

·        Ability and willing to work on new walls and ceilings, and repair existing walls.

·        Ability to determine and clearly identify proper materials and material quantities for new and existing projects.

·        Evaluate customer requests, price projects, troubleshoot customer issues, and present a description of a work order to a customer.

 

Requirements

 

·        Must have current Driver's License and submit to a background check

·        Must have tools, vehicle and good references

·        Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades

·        Independent Contractors must carry liability insurance and workers comp

·        Must pass screening process

·        Must have a smart phone and access to the internet

 

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.

Check out our website at: www.handymanconnection.com

title: Drywall/Painter
description:
First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Drywall / Painter to help rebuild homes and businesses for our residential and commercial customers after fire or flood emergencies. Do you have previous experience in restoration or construction? Are you looking to build a successful career while rebuilding lives? If so, keep reading!

Our experienced Drywall / Painter earns a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

Position Summary:


The Drywall / Painter has knowledge of materials, methods and the tools involved in the construction or repair of houses, buildings, or other structures and builds, applies, or fastens interior and exterior wallboards or wall coverings in residential, commercial, and other structures.

Responsibilities:

  • Measures and installs drywall panels to accommodate electrical outlets, air-conditioning units, and plumbing.
  • Possesses skills with power and non-power tools to saw, drill, or cut holes in panels.
  • Installs blanket insulation between studs and tacks plastic moisture barrier over insulation.
  • Removes plaster, drywall, or paneling, using crowbar and hammer.
  • Assembles and installs metal framing and decorative trim for windows, doorways, and vents.
  • Reads blueprints and other specifications to determine method of installation, work procedures, and material and tool requirements.
  • Lays out reference lines and points, computing position of framing and marking position.
  • Installs horizontal and vertical metal or wooden studs for attachment of wallboard on interior walls.
  • Estimates the number of materials needed to complete a job and the length of time needed to complete the job.

Additional Requirements

  • Minimum 1 year of drywall and painting experience.
  • Courses or certifications from trade schools or equivalent experience.
  • Knowledge of materials, methods, and the tools involved in the construction or repair of houses, buildings, or other structures
  • Ability to pass a background check
  • Valid drivers' license
  • Availability for scheduled on-call and after-hour shifts

Are you able to work independently? Do you have excellent communication and interpersonal skills? Can you work collaboratively with construction crews? Are you service-oriented? Is safety important to you? Do you project a professional appearance and attitude? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Labour Worker
description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE Gold’s Gym British Columbia is hiring a labour worker, with potential to grow! Are you hard working, a good team player, with a passion for fitness? We would love to hear from you!

About Gold’s GymGold’s Gym has been the authority on fitness since 1965. It was then that fitness legend Joe Gold took the knowledge and expertise he gained from training at the world famous “Muscle Beach” and opened up the first Gold’s Gym on Pacific Avenue in Venice, California. At Gold’s Gym, our goal is simple: We’re here to help you Know Your Own Strength®. We are committed to helping people find their inner strength and reach their goals.

Key Responsibilities
  • Basic maintenance work (moving equipment, driving parts, manual labour, painting, general maintenance)
  • Assist in gym maintenance at 4 lower mainland locations (Port Coquitlam, Langley, West Broadway, University Market Place)
  • Assist in general equipment repair
Qualifications
  • Must be able to move and carry up to 50lbs 
  • Drivers License and vehicle 
  • No prior experience is required but it is an asset 
What We Offer
  • Positive, rewarding, and collaborative team environment
  • Competitive compensation
  • Complimentary club membership
  • Discount on Gold’s Gym products and services
NOTE: This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.Gold’s Gym British Columbia is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at https://goldsgymbc.ca/Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.

title: Labourer
description:
Are you looking for long term employment with a proven employer? As a member of the FBL team you will enjoy many career advancement opportunities such as development training, career growth, and promotional opportunities from within.

Forbes Brothers Ltd, OA FB Bullet is looking for qualified individuals to join our growing team in SURREY BC. Specializing in underground utility construction FB Bullet offers a competitive compensation package, benefits and pension contribution.


Civil Labourer

The ideal candidate will either have previous experience as a Construction Labourer or seeks the opportunity to join our growing team and advance their knowledge and skill base. The role of Civil Labourer will be responsible to report to the Crew Leader and execute the day-to-day activities of their crew. As a valued member of our team, you will be able to support and take instructions from crew members with assigned duties to gain and improve efficiencies.

Responsibilities:

  • Receive duties, delegations from the Crew Leader, and assist crew members execute these tasks
  • Work closely with all crew members, and learn the construction industry standards
  • Complete installation of conduit and other utility infrastructure with crew members
  • Work on tight timeline power outage worksites
  • Assist in maintaining a clean and organized work site
  • Able to problem solve through coordination with Crew Leader
  • Ensure quality of work meets or exceeds expectations
  • Complete daily pre-trip inspections on company equipment/vehicles
  • Participate and engage in daily Tailboard meetings, identify hazards and assist in crew compliance to safety policies and regulations
  • Work with construction equipment such as compactors, shoring, core drills, various hand tools
  • Ensure all small tools assigned to crew are cleaned, stored and maintained properly
  • Work closely with Crew Leader/Lead Hand to install conduit per specifications to correct grades/elevations
  • Assist drivers and vehicles navigate through busy work sites via proper hand signals and guidance

Schedule:

  • Due to the demand of our workload, all crews are scheduled Monday-Friday with the opportunity for weekend work quite frequently. Nightshift work is also scheduled on a less frequent basis
  • All shifts are scheduled for 8-10 hours, and due to the type of work we perform can extend past that
  • Daily overtime/double time is offered in all FB positions

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid Class 5 driver's licence, Class 1 or 3 preferred
  • Preferred experience in underground utility construction, hydro/telecommunications considered an asset
  • Physically fit and able to provide hands on assistance to crew members
  • Must be safety orientated
  • Ability to take and execute instructions and duties assigned to you
  • Lead by example attitude
  • Existing knowledge of WorkSafeBC standards and policies is an asset for this position

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: General Labour
description:
A CAREER OPPORTUNITY IN BARRIE

ASSEMBLERS NEEDED!

Monday to Friday
Days or Afternoons... you choose!
$18.50/hr to start!
On Bus route

Details:

• Days $18.50 hrly 7am - 3pm
• Afternoons - $19.50/hr 3:30pm - 11:30pm Monday to Friday
• Overtime after 40 hours
• Experienced working with tools, hand and power
• Read drawings
• Team worker
• On bus route

Please apply online at www.randstad.ca and then call the branch at 705-735-1106.



Advantages
• Work Monday - Friday + overtime
• Welcoming company
• Lots of room for growth
• On Bus Route
• Opportunity to be hired on permanent
• Once hired on - RRSP match program starting Jan. 1 2022
• Full benefits, paid vacation, & 3 PTO days

Responsibilities
• Duties include putting small assemblies together with nuts and bolts utilizing wrenches, sockets and hand drills
• Must be able to read drawings
• Comfortable using hand tools - wrenches, sockets, drills
• Building metal parts to be shipped

Qualifications
• Comfortable using large variety of hand tools
• Manufacturing experience
• Able to read drawings
• Eye for detail
• Reliable transportation

Summary
Please apply online at www.randstad.ca and then call the branch at 705-735-1106.
Please keep in mind we have a referral bonus program for anyone we find a placement for both permanent and temporary.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Carpenter
description:
First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Carpenter to help rebuild homes and businesses for our residential and commercial customers after fire or flood emergencies. Do you have previous experience in restoration or construction? Are you looking to build a successful career while rebuilding lives? If so, keep reading!

Our experienced Carpenter earns a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A CARPENTER

You are focused on bringing back homes and businesses to their former beauty. Your attention to detail and passion for construction assists you in delivering superior quality work to your customers. Whether repairing a roof, or installing a cabinet you consistently demonstrate skill in the safe operation of tools. Your ability to oversee laborers ensuring that the quality standards of the company are being met and as well as your knowledge of materials, methods and the tools involved in the construction or repair of residential & commercial buildings, and other structures will set you up for success in this role

Your excellent communication skills assist you as you work collaboratively with construction crews. Health and safety are important to you which is why you respect all policies and procedures and ensure that they are followed by other employees and subcontractors. You are a get-it-done person who likes to be active and isn't afraid to jump right in and make things happen. You take pride in your work and feel good about being able to restore order for people in our community while helping us build a loyal customer base!

QUALIFICATIONS

  • At least 3 years of experience in the carpenter in the construction or restoration industry
  • Ability to pass a background check
  • Valid drivers' license
  • Availability for scheduled on-call and after-hour shifts

Are you able to work independently? Do you have excellent communication and interpersonal skills? Can you work collaboratively with construction crews? Are you service-oriented? Is safety important to you? Do you project a professional appearance and attitude? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: General Labourer
description:
Our General Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!


Position Summary:

The General Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead, and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross-contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers, and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Labourer (Vancouver Island)
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Labourer is required to perform tasks involving physical labour at commercial construction projects, and to operate a variety of hand and power tools.

Qualifications

  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools
  • Minimum of 1 year previous construction labour experience preferred
  • Knowledge of workplace safety, and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Knowledge of First Aid and CPR preferred
  • Valid Drivers License and clean abstract preferred
  • Out of town work may be required. Work in all weather conditions.

 



Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

The carpenter is responsible for constructing and maintaining buildings.

Required knowledge includes: construction and remodeling trades, practices, procedures, techniques, tools and equipment, materials, specifications, quality control, cost control and safety.

The carpenter must be proficient at the following tasks: hanging doors, drilling and setting door hardware, setting windows, layout for stairs and common rafters, formwork, and reading blueprints. The carpenter must also possess the mathematical and analytical skills necessary to do materials estimates.

  • Ticketed Journeyperson Carpenter
  • Experienced with a large general contractor
  • Valid drivers license and clean drivers abstract preferred
  • Must be able to successfully pass criminal record check

But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.', 'Educational assistance\xa0for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education']

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM RECYCLING?

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, Canada, AIM is a private company with multiple sites located in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe and Asia. Recognized as a world leader in metal recycling and solder manufacturing for a broad range of industries, we focus on creating high-quality products, setting AIM apart. Our continually expanding company offers many exciting career opportunities, a stimulating work environment, competitive salaries and an excellent employee benefits program.

Job Description

American Iron & Metal, a Hamilton based Metal Recycling Yard has an opening for an enthusiastic individual to fill a General Labourer position at our Timmins Metal Recycling Operation. 

Duties Will Include: 

  • Working inside our warehouse on a metal recycling production line 
  • Sorting, picking, and processing metal pieces 
  • Cleaning your work area at the end of your shift 
  • Other general labour duties will apply 
Qualifications

 

  • Experience working on an assembly line 
  • Previous recycling experience is considered an asset 
  • Must be able to stand and walk for long periods of time 
  • Must be able to lift up-to 50lbs 
  • Must be able to work independently as well as in a team orientated environment 
  • Ability to work in a loud, dusty environment 

 



Additional Information

We Offer: 

  • Full time hours with potential overtime, paid after 44 hours 
  • Some mandatory overtime on Saturdays (based on company needs) 
  • Competitive wages, pension, benefits offered 

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. The masculine form is used solely to make the text easier to read. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Construction Labourers (Swift Current, SK)
description:
At Golderado, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values.

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following: Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials; move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris) Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites Prepare and clean up construction sites, move materials and equipment, and perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial construction experience and must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS 09) Certificate, WHMIS 2015, Ground Disturbance (Original tickets required), Standard First Aid considered an asset.
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack) You are able to lift up to 13.5 kg (30 lbs) 9-23 Kg You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required
  • Drug and Alcohol Screening as well as Criminal Background Check Required.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it! Apply today at resumes@pmeinc.com We are an equal opportunity employer. While only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview, be sure to continually

Please note, there is NO TRAVEL or LIVING ALLOWANCE for this project.

title: Summer Student - General Labour (Burlington)
description:
JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is looking for Summer Students to join our teams in Burlington, ON!

Formerly Cogent Power Inc., JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is under new management.

While we appreciate all applicants, we will only be contacting those selected for an interview.

This position is located in Burlington, Ontario.

We have two facilities located on 801 & 845 Laurentian Drive, L7N 3W7 (Conveniently located by bus route) 

Salary: $18.12 an hour 

Hours: This position will be on a straight day shift from 7 am to 3 pm Monday to Friday. 

Position Type: Summer Contract, 4-month period (flexible). 

The Perks:

  • Travel Subsidy:
    • Starting April to September 2022 we will be providing a subsidy to all employees that incur the costs of travelling to work. These subsidies will be provided at the end of the month in the form of a gas card (i.e April subsidy will be provided by mid-May).
    • For those who take a city bus to work, we will be providing a transit pass.  
  • Perkopolis Account - get access to 5000 exclusive online discounts to stores & sports events (Hello Fresh, Apple, Indigo, Toronto Marlies, Toronto Raptors, etc.)
  • $100 Coverage on CSA-Approved Safety Boots
  • Summer Gatorade Program (Free Gatorades over the summer term)

As a Summer Student, you will be working in one of these Departments:

Wound Core Department: 

  • Receiving and inspecting incoming slit steels, assuring that they are correct for the intended order
  • Issue materials to work orders accurately and correctly on both paperwork order, and through the visual software system
  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures.
  • Produce distributed gap cores
  • Ensure product meets quality requirements as per work order, operating procedures and customers specifications
  • Follow priority schedule

Stacked Core Department:

  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures.
  • Material stacking into a repeating specific pattern
  • Ability to follow detailed prints & procedures to create the finished product
  • Work in a team environment ensuring group success
  • Issue materials to work orders accurately and correctly

About you, simply stated:

  • Ability to follow health & safety policies
  • Strong measuring skills 
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • An eagerness to learn and dedication to improvement 
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Organized

Requirements: 

  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Must be able to show proof of enrolment at a post-secondary college or university
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada with a valid Social Insurance Number
  • Students on Visa's welcome to apply 

(Must be 18 years of age or older - students from all levels are welcome to apply. Training for your first two weeks is paid).

About JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc:

On September 20th, 2019, JFE Shoji Trade Corporation acquired 100% of the shares of Cogent Power Inc, from Tata Steel Europe. Grouped, the Cogent and JFE Shoji Steel America business make it possible for JFE Shoji to capture greater market share in the electrical steel market for both transformer and automotive products. The combination of Cogent and JFE Shoji has become one of the largest processors of electrical steel transformers in the world. JFE Shoji currently has many other production and processing facilities throughout Asia, as well as a facility in Tijuana, Mexico.

Globally, JFE Shoji enhanced the businessâ€™ competitiveness by sharing and integrating technical skills with deep business experience, which can be strongly applied to the global and North American markets. With this investment, JFE Shoji has one of the worldâ€™s leading processing and distribution functions for core design and manufacturing for transformers.

Based in Tokyo, JFE is one of the worldâ€™s largest steel producers with over 45,000 employees and operations globally. 

If you would like to be considered, please apply in confidence. For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

Job Type: Summer, Contract, Students

Salary: $18.12 an hour

#JFEHP

title: STUDENT SUMMER JOB - GENERAL LABOURERS
description:
Company Description

ABOUT EACOM

At EACOM, we transform more than wood. Our talented team of 1,100 employees is committed to working, building, and growing together. Embedded in northern Ontario and Quebec communities, our mills have a long, rich history. We responsibly manage and transform forest resources into high-quality wood products. From the Canadian woodlands to the North American home building market, we strive for sustainability, collaboration, safety, and continuous improvement.

Job Description

EACOM – Nairn sawmill, a subsidiary of INTERFOR, is looking to fill SUMMER JOBS - GENERAL LABOURERS term positions in from May to August 2022.

JOIN THE TEAM!
Hourly rate: as per Collective Agreement

Reporting to the supervisor, you will be performing in various tasks related to production.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Rebuild and replenish packages of lumber that have spilled.
  • Perform housekeeping and cleaning, shovel and sweep shavings and chips and pick up broken pieces of lumber in the plant and in the yard as required.
  • Train on and replace on operating positions as needed.
  • Perform other related duties.

SKILLS PROFILE:

  • Team working skills.
  • Autonomy and initiative.
  • Exercise vigilance and adhere to all health/safety policies.
Qualifications

  • Be available to work day and/or night or weekend shifts as needed (flexible schedule).


Additional Information

At EACOM, we're here for you.

EACOM supports employment equity. Diversity is not only welcome, it’s encouraged! We’ll contact you if you are selected for an interview. If you need special accommodations, let us know. Any information you send us will be treated with respect and confidentiality. Gender diversity is also important. Know that women are definitely welcome!

title: Labourer
description:
Seymour Pacific Developments Ltd. is a national leader in land development and residential construction, and we are currently looking for Construction Labourers to perform a variety of construction-related duties at our multifamily site.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials
  • Move tools, equipment, and construction materials to and from work areas
  • Operate hand and power tools
  • Clean up rubble and debris on a regular basis to ensure a safe and well maintained construction site
  • Move and level earth using shovels and rakes
  • Clean, lubricate, and refill tanks as instructed
  • Practice work place safety at all time
  • Perform other duties as required

REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous experience in a related position
  • Positive can-do attitude
  • Willing and able to easily follow direction
  • Able to lift 50lbs
  • Willing and able to work long hours in a fast-pace, physical environment

 

WHY SEYMOUR PACIFIC?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.
